campaign.story:
Terror in the Toybox features six toy lines of the past that never were, created by six ground-breaking comic book creators, and published as trading cards and through a novella that reveals the full back-story of these toy lines.*
We address the "Satanic Panic" of the 1980s that "revealed" the evil and Satanic influences and power of toy lines like Masters of the Universe. The novella is the "last writing" of one Christian Goodfellow, who found that six children corrupted by old toys grew up to become the worst of the worst: comic book artists!*
*Total work of horror satire by the way. Just go with it.
The trading card set and book reveal the creator-owned "toys" that led each of our six artists to a life of drawing sub-literate comic books. 
Who are the worst people in the world?
Comic book artists, that's who! This trading card set gives you their most depraved original visions as they create the toy lines that "created" them.
It all started in their childhoods, through toys that encouraged false idols in plastic form. Terror in the Toybox takes aim at the root of these depraved comic book “artists” by revealing the toys that turned them to their life of sin in both a trading card set and a revealing book.
The Trading Cards
I reached out to six of my favorite creators who, I'm lucky to say, I can also consider friends. The challenge was to design the most subversive toy from their childhood, the one that led them to a life of comic book-ing!
Terry Huddleston preaches the evil of comic books on the "convention circuit," where converts and sycophants flock to meet their artist "heroes". It's like Black Mass for the hordes of frothing fanatics. Instead of a soapbox, Huddleston's podium is his booth of drawings that he sells on the unsuspecting converts. Major Damage is a corruption of the military, fusing it with the power of arcane musclemen,  and promising to do damage to your soul!
Reilly Brown took a depraved existence full of He-Man cartoons and brought his squandered talents to draw the sinful Deadpool for Marvel Comics. He created his own obscene avatar of online hatred called Outrage (with writer Fabian Nicieza, who has been corrupting the minds of comic book readers since the 1990s), where he preaches his absurd art. God did not mean for man to be cross-hatched!
Tim Seeley presents the Socialist Satanist Sorceresses, which explain how and why he's now managing editor of Heavy Metal Magazine, and writer of that obscene book Money Shot.
Dani Strips was turned to a life of fantasy and comic books with the Forever Pony, Brimstone, who requires children to sign a "Forever Pledge" of loyalty in red ink. It's part of what led her to draw subversive and dark horror comic books Coffin Bound and The Low, Low Woods.
Jeffrey Brown's moral decay started with G.O.A.T.s, the Guardians of Alternate Terra! These cloven-hooved goat people led Brown to talk about his checkered past through autobiographical "graphic novels" like Clumsy, or his ode to broken toy lines with The Incredible Change-Bots.
Peter Bagge reared his demented head in the late 1970s in the alternative comix scene, working with purveyor of obscenity Robert Crumb on Weirdo. Bagge revealed elements of his troubled life through his too-long running comic book Hate! He has done so many more corrupting comics, and it all starts with his disgust with patriotic rodent Ratatat-Rat!
The Book
After writing the character descriptions for the card, I realized there still needed to be more storytelling. Glutton for punishment that I am, I got to work on the tell-all book that documents the downfall of an anti-toy crusader, Christian Goodfellow, as he investigated the toys from the trading card pack.
What you are about to read will undoubtedly shock you.
These are the works of advocate and decency activist Christian Goodfellow in his study of the arcane, insidious, and corrupting influence of children’s toys that are tools of Satan, created and perpetrated by Godless factories of Paganism disguised as corporate toy companies. His early studies in the so-called “Satanic Panic” of the 1980s led him to ask one fateful--and fatal--question:
“What ever happened to those youths caught in the evil grasp of these toys of the past?”
The answer is disturbing, to say the least.
Evil toys of the past created a network of people so corrupted by them that they became the prophets of such horror. It became their job to perpetuate the vile gospel of these “innocent” childrens’ toys.
They became comic book artists, and the work they create right now conveys nothing less than sacrilege to warp the minds of today’s youth.
This book is the final legacy of Christian Goodfellow.
The Heavy Metal level features all six cards reproduced on durable white metal. You can also, if you really need, individually order them as add-ons.
Now, spread the word, and help us let the world know that true delinquency starts--in the Toybox!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This luckily ain't my first trading card rodeo! I'm working with tried and true resources to print these evil cards and the book up. However, I will keep in touch and update you if there are any weird things that happen, such as demonic possession or the cards getting dragged and lost in the eighth ring of Heck.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, all!
After getting the big ol' massive Madman campaign out the door, I managed to pack everyone's Terror levels. I'm still waiting on the metal cards for that level, but they should be arriving soon.
The hope is to get these out in the next couple of days, as I get those surveys in. I can't wait to hear your thoughts!

C

updates.update_userinfo: Most levels are packed, and surveys are out!
updates.update_content:
In about a week, I have all of the trading cards and extras en route from their printer AND I just ordered the book last night, which should get it here by the weekend. The only thing still out there are the metal cards, which I hope to have an answer on soon. Can't wait for you guys to get your mitts on this! It's a quirky and fun project!
C

updates.update_userinfo: Book is on its way here!
updates.update_content:
I just sent the book for approval at press; once that's done (hopefully in a couple days, max), I can send it to press. I've gotten it back in a relatively quick time before, so let's hope that's the case!
Tomorrow, I'm going to confirm the metal cards that I sent off; those may take a bit longer, depending on my resource's workload. Either way, we're on track to get these babies out to you within the month!

updates.update_userinfo: This one is turning around quick
updates.update_content:
And, we're funded! Thanks for being the brave souls willing to embark on me with this intermedia journey! And do I have a surprise for you: I'm going to print the cards and book up before funds arrive, in advance! I'm also looking into sticker pricing and what the best format would be! I don't want to leave any of these out!
So, stay tuned, and thanks so much for being part of this. It's a really personal project on me, which was ultimately a big excuse to work with six of my favorite folks in comics!

We are really close to the stretch goal with only two days left! 
I would like to run something by you: I'm looking at a larger print run for the wrapper (500). Since we have a tight number of backers, I'm happy with the wrapper, or I can produce a smaller print run and use that extra money for stickers, post cards, buttons and other swag? I'll leave it up to you!!!!

This is such a weird, off-the-wall, high concept project, that I'd love to see everyone consume it! We're super close to our stretch goal of a wrapper and, after that, I plan on unleashing everything from stickers to "reproductions" of toy packaging.

Let's make it happen!! Please help me get the word out and the backers up! We can do this!
Best, Chris

project_data.project_name: Terror in the Toybox Book and Trading Cards

campaign.story:
Madness has found us...
Hello again fellow adventurers, I wish my news wasn't so dire.  You may remember me from my work on Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs comic book series and trading cards. After the success of our first 2 campaigns, I knew this was a place where our findings could be taken seriously. 
While working on research for Prehistoria, at the Mistview Museum, my colleagues and I uncovered something... Sinister. We immediately decided to shift focus and get this set of cards containing information about these terrifying creatures out  to the world. Chris and I have been able to maintain contact after our terrifying findings, as for our other colleagues... I pray for their safety should they still be of this earth. 
This is where we need your help again Adventurers. We can't get these cards out to the world without your help. The more we funding we receive the more of these creatures will be revealed to the world. We have done it twice, and I believe we can do it again. Please adventurers, the fate of the world could be in your hands...
THE EXHIBITS:
In this campaign we are looking to fund as many Crypto-Terra: Myths and Monsters cards as possible, for you own protection as to what lurks in the darkest corners of the globe. There are 5 sets in total, and of course the infamous Dragon . Each of the sets contains 10 premium quality cards, that feature information about their featured Crypto on the back of the card. The Cryptids in the first offering are:
Set #1- Loch Ness Monster, Bigfoot, Jersey Devil, Mothman, Bunyip, Kraken, Ogopogo, Chupacabra, Skunk Ape, and Yeti.
Set #1
OUR GIFT TO YOU:
Because, you the backers are an incredible bunch, we are adding this handsome promo card free to all pledged levels! Thank you all for your wonderful support.
Beast of Bodmin Moor Promo! Free for all backers!
STRETCH GOALS:
Should we surpass our initial goal, there is an opportunity for stretch goals to be unlocked and added to your pledge, free of charge!!! So the more people who back, the more you could get.
$800 - Unlocked - Set #2 - Thunderbird, Emela-Ntouke, Nandi Bear, Ri, Mongolian Death Worm, Ahool, Werewolf, Dobhar-Chu, Black Shuck, and Gremlins.
Set #2 in full
$1200 - Unlocked -  Set #3 - Wendigo, Beast of Bray Road, Mapinguari, Grootslang, Phaya Naga, Loveland Frogman, Madagascar Tree, Matorepo Wera, Toronto Tunnel Monster, and Dover Demon.
Card Set #3
$1600 - Unlocked - Set #4 - Silver Cat, Jackalope, Ropen, Leviathan, Mahamba, Tsuchinoko, Enfield Horror, Cactus Cat, Pal Rai Yuk, and Tokoloshe.
$2000 - Unlocked - Set #5 - Mamlambo, Ucumar, Mokèlé-mbèmbé, Kikiyaon, Lee County Lizard man, Fresno Nightcrawler, Sewer Alligator, Hrökkáll, Ozark Howler, and Hoop Snake.
$2400- Unlocked- Crypto-Terra Expert Acrylic Badge
$4000- Unlocked- Kickstarter exclusive Comic Book issue- Linking Crypto-Terra and Prehistoria!
ADD-ONS:
 Prehistoria Promo Set - $5 - Ammonite, Brachiosaurus, Masiakasaurus,  and Rapetosaurus.
Over the course of Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs history, we have produced a small amount of promo cards for the set. These cards have highlighted feature Dinosaurs, and even given some hints in what is to come for the Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs Comic World. While these cards are not exclusive, they are harder to find usually only being at special events. We want to give all of you a chance to add these beauties to your collection! All you need to do is add $5 per promo pack to your pledge, and let us know how many you ordered during the survey.
Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaur Promo Cards 1-4
Crypto-Terra T-Shirt- $30 - For those of you who require an extra T-shirt for yourself or a loved one. The Shirt Color options are Heather Blue Navy and Heather Purple. Both of which are a 70/30 cotton & polyester blend. Sizes range in Adult S-3XL.
T-shirts come in Heather Blue Navy or Heather Purple
Crypto-Terra Sticker- $3- Perfect conversation starter to share your knowledge about what lurks in the worlds darkest corners.
Crypt-Terra Logo Sticker
Signed Prints- Choose your favorite Cryptid or Cryptids and  order them as a 8-1/4 x 11-3/4 print, signed by Chris Simmonds! The more you order, the cheaper they get!
1 Print- $20
2 Prints-$35
3 Prints- $45
5 Prints- $50

For more information you can find us at:
Main Page: https://www.mistviewmedia.com/
Prehistoria: https://www.facebook.com/Prehistoriacomicseries
Mistview Media: https://www.facebook.com/welcometomistview
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With this being our third kickstarter we have found a good rhythm to getting our projects out to the backers. That being said, with Covid-19 we never know what can happen. However I do feel the time window allows for us to get all the goals finished and out to you, our wonderful backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Adventurers,

I hope that you are all keeping well in this time. I have some exciting news for you. I have received majority of the product and will begin fulfilling the pledges  immediately. As a one man army, and having a very tight schedule with some of my other commitments (for the next 5 weeks), I will be tackling the pledges country by country. I will post new updates as to which countries have been sent in full. Very exciting times to be able to start getting these out! Also for those interested we will be launching a new kickstarter campaign on July 1st! While this one is focused on Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs issues 4 and 5, there will also be 15 new dinosaur trading cards added to series. Here is a link for stay in the loop: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ageofdinosaurs3/prehistoria-age-of-dinosaurs-issue-4-and-5

updates.update_userinfo: If you ordered Prints please read.
updates.update_content:
Hello Adventurers,

I am very pleased to say all the cards have arrived, and for the comic book we are only waiting on an ad and inner credits pages and it will be printer ready. I have also received the prints from Chris, but has a question. The Prints were ordered in a A5 size ( 5-7/8 x 8-1/4) as opposed to A4 ( 8-1/4 x 11-3/4). The prints are very high quality just a little smaller than previously mentioned. Are you guys okay with that or would you like them to be reordered in the A4 size, albeit they will be a little lacking in the same image quality due to formatting? Let me know your thoughts in the comments.

Hello Adventurers,

I hope you are all doing well, and keeping safe. Just wanted to give a small update on how everything it going so far. The comic book has been completed, and I have received majority of the cards and they have been sorted.  I think it is safe to say we are looking at a much sorter delivery time than October! Also We are gearing up for our next Kickstarter which will be launching in July. It will be for Prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs issue 4 and 5 as well as having new prehistoria: Age of Dinosaurs trading cards as part of the kickstarter. More on that as it unfolds.

Hello Adventurers,

I hope you are all keeping well. I have some great news for you all! Chris is only 2 pages away from finishing the 16 page comic that you all unlocked. I have to say that Chris really outdid himself, and it looks amazing. Things in the campaign are progressing rather quickly, as I have already received the shirts, badges, cards have shipped and now the book is almost done. So I wanted to speak to everyone that had ordered prints.

Hello Adventurers,

I hope you are all doing well. I have a little update for all of you. I have all the t-shirts in my possession, and the badges are on their way. Chris has finished the cover and first 4 pages of the comic. The introduction story will introducing Jackson Graves, who is our globetrotting paleontologist who seems to have a knack for finding trouble rather than fossils. Our story finds him crashing into the Himalayas where he makes an horrifying discovery, or does a horrifying discovery find him? Here is the badge and first page of the comic.

Hello Adventurers,

I wanted to apologize for a mistake I made in yesterdays update. I stated that the last card would finished for you all on friday, and I was incorrect. It's done NOW!!!! WOOOOOOO. The amazing Chris Simmonds never fails to work his tail off for the backers and he has sent me the last of the Cryptids for this series. 52/52, what a great feeling. I can now order all of the cards, and the sooner we get them the sooner we can send them! Thank you all again.

updates.update_userinfo: Your gonna want to read this...
updates.update_content:
Hello Adventurers,

I hope you all had a wonderful weekend. I got some more exciting news this morning! Chris sent over 2 more finished creatures bringing our total to 51/52. Only one lone beastie left, and he is thinking he will have it ready for friday... along with the badge!! What a week this will be.

Hello Adventurers,

It is another great day here at Mistview Media. Chris has sent me 3 new creatures, bringing our total up to 49/52 cards! We are almost there, and im looking forward to another week of Crypto-Terra: Myths and Monsters. I have also ordered set number 2 of the cards, leaving only set 1 and the remainder of set 5 to be ordered.

campaign.story:
HIDE YOUR BANANAS BOYS, HERE COMES
PSYCHO APE TRADING CARDS!
Here it IS! The RETRO Trading Card Series based on the GREATEST MOVIE EVER MADE ... by Addison Binek ... during a world-wide pandemic ... on a budget of almost nothing ...
PSYCHO APE the MOVIE:
It's a love story ... about the love between a weird 'teen girl' and a rampaging psychotic ape featuring the worst ape costume ever put on the screen. It's a detective story ... about a dedicated and driven sadistic 'detective', Dr. ZOOmis tracking down the psychotic ape over decades. It's a road trip story ... about Nancy Banana and Psycho Ape being chased through forests, escaping from prison, and up to the top of the Empire State Building. It's a special effects extravaganza galaxy spanning space opera with huge movie stars and... okay, it's not that. But it's all that other stuff!
PSYCHO APE the TRADING CARD SERIES:
From the publisher of such trading card classics as THE CHRONICLES OF THE THREE STOOGES, MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000, ZORRO, and MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE comes RRParksCARDS' GREATEST achievement yet (this month, anyway). This card series has it ALL:
- 45 CARD BASE SET with puzzle backs in classic 'retro-stalgic' style. With 36 FULL COLOR base cards telling the story of PSYCHO APE, followed by 8 super crisp Black and White cards of the epic battle between Psycho Ape and the entire US military, and ends with a full color card of Nancy Banana and Dr. ZOOmis starting a beautiful friendship. 
- BLOODY SUBSET featuring the blood and gore and 'poo' scenes of this cinematic masterpiece with the backs feature behind the scenes shots taken during the making of Psycho Ape. [card count in progress]
- SPECIALLY COMMISSIONED 3-CARD ART SET by E. Stoinich (artist on RRParksCARDS trading card series Chronicles of the Three Stooges and Manos: The Hands of Fate and 'Series Four' and the upcoming Ultraman Series One).
- SPECIALLY COMMISSIONED 3-CARD ART SET by Claudiu Macarie (artist on RRParksCARDS trading card series Chronicles of the Three Stooges, Sharknado, Quatermass and the Pit, Manos: The Hands of Fate, 'Series Four', Zorro 100th Anniversary, and the upcoming Ultraman Series One) PLUS a special limited edition KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE METAL card.
- 9 3D CARDS with FREE pair of 3D glasses, designed by Christian LeBlanc (MST3K, Zorro, Sharknado, 'Series Four' and MORE RRParksCARDS' productions).
- 1 LENTICULAR MOTION card ... perhaps the first trading card to ever show an ape getting leg-humped by a stray dog (certainly the first trading card to show it in MOTION!).
- 4 DIFFERENT PROMO CARDS, including 3 rare parallel promos.
- AUTOGRAPH cards from the writer, director, producer and co-star ADDISON BINEK ... PLUS Psycho Ape suit actor STEVE ALBERS!
- ORIGINAL ART SKETCH CARDS by some of the hobby's BIGGEST names such as (in no particular order) Marsha Parkins, Mai Irving, Amanda Pattison, James Dickson, Jeff Trax, Ashley Marsh, Bekki Sharp, Michael Mastermaker, Adam Everett Beck, Ross Pickerel, Jenni Gregory, Matt Stewart, Matthew Hirons, Lindsey Greyling ... these are the sketch card artists who have gotten in their sketch cards and are ON HAND. Other artists working on theirs as of this moment are Phillip Trujillo, Sammy Gomez, Junior Bruce, Brian Smith, Simone Arena, Angel Aviles, Arturo Ramirez, Dan Tearle, David Day, Floydman, Huy Truong, Ingrid Hardy, KiLynne Munoz, Jaime Hitchcock, Kevin P. West, Leon Braojos, and MORE! See? I TOLD you -- what a GREAT lineup of TALENT!
- STICKERS ... we're in the process of designing these
- SPECIAL CARD (we've never attempted this kind of card so more on this one later)
- LIMITED EDITION ETCHING CARDS by E. Stoinich.
- GENUINE MOVIE-USED RELIC CARD!

 Here's  a visual 'grand tour' of the series:    
36 (+1) Full Color Base Cards:
Four of the 36 full color base cards (there's a 37th that follows the 8 different BW cards)
8 HIGH CONTRAST Black and White Base Cards:
Three of the Black and White base cards
The BLOODY SUBSET!
Three of the bloody Subset cards (this subset will be at least nine cards ... maybe more, it is 'in progress')
Special 3-Card Portrait Art cards by E. Stoinich 
All 3 of the E. Stoinich Art Cards (backs show original sketch and final ink versions of the art on the front)
Macarie Limited Edition Portrait Cards and METAL card!
Continues the MACARIE tradition of The Three Stooges, Sharknado, MST3K, Quatermass, 'Series Four', Zorro ...
9 3D cards with 3D glasses!

The most INSANE Lenticular Motion card EVER CREATED!
Unable to show the actual motion effects... use your imagination!
Four different PROMO CARDS ... 1 common and 3 RARES
Some of the promo cards for Psycho Ape
Two different autograph cards!
Just a SAMPLE of the AMAZING Sketch Cards that have come in so for for PSYCHO APE 
And the REST is in design and final-touches creation phases ...
Genuine PRINTING PLATES
Printing plate clarity, of course, ranges ... these are just examples showing the 4 different colors
And HERE is the 
RETRO STYLE 'APE ATTACK RACK PACK MASTER SET ... 
... which comes with a FULL SET of everything (the Base Set, The Blood Subset, the 3D cards, The Macarie and Stoinich special/limited edition cards, the Lenticular Motion Card, all of the different Promo Cards, BOTH of the Autograph Cards, ONE sketch card, ONE genuine printing plate, FULL set of Stoinich Etching limited edition cards, FULL set of Stickers, the Relic Card ... plus 3D glasses, miniature authentic RUBBER GORILLA MASK, and to stabby 'foam' bananas with official PSYCHO APE logo branded across the front). Base set will be housed in the 'tuck box' you see. The entire Rack Pack is designed to have a 1970s/80s sort of appearance to it ... a 'Psycho Ape' PLAYSET with cards, stickers, and goofy extras. Only 95 of these will be produced! EVER!
And here's what the foam banana looks like up close ...
Can be used for safely stabbing your friends because it is make of squishy foam (but don't do it anyway)... Don't eat it or put in any other bodily orifices or wear it in your clothes to make you look more manly. Just set it on a counter and slowly back away from it... very slowly...
And here's what the tuck box and base set look like up close...
Okay, okay already ... HOW do I GET all this PSYCHOTIC STUFF???
We've got quite a few PLEDGE LEVELS ... to fit all budgets.

$2 PLEDGE LEVEL will get you ONE regular promo card

$5 PLEDGE LEVEL will get you all 4 promo cards 

$24 PLEDGE LEVEL will get you the 45-card BASE SET in tuck box and 1 promo card and 1 of the lenticular motion cards. What if you want a bit MORE? Well check out the next pledge level ...

$38 PLEDGE LEVEL will get you the DELUXE BASE SET ... that comes with the 45-card BASE SET in tuck box, all 4 promos, 1 lenticular motion card, the sticker set, the 3D card set and pair of 3D glasses AND the BLOODY SUBSET. What if you want a bit MORE for only $12 extra bucks? Check out the NEXT pledge level ...

$50 PLEDGE LEVEL will get your the DELUXE BASE SET (the $38 level) ... PLUS ONE SKETCH CARD, 1 Stoinich Card, and 1 Macarie Card.

"okay, okay... I see what you're doing... you're not fooling anyone... YOU are trying to inch me up to the MASTER SET level at some GREAT price where I get everything and just can't pass it up. I know YOU, RRParks ... so okay. What's in the MASTER SET and what's it gonna set me BACK?"

$68 PLEDGE LEVEL is... [drum roll, please] THE MASTER SET 'APE ATTACK RACK PACK'. And it includes EVERYTHING! The 45-card base set in tuck box, all 4 promos, the COMPLETE 3D card set with 3D glasses, COMPLETE Stoinich portrait set, COMPLETE Macarie limited edition portrait set, COMPLETE sticker set, COMPLETE Bloody Subset, the lenticular motion card, COMPLETE set of BOTH autograph cards, ONE original art Sketch Card, the Genuine Movie-Used Relic Card, ONE printing plate, TWO 'stabby' foam bananas, ONE miniature rubber ape mask, COMPLETE set of Stoinich Etching Cards, the in-progress Special Card ... With the Macarie, Stoinich, Bloody Subset, etc. in Wrapped and Sealed Packs. In other words... EVERYTHING! Oh... but WAIT... there's MORE! You get the limited edition Macarie METAL card, too!

$95 PLEDGE LEVEL ("What do you mean a $95 pledge level? At $68 I already got EVERYTHING!!! What's with this $95 level???") ... At this level you get the $68 'stuff' MASTER SET. But because perhaps you want to leave your Master Set intact and STILL enjoy the cards, this level includes the MASTER SET 'APE ATTACK RACK PACK' plus the $38 'Deluxe Base Set' stuff ... AND ONE EXTRA SKETCH CARD!

$100 PLEDGE LEVEL ... 'Dealer's BUNCH'. At $100 you get SIX of the tuck box base sets, 6 promos, and 6 of the lenticular motion cards. So at this level you get SIX TIMES the goodies listed in the $24 base set level.

$125 PLEDGE LEVEL ... simple. This is the DOUBLE MASTER level. You get the $68 pledge level stuff... DOUBLED. So you can open one 'Ape Attack Rack Pack' and leave the other intact (and with a production of only 95 total 'Ape Attack Rack Packs', sealed ones are gonna be excruciatingly RARE). 

ADD ONS:
If you want to ADD ON other pledge levels to whatever you're pledging on, you can ADD ON by simply pledging on whatever single level you want... then go to your finished pledge and, well, simply 'ADD' the other pledge level(s) amounts you want. For example, let's say you want the $68 'Ape Attack Rack Pack' MASTER SET ... but you also want some regular BASE SETS. Easy. Pledge on the $68 Master Set level, click to 'manage' your pledge, and just add $24 to your pledge for each additional base set you want. Or maybe you want several 'Deluxe' base set levels. Just pledge on ONE, click to manage your pledge, and add on the amount of however many OTHER 'Deluxe' base set deals you want. Want a CUSTOMIZED pledge? Well, just message me (not 'comment', I don't see 'comments'... but a MESSAGE) and we'll work it out. if all this seems as clear as something an ape might fling at you then just message me and I'll get back to you. 

SPECIAL ADD ONS: 
$35 UNCUT PUZZLE BACK PANELS, all 5 different 9 card PUZZLE BACK base set panels. Each panel has the entire 9 card puzzle and there are 5 different of them (hence, 45-card base set). Am going to try and get a photo of this posted soon.  

Original Stoinich and Macarie art ... this is something I'm going to try and work out during the campaign. Will also see what the printing plate count is like and MAY provide some 'rainbow suite' printing plate sets, too. 

Questions  and Answers:
Q:  I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do  I go about it?  A:  Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable  to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no  worries.
---------------
Q:  When will the Psycho Ape Trading Card Series ship? A:  The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of May (perhaps end of April... but almost certainly by May). This series, though, is pretty complicated. Although the base sets, tuck boxes, lenticulars, bananas and mini rubber masks are all produced AND here the OTHER cards are going to be gang printed with Ultraman and Zorro Series Two (yes, that's coming!) which I hope to begin printing in March and April. But most of you know me pretty well by now that if I'm late for some reason getting shipping done I keep everyone informed and do my best to be on time. I'm good about  posting updates and communications so will keep everyone in the loop.  I do,  though, ask for patience in advance ... we ARE still in a pandemic and some productions are tricky to get done through printing companies. 
---------------------
Q:  I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two  base sets? Or two 'Master Sets'?  A:  If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ...  then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge  amount. Be SURE to message me if adding on 'master set' stuff as that is limited to no more than 95 'Ape Attack Rack Packs'.   I'll check  and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine. The way I believe it's done is  after you pledge you click to view/manage your pledge and then you change the  amount of your pledge to reflect everything you want in your package. So, for  example, if you want to pledge on two master sets you just pledge on ONE. After  your pledge is entered you can click on view/manage your pledge and change the  amount of your pledge to reflect adding on additional goodies. And then MESSAGE me what you added on so I can keep an accurate record of what eventually goes into your pledge parcel when I start shipping.
-----------------
Q:  Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or through a catalog? A:  This is my 25th (??!) Kickstarter over the last 5+ years. I've found that pre-selling a  card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of  cards and boxes (especially special production cards that are pricey to do ... such as metal cards). It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a  limited basis. A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious  collectors FIRST before ANYONE else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise  some flexibility on providing 'stuff' for backers.
-----------------------
If  you have a question not answered here please just ask -- you can message me  directly through Kickstarter and I will respond as quickly as possible. It is  better to message me than to post a comment. Kickstarter shows me MESSAGES as  soon as they are posted but is not consistent with showing me 'comments' or where those comments are made. Needle in a haystack. But a 'message'? Well that goes straight to the Kickstarter 'inbox' and ALL messages get seen easily and quickly.  If you can't figure out how to message on Kickstarter then just contact me through my RRParksCARDS.com website.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks? Well I suppose an asteroid could come hurtling through space and land on my head. Otherwise, this is my 25th (perhaps more?) Kickstarter Campaign... and I've published dozens of other card series over the last 5 years ... including eight different Three Stooges series, Gary Saves the Graveyard, three Basil Wolverton series, Japanese Horror in 3D, 3 Mystery Science Theater 3000 series, 'Series Four', Sharknado, The 100th Anniversary of Zorro, Oggy and the Cockroaches, Manos: The Hands of Fate, Old Man Like Ron, DOZENS of annual Halloween card series and others). You'll NEVER be left wondering "what's going on" because I post regular updates and keep in contact with EVERYONE. Please note: AFTER this Kickstarter ends and right before I start shipping I'm going to send out what's called a 'mailing address survey' ... be sure to fill that out and message it back to me when the time comes so there's no delays in mailing your package. Okay? Okay!. While there are always risks and challenges with production, logistics or even crossing the street I have years of experience publishing trading cards and conducting Kickstarter campaigns. So the risks and challenges are minimized.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NEWS:  We are going to have 2 wrappers now.  Frankenstein's Monster and Dracula. There will be equal amount of both wrappers in boxes.
We are also going to offer 2 types of hobby boxes.  1 with guaranteed Distressed set lurking inside and 1 with a full bleed guaranteed inside it.  2 different graphics for both boxes.  We will ask you after the kickstarter is over which box you would like.  

NOTE:  The trading cards will have a United States release and be for sale on Amazon Prime and if enough people are interested, we will look at Amazon Canada as well. Walmart will also be carrying the cards online with 2 day shipping in the US.  We are exploring other outlets and will keep you posted.

Stretch goal update:  We hit $3,100 so a Rare Refractor card has been added to the series and everyone who pledged/pledges at least $30 will get the Refractor Card in their rewards!  
We hit $4,100 so everyone who pledges/pledged $99 or more gets a Sketch Card!  If you get a monster set, that means you get an extra one!
We hit $5,100 so a rare GOLD CARD has been added to the series.  Everyone who pledges/pledged $99 or more gets a rare GOLD CARD in their rewards.  
We hit our goal of $7,000 and now I am adding 2 new base cards and 2 new stickers to the series!
We hit our $9,000 stretch goal and added 2 more base cards and 2 more stickers and a Rare Refractor to the series.  The refractor will be included as a bonus for everyone who has pledged $30!   

What is this project about?
Remember the great non-sport trading cards from the 80s and late 70s?  They always had 7 cards, 1 sticker and a piece of gum.  This series is inspired by those cards and will have the same type of card stock on the base cards.  The same taste and smell in the bubble gum and the great joy of opening a pack.  After the kickstarter is over, the cards will be for sale on Amazon and Walmart and possibly other retail outlets.
I have designed everything about the set myself from the packs to the box packaging as well as draw every card.  This is a labor of love and I wanted to make this set for my fans, classic Monsters fans, comic fans, and trading card fans.
Who Am I?
My name is Mark Spears.  I am an artist with a career spanning over 20 years in the comics industry. I am a 3 time Rondo Hatton Horror Award nominee.  My past credits include Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Upper Deck Sports Cards, Image Comics, Warner Bros, Paramount, Rittenhouse, Corgi as well as many magazine covers and movie posters.

The Characters
All of the classic monsters are here that you know.  Count Dracula, Frankenstein's monster, The Bride of Frankenstein, Werewolf, The Mummy, The Phantom, Mr Hyde, The Blob, The Hunchback of Notre Dame, The Brides of Dracula, as well as some original 'monsters'.  72 pieces of artwork were created.  As well as some special art for some of the chase cards.   I may post a list of some of the characters but I don't want to give too much away just yet.
The series features 72  pieces of brand new fabulous monster art created by yours truly.  Each Hobby display box of cards will contain 20 packs.  Each pack will have 7 randomly inserted cards and 1 sticker card as well as bubble gum in a clear wrapper. Yes there will also be some puzzle cards  making a bigger picture with 9 cards.  I did not go with wax packs because the wax packs can be sealed again after opening them.  The card pack does have that throwback feel. The size of all the cards are standard 2.5" x 3.5".
Besides character cards, there are also versus cards and group cards.
My goal is that once you hold these packs and cards in your hands you will feel like you have been transported back in time to your childhood.
Value
These cards are high quality cards.  My cards could be printed at 24x36 inches and still look amazing because I draw them that big.  So scaled down they look even better.  Produced and made by the same manufacturers responsible for the cards you find at Walmart, Target and other retailers across the country.  This is a project I am using kickstarter to help with funding, not a kickstarter card series that is made just for kickstarter sales.  These cards will be on sale at Amazon and Walmart starting next spring.  If people love them, then I may do a series 2.  My plans are to do a comic book with these characters after the card series in sent to the printers.
My good friend
Scarah, the Damsel of the Doomed has joined me in offering some exclusive Kickstarter cards.  All her cards will be signed by her as well.  We would love to offer a wardrobe fabric card of Scarah, maybe as a stretch goal, we will see.
 If you would like all of Scarah's cards and want a different reward tier than the ones she is offered in, you can add $60 to that tier and let me know you want her full set.  Any questions please let me know.
 The Monster Set does come with an 11x17 art print signed.  (Forgot to mention that in the reward tiers but it comes with one)

Also Check out our two extra rewards featuring a full set plus you pick the characters on a versus card!  

Want More?
If you see that you want two rewards, just add the other reward amount to what you are getting and let me know, I will make sure you get everything you want.
If you would like to add-on any Scarah Card to a reward, the price is $20
If you would like to add-on the 3D set with glasses, the price is $30
Any other items, just let me know!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being in the trading industry for 14 years as well as professional artist for 22 years, I know what I'm getting myself into. My company Spears Art has become a brand of quality in fine art prints on Amazon and Walmart. I am funding the majority of the project myself but with this campaign, I am trying to make the series a little bigger.

The trading card series can be packaged and ready to go in 60 days of production time. I need 30 days prep time of getting all the sketch cards and remaining character artwork for the set and we are ready to go to the printers. We will make our release date goal or beat it.

Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hi everyone!  Sorry I have not updated in a few weeks, was sick but getting better.  Everything has been turned into the printers and are awaiting them to print them, package and send them to me.  The problem we had ran into first of May was that the colors looked to dark to me and we had to stop printing everything.  Then, even though it cost a lot to do, I decided to have everything printed as a hard proof and sent so I can inspect in hand.  This took much longer than expected and set us back.  Everything has been approved now.   So we are just weeks away.  1 week? 2 weeks? 3 weeks? I don't know.  I wish I had a definite date but the printers told me they can't give me an exact date but said all the card printing is scheduled.  After that though they do have to do the sorting, wrapping, etc.  I will keep you posted as soon as I hear any information though.  As for the cards, they look exactly how I wanted and I am very happy with how it all turned out.  I added a lot of stuff to the card set since the kickstarter and can't wait till you can all see everything.  (Ghoulish Golds, Classic Chromes, Horror Foils. etc) One thing I will let you know is there are secret cards in the series.  If you have the monster complete set, you will get them, don't worry.  The secret cards are not numbered, or on a checklist.

Hi guys, just wanted to update everyone again.  First off, I did win the Rondo Hatton Classic Horror Award for Best Artist.  Thank you to all that voted for me.
Second, we are at the hard proofing stage currently, that is where the cards are on the sheet and sent to me to verify colors, brightness, etc.  Once that is good everything is then printed, packed, boxed, etc.  So I am waiting on my hard proofs.  I will send you some photos when I get them in.  We will be have a full page ad in Scream magazine starting in June.   You should grab a copy and check it out!  Once I am done with the hard proofs I will go down my backer list and write everyone to verify if I have everything listed you wanted in your order.  If you want to add things at that time or upgrade you can.  I will have a price sheet for any extras/add-ons.  Thanks again for everything!

updates.update_userinfo: Scream Magazine has come on board as a promotional partner!

updates.update_content:
I know this is late notice but the voting ends for the Rondo Classic Horror Awards midnight Sunday 25th.   I have a lot of fans that have been voting for me as Best Horror Artist of the year.   I have been nominated 3 times in the past for covers I have done but have never won.  If you think I deserve this award and would like to vote for me, here is how to vote:

Just email taraco@aol.com and put 'Best Artist Mark Spears' in the subject and please put your name in the email to validate it.  That's it!

Hello everyone!  I apologize for making you wait a little longer.  Believe me when I say it will be worth it.  Almost finished with this journey and I can't wait to share this series with you!  Just wanted to give a quick update.  Everything is rolling along still.  I have a few more sketch cards to finish up but the printers will be starting to print the other cards this week.  Besides the sketch cards, what has taken a little longer in the process is that I increased the base sets to 86 cards now.   Also the Classic Chromes are now at 93 cards.  Each Classic Chrome has silver ink on them as well, so they are a more premium card.  I went back and recolored each image to look its best in the glorious black and white.  They look amazing.  The Ghoulish Gold cards (gold stamped), the MonsterSpectrums (refractors) are all set to go to the printers this week as well.   I have made the base stickers die-cut so they would seem more retro.  As I was setting up the 3D cards over a month ago, I started getting really good at the technology.  In fact, after making them and showing them to some people, I have decided to include 4 3D cards in ever hobby box.  As for glasses, there will be a pair of 3D glasses included inside every hobby box as well.  Can't wait for you to see them.  The fronts and backs are in 3D.  For those who ordered the blaster boxes, besides one autograph card in every box, a Ghoulish Gold card will also be inside one of the 8 packs as well.  I will give you guys another update in a week.  Again thanks for your patience and your support.

The Sketch Cards have arrived and I am starting them tonight.  Other big news is I am getting a back cover ad for the series in Non Sports Update magazine's next issue.   The release date says "coming soon" since I don't know a definite date yet.  Everyone from Kickstarter will have their items before we officially release the set on Amazon and Walmart and other places.  You are my first priority.   I am going to see if Diamond Comics will distribute the cards but right now I want to get everything finished and in your hands before I do that.  All the cards are ready to go to the printers but we have to get Scarahs cards printed, signed and sent back so that will take a few weeks as well.  I will also have to get my cards printed, signed and sent back.  Speaking of that...

updates.update_userinfo: Artwork almost finished, 99 down, 1 more to go.
updates.update_content: Just wanted to give you guys an update.  I have completed 99 pieces of artwork for the card set.  I have 1 last picture to do that was a reward tier battle.  That should be done in a few days.   The stickers will all feature new art (24 stickers in all) and then the cards will all have 74 pieces of art as well).  Last few days I have been working on the card backs and fronts getting them just the way I want.  The 'distressed' look will not interfere with the artwork and will just go a long the border for anyone who is curious about that.  After the final art piece is done, the next step will be finalizing all wrapper, card template designs, boxes, etc.  I am still hoping for late March release but it might be April depending on how the sketch cards work.  They will need to print them first before anything else, ship them to me, then I draw them all and ship them back for pack inserts.  So that might have a few hiccups in process but we will see.  Some people asked about a custom binder and I do believe I will be able to offer that at release.  Maybe even do a special picture just the the binder.

Thank you all for backing the project.  Here are some bonuses.  I am going to go ahead and make the concept cards 20 now in the chase card subset. I am going do an exclusive card and artwork that only kickstarter backers will get no matter the pledge level and this card will never be released at launch.  Monster Set backers are getting 12 exclusive sticker cards that will not be in packs.   For anyone who pledge $99 or more, you get a printing plate or extra one if your reward level already had one.

I had a few people as for some last minute stretch goals, so here it goes...
If we hit 14.5k before the kickstarter ends in a few hours I am going to increase the concept cards to 20 in the chase card subset, The base sets will go up to 80 cards each and I will do an exclusive card with artwork only for this card that all backers will get no matter the pledge level and this card will never be released at launch. If we somehow hit 15k before it ends, then everyone who pledged/pledges $99 or more will get a printing plate or extra printing plate if they already have one in a reward.

project_data.project_name: Mark Spears Monsters Retro Trading Cards

campaign.story:
Hi there! First off, let me say thank you for checking this project out! It's my first Kickstarter and I'm excited to get this very strange card series produced! 
This strange whacked out card series includes: 11 cards, foil parallels, sketch cards, original art cards, wrappers, and original production art.

A little bit about me.... I've been collecting cards since I was a kid, and have been making one-of-a-kind collage art cards for about 6 years now. This is my first mass produced card set based on my work (Mike, who you'll meet further down, as well as Richard Parks talked me into it!).  I've made collage cards for both Richard Parks (Psycho Ape and MST3K) as well as Richard Fowlks (Drive In Double Feature Series 1) card sets.
I'm an administrator at the FB page the Card-Board, and have my own FB art page Strange Cobwebs the Art of Jeff Trax (if you'd like to check out all the other kinds of collage cards I've done over the years....there's a lot!)

I'm working on this project with Mike Gallegos Jr, an artist I met through the Card-Board earlier this year. He is a freelance artist from San Antonio TX, who has experience creating his own card set (the self produced Trash Bin Weirdos). He creates different pieces using pencils, inks, and colored permanent markers. His works include everyday objects and film characters.
 Mike designed the KS exclusive card, the backs of all the cards, and the 2 wrappers, .... more on that below.

So without further ado, let's jump in!
This set was created while I was listening to the music of Skinny Puppy, and if you are a fan of them then you'll see the influence! And if you are a fan of early Ministry you'll know that Everyday is Halloween, so these cards will fit right in to any horror card collection anytime of the year!

This set is called Creeped Out Collages (series 1....We've had so much fun making this series....Series 2 is already in the works!!!!): The Family of Fear. 
 Each collage is a member of a Family of Nightmare proportions!! Each card has the character's name and an odd bio on the back of the card. 
In ADDITION to the base set we have a BRILLIANT, SHINY foil parallel set!

Mike is doing 30 sketch cards and I'm making 30 collage cards. Each Master Set will get one of each! And the Master Set is limited to a production run of 30.


Here's some examples of Mike's sketch cards.

The 1/1 collage cards I'm making FOR MASTER SET BACKERS will fit in directly with the set(s) you're buying but will be new characters in the family (There will be space on the back of the card for you to name the character!!)
Here's two examples of my 1/1 collage cards:
Included with ALL ORDERS will be this Kickstarter Exclusive Backer card. After this campaign this card will NO LONGER be available.
Included with ALL MASTER SETS is this KS Exclusive Master Set Backer card. After the KS campaign is over this card will no longer be available!
Mike designed two color variations of this wrapper: wrappers are part of the MASTER SET, and ONLY AVAILABLE at the MASTER SET LEVEL...here's one of them. 
So, Lets look at what you get at each Pledge Level!
WHEN YOU VERIFY YOUR PLEDGE, PAY CLOSE ATTENTION....WE HAVE SOME EXCLUSIVE ART ADD-ONS!!!!!

Meet The Family: The Basic Level  (limited to 20 sets) 
$15 gets you:
1 Basic set of 11 cards 
1 KS exclusive backer card (designed by Mike)
1 Series 2 Promo card (designed by me)

The Engagement Party: Level 2 (limited to 20 sets) 
$25 gets you:
1 Basic set of 11 cards
1 Foil Parallel set of 11 cards
1 KS exclusive backer card (designed by Mike)
1 Series 2 Promo card (designed by Me)

Married to the Family: Master Set  (limited to 30 sets)
$48 gets you:
1 Basic set of 11 cards in the Kickstarter exclusive green wrapper
1 Foil Parallel set of 11 cards in the Kickstarter exclusive blue wrapper
1 sketch card by Mike
1 1/1 collage card by Me
1 KS exclusive backer card (designed by Mike)
1 KS exclusive Master backer card (designed by me)
1 Series 2 Promo Card (designed by me)
1 "eye-popping" surprise card
(The sketch card and 1/1 collage card pictured in the lower right corner below are samples of what are included in the Master Set Level)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first Kickstarter, Mike and I have both produced and sold our own 1/1 cards, sketch cards, and cards sets. 

Once the Kickstarter is over and we have the funds, we will send everything to the printing company. This is the same company Mike has used on his and my card sets in the past and is very reliable. This KS will be ending during the holiday rush, so I will be mailing packages after Christmas to ensure speedy delivery. 
Every sketch card and 1/1 collage card will be done before the KS is over! All we'll need to do is print off the amount of cards/wrappers that were pledged for in the campaign! So the turn around time won't take long at all!!!!
if you have any questions, please please please MESSAGE ME. I'll see messages right away, but comments can be lost in the shuffle.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi everybody,
I just shipped out the first load of packages (the International folks and the "Meet the Family" packages)
I'll be shipping out "Engagement Party" and "Master Sets" This weekend and Monday.
Thanks again for all your support! We are already working on series 2!!!

The Big Day arrived!!!
I got the cards last night, and have begun to assemble packages!
There are still a handful of backers who have not filled out the survey, so please do that.
I will begin shipping this weekend!
Just got a message from Mike!

Hey everybody! 
I just got word that our order is now in production at the printer!!!!
Not only that, but I also got all of Mike's sketch cards in the mail this week!!!
So what does that mean? that means that in the next few weeks i'll have EVERYTHING in hand and will be assemblilng your rewards and getting the in the mail to you!

Just got the funds! We've got the numbers of cards needed laid out and ready to send to the printer.
HOWEVER, because of Christmas, the printer is really backed up on orders, so our order will be pushed until the first week or so of January, which still puts us on schedule!
So, until the next update, have a most excellent Christmas, Hanukkah, Kawanza and or Festivus!

Thank you Thank you Thank you to everybody!!!!!!
The project wasn't just funded, it was doubly funded!
Thanks to everyone for spreading the word and especially all of you with your pledges!
Over the next day or two, I'm gonna compile the list of all cards that need to be printed and get the order off to the Printing company.

This series is doing so amazingly well, thanks to all of you, that we've begun work on series 2 already! Here's a look at the promo card that will be included with all orders of this Kickstarter. Thanks again for your support!

project_data.project_name: Creeped Out Collages: Horror Trading Cards

campaign.story:
Three Publishers Walk Into A Crypt ...
Ok, so maybe we didn't quite walk into a crypt, but there are three publishers!  In an industry dominated by a handful of large publishers, many of the independent trading card companies have come together in a collaborative fashion.  Instead of fighting over customers or hoarding secrets, these firms have been working together for years.  Now, we are taking the next logical step...a joint publication based on one of the most revered horror films in history.
RRParks, RJF Image/Design, and Attic Cards Present....Nosferatu!
Nearly 100 years ago, F.W. Murnau released his epic masterpiece, Nosfertu.  Initially ordered to be destroyed, a few copies were salvaged and the film was released seven years later in the United States to great acclaim.  Based on Bram Stoker's Dracula, the film follows the exploits of Thomas Hutter who is assigned to assist Count Orlok in the purchase a new home.  This simple task is far more than it seems when Hutter discovers that the Count is no mere mortal.
Even those who haven't seen the film are familiar with this iconic scene.
The film contains numerous iconic scenes, but none match the sheer terror conveyed in Count Orlok's ascent up the stairs.
Base Set of 27 Cards including Anaglyph 3D!
The base set for Nosferatu is made up of 27 cards among 3 subsets.  The first 9 cards feature amazing 3D conversions by the one and only Christian LeBlanc.  Christian has lent his talents to numerous sets released by this trio of publishers including Mystery Science Theater 3000, Manos, Florida Man, Little Shop of Horrors, and countless others.  Collectors are in for a treat with this release as Christian has gone all-out with some of the most incredible 3D images we've seen. 
The 3D subset will have 9 different cards ... two of which are shown here. Designs by Christian LeBlanc
Of course, a pair of 3D glasses is included with each set.
Following the 3D subset comes the Story Cards, featuring images from the film in chronological order following the narrative of Nosferatu.  The obverse of each card contains a retelling of the story formatted to follow the classic Text Frames from the silent film era. 
Nine different story base cards will tell the nightmarish story of Nosferatu
The final subset contains promo cards that will be given away in other products produced by RJF, RRParks, and Attic Cards, as well as by the artists who created the amazing art.  These promo cards will contain exclusive art created for the Nosferatu set.  But collectors, fear not!  Those backing at the Master Set level will be provided a complete 9 card set in their package with no additional purchase required!
Sketch Cards
Backers from previous sets know that sketch cards are something that RJF, Attic and RRParks take very seriously.  Quality sketch cards may come from the talented artists on board this project, but they start with quality materials.  You won't find low-end stock here.  As with our prior products we have enlisted Karen "Wonder Woman" Cowan from ICONIX to manufacture the triple-layer, black-core, 35pt sketch card blanks that collectors have come to love, and artists have come to depend on.

Chase Cards o' Plenty ...
Because this card series represents the 100th Anniversary of this classic horror movie we've got a LOT of REALLY fun specialty cards ... starting with:
Full Motion Lenticular Cards
Count Orlock rises from his coffin ... Count Orlock creeps up the stairs! These two iconic scenes are brought to life in these two FULL MOTION lenticular trading cards! 
These are the two FULL MOTION Lenticular cards for this series ... already designed, produced, and here -- ready to include in card sets!
Fine Art Limited Edition Genuine Etching Cards
What a fitting tribute to this classic anniversary card series -- FOUR different genuine, limited edition signed and numbered FINE ART etching cards, produced in much the same way as Rembrandt Van Rijn produced etchings in the 16th Century. Each one hand inked and crafted. 
Four different fine art, limited edition and numbered Nosferatu Etching cards with art by Michael Mastermaker and plating by RRParks
Genuine Film Cell Relic Cards
We can all watch Nosferatu on DVD ... but how about OWNING actual frames of the vintage film itself? FOUR different cell cards to collect -- each containing a genuine 16mm film strip from the movie PLUS a special tri-publisher cell. TWO cells inserts in EACH card.  
Image shows ONE of the Four Different cell cards to collect.
 Special Packaging: BOX and 4-BOX CASE
A complete set of all 9 story base cards, 9 art cards, 9 3D cards ... 1 lenticular card, 1 cell card, 1 etching card and 1 SKETCH CARD comes in a specially designed tuck-style box. Plus a pair of 3D glasses. All this for $34. Also available is a 4-box CASE which will include 4 of these tuck-style boxes and a case is guaranteed to contain BOTH of the lenticular motion cards, ALL 4 etching cards, ALL 4 cell cards and 4 sketch cards (by 4 different artists). And a full 4-box case also includes a special printing plate box topper PLUS 4 3D glasses and MORE surprises! A case of 4 boxes with all the special box toppers is $120. ALL orders will also receive the Nosferatu NSU 30th Anniversary Promo Card! 
The four boxes and the CASE are currently being designed. This set of cards is available by base set BOX ... or by 4-box MASTER SET CASE.
PLEDGE LEVELS
So, how do you get in on this Nosferatu 100th Anniverary Trading Card event? EASY! listed below are the pledge levels ... figure out what you want to add to your collection and on the right hand side of your screen you can pledge the tier you want. Here are the pledge levels:
$3 Pledge ... At the $3 level you get ONE promo card and ONE random base card
$20 Pledge ... At the $20 level you get the 27-card base set (9 Art Cards, 9 Storyline cards, and 9 3D cards with a pair of 3D glasses).
$34 pledge ... At the $34 BASE SET level you get the tuck-style box which includes a complete set of all 9 story base cards, 9 art cards, 9 3D cards ... 1 lenticular card, 1 cell card, 1 etching card and 1 SKETCH CARD comes in a specially designed tuck-style box. Plus a pair of 3D glasses. 
$120 pledge ... At the $120 MASTER CASE level you get FOUR tuck boxes containing everything in the base set level ... which includes FOUR complete base sets, 4 lenticular cards (two sets of both lenticular cards), all FOUR different etching cards, all FOUR different cell cards, FOUR original art sketch cards by 4 different artists, 4 pairs of 3D glasses, PLUS the special CASE TOPPER cards. This is a master set of EVERYTHING! All housed in the special 4-box case.
$220 pledge... This is the HOARDER'S SPECIAL level. TWO cases (8 base sets). All the bells and whistles of the MASTER CASE level ... but DOUBLE! And yes, there WILL be bonus goodies at this level.
$300 pledge ... DEALER'S DEAL! THREE cases of 4 base sets ... total of 12 base sets. At this level there are 12 27-card base sets, 12 sketch cards, 12 cell cards (3 sets of all 4 different cell cards), 12 lenticular cards (6 sets of both lenticular motion cards), 12 etching cards (3 sets of all 4 limited edition etching cards), 12 pairs of 3D glasses and three special box topper bundles. PLUS, of course, a dozen of the NSU promo cards.  
Customizing your Pledge
If you don't see the exact pledge level you'd like to see just message us. Want to pledge on a case AND a box? Or several of the same pledge level? Just let us know and we'll walk through how to pledge for exactly what you want. NOTE: 'Message' means message ... posting a 'comment' instead of a 'message' may go unseen. So be sure to use the message feature. All 3 of us publishers are also on Facebook so you can message us there, too, if you aren't able to do a message through Kickstarter. 
The plan is to ship this card series by Christmas 2020. 
FAQ
"If I want to pledge on TWO base sets how can I do that?"
Simple. Pledge on ONE base set. Once you've pledged, just go to view/manage your pledge and change your pledge amount to reflect TWO base sets. Meaning you'll find your pledge for $34 for one base set ... simply change that amount to $68 (2 x $34) and then message us that your $68 pledge is for TWO base sets.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The three publishers have combined for over 100 trading card set releases and more than 35 Kickstarters, all successfully fulfilled. There is the risk of supply chain issues given the ongoing pandemic, but this would only result in a delay of fulfillment, not an absence.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update: Master Cases with Photos and Video!
updates.update_content:
Howdy faithful backers! Here's a long overdue update.

Everything is headed out the door, just packaging and shipping it all!! Many apologies for how long this process is taking; with the kids STILL schooling at home, it's been a scheduling nightmare to get the time to get this done and to you all. But here is video of wrapping a tuck box for the Mater Cases. Fun with plastics and a heat gun!!

Greetings All,
Thank you so much for your patience.  As some of you may have noticed, a few backers have received their cards...which means shipping is underway!  There is a slight delay in the production of the special packaging to hold the 4 box case.  We promised special packaging and didn't want to not deliver on that.  I spoke to the printers on Friday and the packaging should be in my hands within 2 weeks.  The plan is to have everything out by the end of February, assuming we receive everything on schedule.

Greetings All!
Jeremy here, hope everyone had a nice holiday.  Some good news, the tuck boxes have came in and they look SHARP.    Here's the font, we'll keep the back a surprise:

Greetings!
Attic Cards is proud to announce two releases going on right now just in time for the holidays!
First is available at www.attic-cards.com, and is an officially licensed release from Full Moon Features. Four different boxes are available featuring some of your favorite Full Moon Characters. Each box includes two premium acrylic cards, 2 retro-style holofoil stickers, and an original art sketch card. That’s right, every box includes a sketch card! These sets are limited and the last Full Moon set sold out quickly, so don’t hesitate. Boxes are only $44.99, and again each box includes a sketch card!
