Checking back with all of you before we close shop for the Thanksgiving Holiday. The latest and greatest progress:
• All 27 base cards are with the printer
• All 4 variations of the etching are completed and being assembled
• The cell cards are in assembly phase (dual-cell ... an original relic strip of film PLUS a special cell inset... for all 4 cell cards)

updates.update_userinfo: Krampus is Back! Along with Puppet Master!
updates.update_content:
Greetings,
I hope everyone is doing well and staying healthy.  Jeremy here checking in on behalf of the trio.  Things are moving right along with Nosferatu.
Boxes have been approved and sent to print
27 Base card set has been beamed over for production, pending proofs
Cel Cards and Etchings are underway

First and foremost, thank you again for backing this project.  Now that numbers are finalized, at least the minimums, we've started production on the set.  Cel cards are currently being made and the etchings, which is a very labor-intensive process, are being set up for production in the next week or so.  Sketch cards continue to come in from the incredibly talented artists onboard this set.
With that said, if anyone wants to add anything to their order, or if anyone stumbles upon this Kickstarter now that it is over and wants to back, we have a little flexibility before everything goes to print.  Send a message to any of us (Richard Parks, Richard Fowlks, or me) and we'll see if we can squeeze you in.  Production will be locked down towards the end of the month, and while there will be some Basic and Boxed sets available via direct order, master sets will likely be limited.

project_data.project_name: Nosferatu Trading Cards from RJF, RRParks, and Attic Cards

campaign.story:
Good EeeEeEvening.... And WELCOME BACK! To THIS ... our SEVENTH annual HALLOWEEN TRADING CARD EVENT! 
HAPPY HALLOWEEN from RRParks CARDS! We're wrapping up our seventh year as a trading card company as well as our seventh Halloween as a publisher. Every October we publish some fun spoooooky and creepy horror and monster card sets ... and THIS is our BIGGEST HALLOWEEN EVENT EVER!  Your pledge on this project helps with production costs and will make sure you get ALL the CARD SERIES as well as exclusives.
We are DETERMINED to get this years' RRParksCARDS Halloween Trading Cards to you BY HALLOWEEN! We might not be able to go out trick or treating ... might not be able to have a Halloween party ... but by golly I want everyone to be able to enjoy the holiday and so the scar-r-r-r-ry LOGISTICS for getting these cards to everyone by Halloween were started MONTHS ago in preparation.  Some of the cards of this Halloween have already been printed and here already... others have just been sent to printing ... and some I have to have produced when the Kickstarter ends (such as the limited edition METAL cards which have production numbers determined by the number of backers ... making such cards VERY rare and NEVER to be reprinted).
September 13th ADDED BONUS! See bottom of this description ...
Note: The $92 master set level is SOLD OUT ... Some $85 master set levels are still available. If you want the binder insert kit added you can pledge on the $85 level and then click to view/manage your pledge and add on the $7 needed to include the binder insert kit (why $7? That's the cost of postage and packaging materials to send the binder insert kit in it's own package). If you have any questions just message me. 
So, what card series are happening this year?
Halloween Trick or Treat Series EIGHT!
Halloween Trick or Treat Series EIGHT features 9 different cards of SPOOOOOKY vintage Halloween masterpieces (18 wonderful images) on glossy cards RETRO-STALGIC stock with black borders. All housed in a wrapper.
Monster Choke 'n Gag Series SEVEN!
Continuing the Monster Choke 'n Gag Series Seven -- which was the first card series I published under my then-new company RRParks CARDS -- comes series SEVEN. 24 different 1960s style midgee and triplix panel cards. This time the focus is on MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE (featured on an episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000) with dozens of 'riffed scenes' including a checklist back card. All in their own wrapper.
Quatermass and the Pit SERIES THREE!
This annual card series chronicles the classic BBC TV series Quatermass and the Pit. And this is the THIRD installment (What? You missed the first two installments? Well worry not -- at the end of this description you'll see ADD ON options to catch up!) Perhaps you've never heard of Quatermas and the Pit... but you HAVE heard of the movie FIVE MILLION YEARS TO EARTH. Well, almost 10 years before that classic Hammer film was released, the BBC did a 6-hour, 6-part miniseries called Quatermass and the Pit. It is one of my all time favorite science fiction / horror movies and I'm continuing the series started last year ... this is series two and features the 2nd episode of the BBC production. When construction workers begin work on a new housing development they discover strange fossil skulls ... a paleontologist gets wind of the find and with the assistance of Professor Quatermass and the professor's nemesis, Colonel Breen, the 3 set out to investigate the strange fossils in the pit. And it is quickly determined that they, and the strange cylinder found with them, are not what they seem. Stay tuned -- Halloween 2021 will have Quatermass and the Pit series four!
Horror Monsters Series THREE!
Here's something I've ALWAYS wanted to see since I started collecting monster and horror trading cards ... the THIRD series of the 1960s classic card series from Nu Cards: HORROR MONSTERS! This series of cards features the CONTINUATION of the GREEN and ORANGE border series of the 1960s... Goofy gags and jokes with a duo-tint front and classic retro-stalgic style stock. And when you get the cards look closely at the back graphics! The complete set of 21 cards come in a pack wrappered complete set. OH but WAIT! There's MORE! Some years ago I discovered that Horror Monsters Series One, in the 1960s, had also been issued as two-card panels, perforated in the middle and available in a cello pack. So to celebrate the return of this classic series ... after almost 60 years... This series is ALSO being released in a two-card panel version (10 panels = 20 cards PLUS a special 'slick' insert... and a 'cello' type package). And you get BOTH versions with a master set pledge.
Comic Book Advertising Card Series One!
Comic Book Advertising Card Series One. I'm sure I'm not alone in this, but when I was a kid in the late 1960s I marveled at the fantastical ADS in comic books ... Giant Monsters, Epic Plastic Army Men armies, Spaceships you could actually RIDE IN, Fish that could tell your FORTUNE, and perhaps the most MAGICAL of ALL: The X-Ray Spex. Relive those wonder years of being a kid where for $1 you could unlock all the mysteries and magic that hucksters were pedaling -- This trading card series of 18 retro-style cards features 36 of those classic ads! And what ABOUT those actual plastic soldiers, fortune telling fish, monsters that obey your commands, and X-Ray Spex that we marveled at but never sent in our $1 to get? Well ... keep reading ... your dreams will come true TODAY!
Scary Clowns Series 2 and 2 1/2
A couple years ago I did a small little card series called Scary Clowns. Mini cards with nightmarish and disturbing clowns. Well, here's SERIES TWO! And because I'll be publishing a certain Mysterious, Scientific, Theatrical SERIES FOUR of something in a couple months we have a special Scary Clowns Series 2 1/2 ... with clowns familiar to MSTies! 
Attack of the GIANT LEECHES Trading Card Set!
One of my all time favorite 1950s B-Horror Monster movies is Attack of the Giant Leeches (sometimes called The Giant Leeches). It's cheesy, it's lurid, it's awful... and I LOVE it! MSTies are familiar with it ... and virtually ALL horror movie buffs have seen it. And now it's a full color retro style trading card series -- featuring the wonderful movie poster and one-sheet/lobby card art of that classic 1959 (almost 1960) movie. NINE cards ... and for master set backers a special promo card. 
The OUIJA BOARD Card! ... that REALLY WORKS!
That's right gang! HOO HAH!  You will NOW own your very own Ouija Board ... that ACTUALLY WORKS! You can NOW communicate with the SPIRIT WORLD! Turn the card over, put your finger on the magic skull... ask your question ... and turn the card over to reveal an answer provided by a GHOST! Don't like the answer you get? Try it again and get a DIFFERENT ANSWER! OOOooOOooo SCARY! It's MAGIC! 
Limited Edition JACKALOPE ETCHING! 
Drawn and etched by RRParks (Hey! That's ME!) this miniature fine art etching is a limited production signed and numbered etching art print! The final edition number will be based on the number of backers. This genuine etching was drawn, plated, inked, and impressed by me using archival French Arches BUFF acid free stock and a Sturges "O" roller intaglio press and comes mounted to a signed COA (Certificate of Authenticity) and will be numbered once this Kickstarter is over. The final etching art card will be JUST like etchings created in the 16th century (and to the best of my knowledge I'm the ONLY trading card publisher that actually produces REAL etchings!).
FINALLY! An OFFICIAL RRParksCARDS Halloween Binder Kit!
After 7 Halloweens RRParksCARDS has published a LOT of Halloween Themed trading card series. Halloween Trick or Treat Series 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and now 8 ... Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and now 7 ... Scary Clowns Series 1 and now 2 and 2 1/2 ... The Dungeon of Doctor Dreck Series 1 and 2 ... Attack of the Giant Leeches mini set and House on Haunted Hill mini set ... Yoshitoshi Japanese Horror in 3D ... Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 1, 2 and 3 ... Gary Saves the Graveyard ... The Monster Times ... Duke's Comic Characters ... Lotte Monster Etchings ... Stooge Laffs and Stooges Halloween Spook-Tacular ... and more. Also RRParksCARDS' last series BEFORE we officially became RRParksCARDS: Hans Holbeins Dance of Death Etching Series. Well NOW you can put together a binder with OFFICIAL BINDER INSERTS and house your ENTIRE RRParksCARDS Halloween Sets in SCARY STYLE!  Includes a large insert panel for the cover PLUS a panel for the spine. 
The Monster Times RACK PACK!
That's right! In celebration of our SEVENTH year we have a trip down memory lane with The Monster Times trading card packs in a 1960s style RACK PACK containing 3 10-card packs. These wrappers were actually produced about 7 years ago when I wasn't sure if The Monster Times was going to be released as a factory set box or as a retail pack. I had the official wrappers printed up -- two versions (green and yellow) -- and never used them. Until NOW! In this first ever The Monster Times Rack Pack.
The MST3K Rack Pack!
When I was a kid I LOVED rack packs... those plastic or cellophane treasure troves that contained LOADS of cards or packs. So what better way to celebrate the upcoming SERIES FOUR ... what better way to celebrate the 1960s ... than with a SIX PACK Rack Pack of series 1, 2 and 3 MST3K cards. I field tested the 'rack pack' about a year ago with loose MST3K cards ... and NOW have the Rack Pack system figured out. RRParksCARDS Rack Packs come with an official header card. And this MST3K Rack Pack will come with a bonus SPECIAL card (like a lenticular or DIY blank or something else that's a 'chase' type card). 
Exclusive Limited Edition METAL CARD!
At this time, the design of the Metal Card is still being worked out. Maybe it will be related to the upcoming Attic Cards - RJF Cards - RRParksCARDS production (yes, 3 different publishers all teaming up to publish a single card series) of NOSFERATU for Nosferatu's 100th Anniversary! This metal card will be available ONLY for backers of this Kickstarter and will be limited in number to fill orders. NO extras, no late-arrivals... available ONLY NOW!
Special 1960s Style TOY SURPRISES!
As promised above ... we've got some REALLY cool vintage style toy surprises this year! A creepy 1960s 'style' jiggly finger puppet of a hideous beast! A spooooky realistic spider that obeys your commands (providing your command is to 'sit Spot, sit')... but then we've got for you an ACTUAL 1960s plastic soldier (two of them actually!) that are THE figures that were advertised in 1960s comics -- these were not easy or cheap to find and if you never coughed up a buck in the 1960s to order these guys, NOW you will KNOW what you missed out on (for either good or bad). But WAIT! How would you feel about getting a genuine FORTUNE TELLING FISH! Oh yes, that classic 'gimmick' novelty of decades gone by, this fish can tell your fortune (or at least how you feel). It's weird, it's odd, and it was NEVER worth what 1,000s of people paid in the 1960s! And now it is YOURS to CONTROL! And the holy grail of mail-away-weirdness ... you can NOW own a pair of GENUINE X-RAY SPEX! See through flesh, see through clothes, scare your friends, trample your enemies underfoot and usher in the end of days ... or at least see through flesh and clothes. Never sent away for a pair of X-Ray Spex when you were a kid? Well NOW you don't have to as this comes FREE with your master set!
Genuine Printing Plates!
Every master set comes complete with a genuine printing plate used in the production of these trading cards. Each will have a certificate of authenticity on the back. EACH plate is UNIQUE and guaranteed genuine production-used for printing one of these cards in this, our SEVENTH annual Halloween Trading Cards project.  
RARE and EXCLUSIVE PROMO CARDS available nowhere else!
I don't have a photo to show you yet, but as Kickstarter backers on my Halloween campaigns already know, I produce exclusive promo cards for the annual event. Some are destined to be sent to The Wrapper and given our sparingly to resubscribers of that magazine ... while other promos will be available ONLY HERE and ONLY NOW! Planned are at LEAST 8 SUPER RARE promo cards ... a full set available ONLY here and now for master set backers. 
CREEPY CELL CARDS!
For Master Pledge levels backers ... CELL cards continued from last year -- you will get this year's INSTALLMENT of Cell Cards! 
Pledge Levels:
$3. For $3 you get TWO (random) of the rare Wrapper promo cards and my thanks for supporting this Halloween Kickstarter.
BASIC SETS PLEDGE: At $35 you get ONE of each of the 2019's sets including Halloween Trick or Treat Series 8, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 7, Quatermass and the Pit Series 3, Horror Monsters Series 3 pack set, Scary Clowns Series 2, Comic Book Advertising Series 1, and Attack of the Giant Leeches trading card set. PLUS some promo cards and surprises. 
DELUXE BASIC PLEDGE: At $50 you get ALL the sets listed in the BASIC SETS level ... plus 4 RARE promo cards, ONE genuine printing plate, the Metal Card and the etching card. AND the Ouija Card.
MASTER LEVEL: Here it is... the 'everything' level! At $85 you get Halloween Trick or Treat Series 8, Horror Monsters Series 3 complete pack set, Horror Monsters special duo-card panel pack of all 10 different panels (cello pack), Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 7 (special MANOS edition) complete pack set, Comic Book Advertising Series 1 complete cell pack set, Scary Clowns Series 2 AND Series 2 1/2, Quatermass and the Pit Series 3, full set of the Attack of the Giant Leeches cards ... PLUS TWO of the Ouija Board Cards (one for you, one for a victim of your choosing) ... PLUS the limited edition Jackalope etching card ... PLUS the limited edition metal card ... PLUS the Cell Cards AND one printing plate ... PLUS The Monster Times RACK PACK ... PLUS the MST3K RACK PACK ... PLUS The weird creature finger puppet AND the realistic fake authentic imitation spider ... PLUS the Fortune Telling Fish ... PLUS 2 genuine 1960s plastic toy solider comic book ad toys ... PLUS the X-Ray Spex ... PLUS all of the special PROMO CARDS and some bonus promo cards, too. The MASTER SET has EVERYTHING!
MASTER LEVEL plus BINDER INSERT KIT: $92. EVERYTHING in the above MASTER LEVEL but because the binder insert kit would have to mail separately (and it costs a bit to mail) if you want the binder insert kit, THIS level includes it and covers the US postage to mail it in a separate package.
... and the next is THE ULTIMATE 'catch up' level:
The $280 ULTIMATE PLEDGE LEVEL:  This last one is to get you caught up on all the RRParksCARDS annual series. This one includes everything for the previous 6 years so you can CATCH UP: Monster Choke 'n Gag series 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 ... Halloween Trick or Treat series 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 ... Scary Clowns series 1, 2, and 3 Quatermass and the Pit series 1 and 2, The Dungeon of Doctor Dreck series 1 and 2 (plus the mini sets of House on Haunted Hill and Attack of the Giant Leeches) ... plus The Most Irritating Man in the World pack set with bonus 'toilet targets' PLUS Gary Saves the Graveyard deluxe set with zombie head and all 8 autograph cards (the director plus 7 main actors), PLUS a loose set of all 50 The Monster Times cards, PLUS all 3 GitD cards (Gary Saves the Graveyard, Yoshitoshi, and Monster Choke n Gag Golem), PLUS Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 1, 2 and 3, Duke Comic Characters complete set, 'secret monster set' from a couple few years ago, Hans Holbein's The Grim Reaper complete set (the last card series I did before I became officially RRParksCARDS), PLUS the Three Stooges Halloween sets: Stooge Laffs (midgee panel set in wrappers) and the 1950s style Stooges Halloween 'continuation' series (in packs) PLUS the 6-card Three Stooges Monsters Glow in the Dark set. PLUS: Some cool extra goodies. IF you want this 'Ultimate Bundle' as WELL as this years' 2020 RRParksCARDS Master set pledge on the $75 master set and then ADD ON $280 for this Ultimate Bundle (Why? Because I have to keep careful tabs on the $75 Master Set level so I don't exceed 95 master sets). Expect a wonderous package of goofy, ghoulish trading cards. This is the 'BIG ONE'. And expect some really cool bonus collectibles in this one (they're a surprise! All treats -- No tricks!). PLUS THE BINDER INSERT KIT!
If you don't see the exact pledge level you'd like to back just message me and we'll piece one together for you.
 ADD ONS from 2013-2019 RRParksCARDS: 
The printing plates, etching card, cell cards, metal card, and the 'toy goodies' in this years' MASTER SET level are available ONLY for Master Set backers. But if there are some card sets you'd like to ADD ON, just let me know. Card sets you can ADD ON include: Halloween Trick or Treat series 1, 2 , 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8 ... Monster Choke 'n Gag series 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 6, and 7 ... The Grim Reaper series 1, 2 and 3 ... Yoshitoshi Japanese Horror in 3D ... Dungeon of Doctor Dreck series 1 and 2 ... The Three Stooges 'Halloween Stooge-tacular Box ... The Monster Times (base set or boxed set) ... Duke Comic Characters, Grim Reaper Etching Set, Stooge Laffs, Stooge Retro 'Halloween' packs, Scary Clowns 1 or 2 ... Quatermass and the Pit series 1, 2, and 3 ...and so on. You can also add on for Basil Wolverton Barflize or Basil Wolverton 2: Wolverton's Women ...  I do my best to work things out with everyone and the only time I can't is when something is completely sold out OR when something was an exclusive for master set backers.  Message me about something you're seeking and if I still have it, you can 'add on' to your pledge at the original release price. If you're pledging on the MASTER SET and want to add on another MST3K Rack Pack, another Horror Monsters Series 3 panel set, another The Monster Times Rack Pack just let me know.  
IF you want to ADD ON something and NOT pledge on this year's Halloween ... maybe you only need Halloween Trick or Treat Series 5... or some Grim Reaper sets ... something like that ... then simply pledge at the $3 level and MESSAGE me what you want to 'add on' and I can send you the amount to ADD to your $3 pledge to get the ADD ONs you want.
NOTE: Very Important. As you can imagine, with Nosferatu coming up... and the Series Four (for MST3K fans) in November... AND ULTRAMAN towards the end of the year and some other early 2021 card series my time is gonna be strained. So as mentioned a couple years ago, 'Halloween' type sets (like those listed above) are ONLY available during September and October. If the various Halloween sets are NOT requested during September or October of this year then you'll have to wait until September/October of 2021 to get them. 
 FREE BONUS CARD SET JUST ADDED (SEPTEMBER 13TH): 
Although I don't do 'stretch goals', this campaign has been doing so well with backers supportive of our seventh annual RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter I've put together a BONUS set not originally planned. Celebrating the 100th Anniversary of the classic monster movie, THE GOLEM, here is a brand new 9 card set plus a special 10th Kickstarter backer card! Those who pledge at the Basic Set level or higher will get the bonus set and 10th card for FREE! Those who pledge at the Master Set level or higher will get the 9 card set, the special 10th Kickstarter backer card PLUS all 5 Der Golem promo cards! Those who pledge at the Master Set and Binder Insert Kit (or Master Set and add on the binder insert kit) will get the 9 card set, the special 10th Kickstarter backer card PLUS all 5 Der Golem promo cards PLUS a limited edition numbered uncut panel of the 10 Der Golem cards! If you've already pledged at the Basic Set or Master Set levels or higher you will get these free items AUTOMATICALLY -- no need to do anything, they are free and will be included with your other goodies. I'm creating this Der Golem set as a THANK YOU for your support.
Two of the 10 different DER GOLEM cards (fronts and backs of 2 of the cards shown... there are 10 total cards, all designed and going to the printing company TODAY)
 Frequently Asked Questions: 
"What if I can't pledge directly on Kickstarter?"
If you can't pledge on Kickstarter, just message me through Facebook or email me through my website at RRParksCARDS.com ... but any message or email MUST be received before the end of this Kickstarter (which is October 8th). RIGHT after this Kickstarter ends I'll be submitting the orders for Metal cards, Etching card COAs and assembling master sets. If you can't send a message or email before October 8th then there may be items you'll be unable to get.
"Why is postage outside the US so expensive?"
Actually, quoted costs for international shipping are LESS than actual costs ... the reason the cost for mailing outside the US is so expensive is because you live FAR AWAY and the USPS are MEANIES! 
"What if I would like to pledge on two Master Sets ... or some past year sets ... or want a customized pledge level?"
Easy -- just MESSAGE me through Kickstarter (that's "MESSAGE"... not "COMMENT". A comment is virtually invisible to Kickstarter hosts/creators ... but a MESSAGE is something I'll see) and we can figure out between us what you WANT and HOW to pledge it. 
"What if I'm wanting to pledge on the Basic set ... or all of the Master Sets are gone ... but I still want the binder insert kit? How do I get that, too?"
Because for binder insert kit is large it generally has to be mailed separately from the cards (a second parcel). So if you want to add on a binder insert kit you can simply click on your pledge to view/manage and ADD $7 to your pledge. This covers the postage and packaging materials for mailing the binder insert kit. The insert kit is basically FREE ... but I do need some money for US postage and the solid packaging materials. If you are outside the US message me first (as postage is higher going outside the US.
"What if I missed a couple years of RRParksCARDS Halloween Trick or Treat, Monster Choke 'n Gag, Grim Reaper, Quatermass and the Pit, etc.  -- how do I CATCH UP and add those sets to my pledge amount?"
Easy ... look above for the Jack O Lantern in the chef's hat and menu board. Next to him you'll see a list, with prices, for ALL past Halloween related sets. Figure out what sets you want, add up their costs, and just add that amount to your existing pledge. If you have ANY trouble doing this, just message me (MESSAGE ... not COMMENT... messages are something I can easily see and respond to but comments are largely invisible). If you can't figure out how to message me through Kickstarter you can also email me at RRParksCARDS@yahoo.com or message me through Facebook (I'm RRParks CARDS on Facebook). 
"What if I don't know how to read?"
Then you won't be able to read my answer to that question.

Risks and challenges
This is my 28th Kickstarter ... Everything always gets produced -- between my experience, trusted artists, an outstanding printing production broker I've always come through on everything (and mostly ON TIME, TOO!). And in the case of the Halloween sets above, virtually EVERYTHING is already printed/produced or already at the printers. By the time this Kickstarter ends only things that will remain to be produced are the Metal Cards and I will get right on those when I know how many backers there are at the Master and Deluxe Master levels (since they will be produced only to the quantities needed to fulfill such pledges).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WELCOME to RRParksCARDS' very first TEST ISSUE Trading Card Series: OGGY and the COCKROACHES! Oggy and the Cockroaches (known as Oggy et les Cafards in French, often referred to as simply Oggy) is a French cartoon series currently produced by Xilam Animation and created by Jean-Yves Raimbaud.  The show gives us the adventures, mis-adventures and various exploits of two cats (Oggy and Jack) and their regular adversaries Joey, Marky and Dee Dee ... three mischievous cockroaches. The cartoon series  started airing in 1998, it was successful in France and was eventually broadcast worldwide. Notable for truly beautiful scene work, unusual 'camera angles' and stories EASY to comprehend (even if inexplicable) because there is no dialogue!
RRParksCARDS has teamed up with American Mythology and Xilam Animation to bring the world the FIRST US trading card series of this internationally beloved cartoon series ... and we're testing the US market with this very first, limited edition PREVIEW SERIES of limited edition trading cards. 
What does this PREVIEW EDITION include? 
1. Trading Card Base Set. This base set features NINE different PREVIEW cards ... PLUS a 10th Kickstarter Exclusive Card! Fronts feature a classic scene from the cartoon series and the backs feature title art, synopsis and extra image from the cartoon.
2. Five Different Stickers. These full color stickers feature the lead characters: Oggy, Jack, Dee Dee, Joey and Marky.
3. Genuine 3D Lenticular Card. This lovely lenticular card features Oggy and Dee Dee peering down a manhole with a gorgeous crescent moon background/sky graphic. VERY cool!
4. Metal Card. Kickstarter Exclusive Full Metal, limited edition and numbered card available ONLY through this Kickstarter campaign and produced by that wonderful team Jacob and Julie Stem at Faerie Metal!
The nine card base with 1 sticker set will be wrapped in a special PREVIEW SET wrapper: 
Front of the wrapper for the special PREVIEW SET CARDS.
This PREVIEW SERIES is to help gauge how many Oggy and the Cockroaches fans there are so we can plan a FULL CARD SERIES release. As such, although the production of this preview series is VERY limited, we are keeping the pledge tiers VERY low priced to encourage Oggy fans to come on board, show their support and fandom, and we think that once you see the production quality of RRParksCARDS you'll be excited to collect the actual FIRST SERIES that is currently in the planning stages.
Here are the pledge levels:
$1 'sampler'. For a $1 pledge you will get TWO of these special edition PREVIEW cards mailed anywhere in the world.
$7 'Preview Pack'. For a $7 pledge you will get a PREVIEW PACK. The pack includes the wrapper, 9 cards PLUS a sticker. Postpaid in the US
$20 'MASTER SET!' PREVIEW EDITION. For a $20 pledge you will get the PREVIEW PACK of 9 different cards PLUS the sticker. PLUS the other 4 different stickers (so you'll have a complete set of all 5 stickers) ... PLUS the special 10th Preview card ... PLUS the 3D lenticular card ... PLUS the limited edition  METAL CARD! Postpaid in the US. 
$35 DOUBLE MASTER! One set for you and one set you can give away or trade or whatever. At this level you get TWO of everything listed in the 'Master Set' level. I will ALSO include TWO unused/UNFOLDED wrappers (since they make for a lovely addition to a special card series in your binder/album). Postpaid in the US.
$50 HOARDERS SPECIAL. At the $50 level you get 10 PREVIEW PACKS  (guaranteed to include 2 of each of the 5 stickers... so if you were to open the packs you'd have two sticker sets and 10 of the 9 card sets) PLUS I'll include ONE lenticular card and ONE metal card and 10 of the card #10. Postpaid in the US. [LIMIT of ONE of these 'hoarder specials' per backer]
 SPECIAL ADD ON! 
$15 UNCUT, limited edition NUMBERED and PUBLISHER-SIGNED sheet of all 10 different preview cards. Limited to only 50 numbered sheets. Before adding this on be sure to message me FIRST to make sure They are still available. I'm limiting these to only TWO per backer.
JUST ADDED on July 26th ... FOUR PROMO CARDS! 
These are limited to only 100 or LESS each ... These will be included as a BONUS for those pledging at the master set or higher level and a complete set of all 4 will come FREE with EACH master set ordered.
 SPECIAL INTERNATIONAL Backer OPTION.  
Yes, shipping to any country outside the US is very pricey these days. BUT, if you pledged on my Manos: The Hands of Fate and/or Wolverton Series Three ... and if you want to include your choice of Oggy goodies above I can mail it with your Manos or Wolverton package for ZERO additional postage. So in order to do this just figure out what Oggy tier you want ... pledge $1 ... and then click to manage your pledge and change the pledge amount to the tier / level you want to get. This should result in ZERO postage costs added to your pledge amount. And then just message me with a quick note as to what you've done and we're all good!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
ALL parts of this campaign -- the 10 cards, 5 stickers, lenticular, metal and wrapper are all designed and cleared through Xilam Animation approval processes. The printing companies are already lined up. This is my 27th Kickstarter (all 26 previous were all successful and while I'm still producing the previous two Kickstarter card series -- Manos: The Hands of Fate and Wolverton Series Three -- all responding backers have all received their rewards from all previous Kickstarters). I have an excellent record of delivering all products from all Kickstarters. Basically, the only risk of you NOT getting all these neat collectibles is if you don't even pledge! At the conclusion of a Kickstarter, once all payments are cleared and RIGHT before I publish cards I send out what is called a 'Mailing Address Survey'. This survey is where you tell me where to send your pledge rewards ... I can only mail a package if I know where it is being mailed. Kickstarter automatically emails the survey to everyone at the same time ... and I post an update when the surveys are going out. So when you get the mailing address survey be SURE to complete it and email it back to me. Will only take you about 2 minutes and it makes sure you get your stuff as quickly as possible. As always, if you have a question just message me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Sketch cards (art cards) have been a part of my creative job since 2005, and have worked for Topps Entertainment, Rittenhouse Archives, Perna Studios, RRParks Cards, Upper Deck, Iconic Creations, iCardz, Monsterwax, Viceroy Cards, and others. I've also created Illustrations for instructional, equestrian-related books and articles.
This project is a way for me to explore sketch cards and the people involved. I'm really hoping that it could be a way for me to give back to a genre, a community, that let me draw, sketch, paint, and explore what else I could possibly do. Sketch cards are, in the grand scale of things, largely unknown, and I'm hoping that this book can show new people the possibilities of collecting sketch cards. It's also a way for me - and therefore the reader - to get to know who the people involved in this world are by chatting with them just a little.
The financial amount on this Kickstarter is based on a cost to print approximately 60 PAPERBACK books. People who support the $200 levels and up will receive 1 (2 copies EACH at the $500 and $700 levels) HARDCOVER. They are very expensive to produce for a small-run (low number) project such as this, but you are guaranteed that you'll own a very limited edition of a high quality book. The softcover will be very limited edition as well, it is NOT sold in print ANYWHERE else!
Mock-up of what the PAPERBACK book will look like published. There might be a few minor changes in the fonts, but nothing else. A view of what the HARDCOVER will look like is forthcoming and will be shown in the project updates.
Above is a list of the collectors, art directors, and artists interviewed for this book.
A spread from the eBook.
Containing 42 interviews and lots and lots of artwork, I'm hoping this project creates a time capsule/print collection of art and thoughts.
The front of the promo card.
It was absolutely impossible to include enough art from a vast variety of artists and sketch card/trading card sets, so this book barely touches the surface.
Therefore, a stretch goal of this book is this: if it goes over the goal, I guarantee a second volume in 2021. The extra funds would help cover the costs of creating a similar book but containing all new artwork, a new perspective with different people, and give the ability to pay a few artists for original artwork. The incentives here feature my own work because I was so cheap (tee hee).
The back of the blank sketch card.
These are slightly thicker cards, excellent quality.
Hard cover books are available only at the $200 level and up because they are very expensive to produce in small numbers for a niche project such as this, as opposed to a large publisher producing books. However, you will be the owner/collector of a book that is guaranteed limited edition!
Stretch Goal: My first priority in attempting to have this volume published at least as a paperback, and limited hardcovers. Sketch/art cards are an awesome addition to a collection of nearly anything, and having a print compilation of various artists' artwork is something I really hope will happen. Ultimately, creating several volumes would make for a really nice archive of a multitude of artists in this niche world, and give printed voice to collectors and art directors as well.
Therefore, should this project "over fund", next year would see the release of at least one more volume featuring different artists and people. I'm already attempting to coordinate interviews in the hopes that a volume 2 will happen. 
I will have learned a lot from this project, and would be able to bring that with me to the next one, and I'd like to include original art from other artists, and not just myself.
Way down below are images of the prints, promo cards, and EXTREMELY limited Philly Alien cards. Two new prints will be forthcoming - I will post those images in the project updates.
4 x 6 inch print of Salacious Crumb, from an original painting by me, Ingrid Hardy.
4 x 6 inch card print from an original painting of a Walker on Jakku, painted by me, Ingrid Hardy.
4 x 6 inch print of the base card art for the Galaxy trading card set from Topps, by me, Ingrid Hardy.
Limited promo cards that were orginially destined to be available at the Philly Non Sport Show in early May 2020, cancelled because of Covid 19.
These are EXTREMELY limited! ONLY 5 exist. These are metal version of the previous promo cards (yes you can see my reflection in the cards) On the bottom left corner you'll see "AP 1/5" "AP 2/5" "AP 3/5" "AP 4/5" "AP5/5"
ALL books will have a hand stamped bookplate inside. This measures approximately 3 inches, and has room for your name or whatever you wish to write.
Update June 18, 2020: These just arrived! 100 6 x 9 inch presentation folders in which the various cards and prints will be inserted for shipping. Nothing super-fancy but I think it'll be a nice way to get the extras... ♥
These promo card sheets will arrive CUT for levels $70 and $100, and will be UNCUT and NUMBERED for levels $200 and up
These promo card sheets will arrive CUT for levels $70 and $100, and will be UNCUT and NUMBERED for levels $200 and up
Update June 23, 2020: STRETCH GOAL REACHED! Well, since a while ago, to be fair, but I thought it should be stated. Because of the support and interest shown in this project,there will be a volume 2! 
Planning and work on that won't begin until this fall (my focus right now is this dream project), but a list of people has slowly begun populating already, including 3 special guests, one of which has already been hinted at.
Update July 1, 2020: SECOND STRETCH GOAL REACHED! There will also be a 9 card sheet included with all levels from $70 and up! $70 and $100 levels will get the sheet cut into cards, and ALL levels $200 and up will get the sheets UNCUT and NUMBERED.
There will be a glossy, high quality "sheet" that will be printed, with 9  promo cards on it. For the $70 and $100 levels, you'll get them - cut -  within the presentation folder with the sketch cards and other promo  cards. For the $200 levels and up, you'll receive UNCUT sheets, hand  numbered, slipped inside of the books.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This book is already written and is currently published as an eBook, so there will be no delay in creating the book. There will be some small changes in the book to make print-ready, of course, and there will be pages within the book for collecting signatures from the artists, should you with to do so, and a page with an Ex Libris bookplate. These are changes that take about a day to do - no risk there. 

The time frame from the end of the Kickstarter to when you receive your book should be approximately 6 weeks - it could be less, it could be a little more, depending on the mailing system. The printer has informed me that the time frame for them is usually 2-3 weeks and then a week for shipping from them to me. Then I package and mail (the book plates will take a short bit of time, depending on how many there are to print) everything to you. 

The costs involved with this project are reflected in the goal and are also meant to cover the fees from Kickstarter. They do not include any profit to me.

 I reply to everything, so if you have ANY questions - ask away! My email is: ingridhardy32@gmail.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Illustrious Gratitude ♥
support.descp: You believe in this project as much as I do - and I thank you for this! You have my respect and gratitude.

support.title: Free Ebook Level
support.descp:
At this level, receive a free PDF version of the book, as well as my deepest gratitude for supporting this project!
INCLUDES:
ebook

support.title: eBook, Promo Card
support.descp:
Like the previous levels, you receive an eBook version of the book (for your illustrious digital files), but you'll also receive a promo card in your mailbox.
INCLUDES:
ebook
Promo Card
Prints

support.title: Previous, SOFTCOVER book, 5 Sketch Cards
support.descp:
At this level, you get the previous rewards (ebook) but 2 prints instead of 1, AND a physical, SOFTCOVER copy of the print book. But wait, there's more (so sorry, I'm a TV addict since my youth, lol)... You'll also get 5 blank sketch/art cards that were designed and printed especially to go with this project delivered to you with the book. With these cards you can commission any of the artists you wish!
Shipping costs might vary slightly depending where you are.
INCLUDES:
ebook
Promo Card
2× Prints
Softcover Print Book
5× Blank Sketch Cards

support.title: Prints, SOFTOVER Book, Cards, Bookmark
support.descp:
At this level, not only will you receive the previous rewards (ebook, print book) but you'll receive 3 prints instead of 2, 10 blank sketch cards for commissioning art instead of 5, a metal bookmark, and a HAND STAMPED BOOKPLATE within the book! I'm designing a black and white image to be used on a stamp (3 x 4 inches) and this will be hand stamped inside your copy of the book. This will give you (if you wish) an area to sign the book as yours for your own library. You will also be mentioned in the book as a supporter of the print book!
Because it takes a bit of time to hand stamp, these book may arrive a bit later than the previous levels.
INCLUDES:
ebook
Promo Card
3× Prints
Softcover Print Book
10× Blank Sketch Cards
Metal Bookmark
Shoutout in this book (volume 1)

support.title: All Previous but a HARDCOVER of book.
support.descp:
The hardcovers are very pricey to print and will be VERY limited editions. This level gets you everything in the previous, but the softcover will be HARDCOVER instead!
INCLUDES:
ebook
10× Blank Sketch Cards
Metal Bookmark
Prints
Promo Card
Shoutout in this book (volume 1)
HARDCOVER Print Book

support.title: Previous, 2 HARDCOVER Books, Shoutout
support.descp:
At this level, not only will you receive the previous rewards, but you'll get TWO HARDCOVER copies of the book, and 20 blank sketch cards. You will also get a shout-out in the book as a major supporter of volume 2, which already has a few new projects being planned. You will also have the chance to receive a hand sketched, one of a kind sketch card from one of the artists in the book INCLUDED with the shipment! The number of cards available will depend on the availability of the artists.
INCLUDES:
ebook
Promo Card
3× Prints
20× Blank Sketch Cards
Metal Bookmark
Shout Out/Mention in BOTH THIS BOOK AND VOLUME 2!
Shoutout in this book (volume 1)
2× HARDCOVER Print Book
Original Sketch Card from an Artist in the Book

support.title: All previous, and original Artist Proof
support.descp:
At this level, not only will you receive all the previous rewards, but you are a diehard supporter of something very genre. You will basically guarantee a volume 2 of the book, because this level will certainly help ensure this project funds. You will receive (for free) 2 Artist Proof cards from me, Ingrid Hardy. The choice will vary on the cards I have available, but I have a selection for you to choose from - Star Wars included. I will contact you concerning the choice of sets and what you'd like.
The cards will arrive after the book, in order to give me time to paint them - you will have continuous updates on how they are advancing.
You will also receive a hand sketched, original sketch card from one of the artists in the book! The number available will depend on the artists available.
INCLUDES:
ebook
Promo Card
3× Prints
20× Blank Sketch Cards
Metal Bookmark
Shout Out/Mention in BOTH THIS BOOK AND VOLUME 2!
2× HARDCOVER Print Book
2 Original Artist Proof Cards - Your Choice Within Available Card
Original Sketch Card from an Artist in the Book
Shoutout in this book (volume 1)

updates.update_content:
And that's it! The last boxes are going out today and tomorrow (there are still 8 people who have not given me their mailing addresses... books will be kept aside for you). As there were more people than I ever expected, and I made the mistake of ordering some things like prints before the Kickstarter was finished so I could be more timely, I did run out of prints and presentation folders. Only 6 short, but still. Lesson learned. For the next time, I order NOTHING until it is over and will be able to do a better job on that.
For those who missed a print or presentation folder, I included and extra 9-card uncut sheet, in hopes to make up for it. I won't re-order 100 folders when not all will be used. However more sketch cards were ordered, so I'll be making up for anything missed with the said uncut sheets, and You can get a lot of use (I hope) out of the sketch cards.

Hey Everyone! 
This is a long post, so do feel free to get yourself some refreshments, or a cocktail (even better) 🤭
This week marks the beginning of the end... of this project. The first two levels have had their rewards delivered (the PDF ebook), and in case you missed it, and for everyone else because it is part of the project, the link to download the book is here:  https://payhip.com/b/3vAS   Please use the code KICKSTARTER2020   and you'll be able to download the PDF to whatever device you wish. The PDF is slightly different that the print - I think I've already posted about that - the ebook has fewer images but the text is mostly the same. More corrections were made in the book version.

updates.update_userinfo: Inserts Have Arrived and a Few More Finished Sketch Cards
updates.update_content:
Below are the inserts that have arrived and I'm really happy with them. They really look great! I'll begin numbering the ones that will stay as sheets as of today (mind you, you can cut them up when you get them if you wish), to be sure that task is complete before the books arrive. Speaking of which, those two deliveries are all that is left! They haven't yet left their respective print locations, but it shouldn't be long now. If no news is received tomorrow, it's then fairly sure that next week I'll get a "ready to deliver" notification.
So these are the sheets, and below are two more cards I've completed for inclusion (3 more on the table underway)...

Hope you have all been having a beautiful summer, despite the insane-ness of 2020. 
In this update, I get to announce the book is completely paid for, proofed, and being printed! It's ALL done, whatever errors are in the book will haunt me forever now. Now it's just a waiting period until they are actually in my studio, but as we spea- er, um... type, I'm shopping for the final shipping supplies, to be ready when they arrive. The tuck-in sheets should arrive earlier than the books, so I'll show you photos of those when they get here.

updates.update_userinfo: Updates, Ebook Download, and Marsha Parkins Art Cards
updates.update_content:
Three things in this update: 
First... It is off to print! Karen has confirmed to me that I'll be getting the invoices for everything this weekend - Monday at the latest - and once that happens, the turnover time is between 2-3 weeks. This is tentative of course, as shipping is generally slow now. The paperback is being printed in the US, and the hardcovers are being printed in Ontario, Canada. Hardcovers are heavier, and for some reason would carry a very high duty fee (the cross boarder thing), and shipping will be relatively quick here. The tuck in sheet (I just think that tuck in sheet idea from Richard Parks is great) will be printed and shipped shortly. That takes very little time, relatively speaking.

It's August already! The summer is flying by. Everything is now complete and ready to leave, as soon as the books are printed. Karen has informed me it's happening - on their end - this week, and apologizes greatly for the delay. Normally things go much faster she said, but quarantine has (as I've mentioned ad nauseum) slowed everything down. But no worries, it is slowly moving along.
In the meantime, the second of the 4 artists who are returning cards for inclusion in the package is Laura Inglis! She has drawn 2 beautiful cards for random insert and you can see them below.

updates.update_userinfo: Preview 1 of Sketch Card Inserts and Update
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, I hope you are all able to take advantage of summer, at least a little! Here in Quebec, Canada, we still cannot enter the US as tourists, nor can we yet visit the Canadian Maritimes. Basically we can only stay within the province itself, but I'm not complaining at all. Many people, everywhere, have it much worse, and we're having great weather to boot. Hope you are all well.
In this update, I get to show you a few cards that will be randomly inserted in book packages. They were not part of the incentives - these are done by a few artists as "surprise" extras, on the same sketch card stock of which you'll be getting blanks of (pertaining levels).

And so I'm back, and so excited, just can't hide it.... 😅 It's (kind of) funny how the absence of pain makes you realize the absence of pain. How weird is that  😶
Anyway! Now we have come to the fun part of this project. Getting the last bits ready for print. I still have not gotten a firm time for how long it will take from printing the books to me receiving them. It is a certainty that Covid-19 has slowed shipping times, there is no avoidance of that, and personnel in most companies have been reduced, so I'm guessing it won't be super-fast (though the sketch cards were printed and shipped very speedy-like). As long as the quality is excellent, I personally don't mind a bit of a wait.

updates.update_userinfo: The Art of Sketch Cards is a reality!
updates.update_content:
First and foremost, thank you to all of you for your support of this project. I'm not overstating when I say it is because of your support there is a volume 1 and will be a volume two. As previously mentioned, I'm on the road currently, but as of Monday morning I will be in my studio and will begin sending out the PDF version of the book to everyone.
Do remember that the PDF version is slightly different than the print version! Because the print version is larger, there was more room to add some more artwork into it, but all the text and articles are the same.

campaign.story:
NEW PROPS Video!!!
IF ANY PROP in this video looks like a GREAT BACKER REWARD, be sure to message us or COMMENT — we might be able to do it for you!
Origins of the Movie
In 1972, legendary comic artist Richard Corben (Heavy Metal/Fantagor/Dark Horse) teamed up with writer Jan Strnad (Disney, DC Comics, Heavy Metal) and published a story entitled “To Meet the Faces You Meet." J. Allen Williams (Darkstar, Everything) managed to purchase a copy of this story at the age of 12, successfully hiding the explicit underground copy from his mother, and tended a growing seed of an idea for a movie for nearly half a century.
In the early 90’s, Williams met Corben and they collaborated on projects over several decades and became friends. In 2016 J. Allen produced a one-minute pitch video for “Faces” and sent it to Rich, who immediately flipped out and introduced the producer to Jan Strnad — and they began to plan. J. Allen wrote a first draft screenplay based on the 16-page comic, and began to work with Jan to refine it into a shooting script, co-writing the final version together. Fast forward to 2020 and the entire movie has been produced! Extensive CGI animated work is now waiting for live-action actors to be added, similar to TRON or The Last Starfighter, but in 4K with modern animation techniques.

Patton Oswalt’s performance voicing the lead animated character of MEAD has already been recorded. Now it's time to cast name actors to play the lead live action on-screen characters. 
PLAY

A PRE-PRODUCTION trailer with no actors (actors are the reason for this KS campaign)
Synopsis
The military thought they had created the ultimate weapon－a soldier (Friz) linked symbiotically with an artificially intelligent spaceship (MEAD: Mobile Extrasensory Autonomous Deceptor) with the ability to project illusions so real that they cannot be distinguished from reality. Together, Friz and MEAD became the most deadly fighting force the world had seen.

There was one problem: An errant bit of programming instilled MEAD with a conscience and pacifist tendencies that made him and his human symbiote useless for military purposes. Scheduled for "decommission," Friz and MEAD go on the run, pursued by bounty hunters and an admiral with a personal axe to grind.
 The Goals
We are setting our minimum goal at $25,000, but hope to raise up to $60,000+ to hire as many A-List Hollywood Actors as possible. As you know, much of that amount will go to Kickstarter’s cut and the printing of backer prizes — so that is baked in. We are looking at this as a four-phase campaign that will allow us to minimally cast the role of “Friz”, but the top three tiers will allow us to add more.
 $25,000:  We will be able to cast our lead male character “Friz” to play opposite Patton Oswalt (already hired, paid and has performed), pay Kickstarter their fee, have prizes printed and signed, and ship them to our backers.
 $40,000:  We will be able to cast our antagonist “Admiral Gillette” with a great name-actor as well as our initial goal.
 $60,000:  We will be able to add one or two more name actors to play one or both of our female leads, “Tam” and “Phoebe”.
 Over $60K:  Any money we raise will be used to employ A-list actors. Negotiations on price are always very fluid, and certainly are at this juncture prior to funding this endeavor. Funds beyond our main goals here could also be used to pay character actors to play the 25-ish supporting roles. Of course we hope to reach our stretch goals, but hitting our 1st tier funding goal would be absolutely wonderful and vital to the success of our film.
 The Actors
Though we have only finalized Patton Oswalt, other actors will be cast and contracted to play various roles once we have funding.
 FRIZ:  As our male lead, this actor must carry the entire film and interact with the animated “MEAD” character voiced by Oswalt. Friz is the imaginative half of the duo, imagining and creating the illusions that MEAD projects. Initially regarding MEAD as just another robot, Friz comes to realize that MEAD is much more.
 GILLETTE:  Admiral Gillette views our two symbiotes as the greatest threat facing the military establishment, treasonous pacifists who must be eliminated for the security of the planet Earth. Plus, Friz carries Gillette's severed hand aboard the MEAD ship, so the grudge is personal.
 TAM:  Tam is the technician responsible for MEAD'S programming — pacifist tendencies and all. During the process of creating MEAD and Friz's symbiotic relationship, a love developed between Tam and Friz. But a daring escape ended all of that, and Friz is left with nothing but a holographic "Tam" who can do anything he programs her to do,  but she can never surprise him.
 PHOEBE:  Phoebe is a tough cookie, an escaped convict who finds her fate intertwined with that of Friz and MEAD. As a flesh-and-blood woman, she is the best bet－albeit a risky one－to take Tam's place in Friz's heart.
 25+ SECONDARY CHARACTERS:  Fighter pilots, bounty hunters, technicians and extras are needed to flesh out the world of Friz and MEAD — about 25 actors.
 Diversity in Casting Process 
We plan to cast actors from a wide range of cultures and backgrounds, with an intentional focus on showing what the world might look like in the future. This film will feature strong, commanding female characters, reflecting the importance of representing them in leadership roles. 
 Our Schedule
COVID-19 has placed you, us, and the entire world on hold, but all projections assure us that this too shall soon end, hopefully by mid-summer. Once our campaign has funded, we plan to cast and schedule shooting immediately if possible, flying actors to our studio in Missouri for an aggressive production schedule.
We have already cast character actors to play some of the smaller roles. Nearly all have played parts in films before, but are not as recognizable as the people we are compensating with funds from this campaign will be.
As pointed out earlier, the HUGE-budget part of this film is complete — every scene is finished and edited (even the sound effects & music). All that is left on the docket is casting, filming, and compositing the actors (shot in our green-screen studio) into the final film.
 Worldwide Distribution 
We’ve already been approached by Heavy Metal magazine (they produced a 1980 animated film featuring our partner Rich Corben’s art and story) for an interview. We have received tentative interest from a distributor in LA, and also one out of Singapore – and we’ve barely even talked about this project publicly prior to this Kickstarter Campaign! WITH HELP FROM YOU and the casting of some great screen actors, we will have no problem finding an audience for “To Meet the Faces You Meet.”
Prize Fulfillment
Once we are funded, the comic book and posters go to print. That process will take a few weeks, and then the copies to be autographed by RICH CORBEN, JAN STRNAD and myself will be shipped around the country (Jan in LA, Rich in KC, and myself in southern MO) to be signed. Those will be shipped immediately to backers all over the world.
The BluRay of the film will go out to all that wanted one once the film has been edited and special “promo” BluRays specifically for YOU backers will be duplicated, packaged and shipped. We project production to be complete by late spring of 2021 – virus situation allowing. But rest assured, nothing will stop the completion of this film, (even Covid-19) and as soon as possible. 80% of the project is complete already (you can view many scenes with Patton Oswalt in our pre-pro trailer and other videos we're sharing with you).
 Our Budget
Even after including our stretch goal of $60K +, this film falls under Hollywood’s “Micro-Budget” number at under $250,000. Low budget films out of Hollywood can be $10M.
But there is a huge asterisk here…*
The company producing the film (Parallax Studio LLC) has completed everything to date in-house since 2016 — animation work that would cost tens of millions in Hollywood produced by any company there — like over $100M (check out what the average Pixar movie costs to make). But Parallax has not charged themselves for their own work, so this part of the budget has been absorbed by the studio as production proceeded. There is a small amount of out-of-pocket that the studio has also absorbed and paid to date.
The studio has spent roughly $30K for Mr. Oswalt, prop construction, costumes and other ancillary needs to date. It is projected another $30K will be spent outside of this Kickstarter casting budget effort to complete the film.
This makes our budget (if fully funded) a bit under $250K – *not including the studio’s in-house investment in writing, design, animation hours, and business coordination. 
PLAY

Why produce this movie?
Jeff explains and describes the prizes backers will receive in the above video.
The story has bounced around in the Director/Producer’s mind for nearly fifty years since purchasing the comic story in a small Springfield, MO head shop in 1972.
J. Allen (Jeff) Williams considered producing it in 1999, but decided to put Darkstar: The Interactive Movie on the front burner. In 2013 the idea to produce "Faces" was again considered, but the film Everything was greenlit and completed. Those projects had $500K and $150K budgets respectively. Darkstar was released in November of 2010, but the distribution of Everything has been held back until Faces is complete. The planets lined up in 2016 and Jeff was looking for a new title to produce.
So three guys from the Midwestern United States (Jan from Kansas/Jeff & Rich from Missouri – both Kansas City Art Institute Alumni) decided to combine their skills, story & art, and embark on an animated journey that has led us here. They are passionate about their story and the amazing characters that Jan created so long ago.
Jan and Rich originally wrote and illustrated this fantastic story long ago as young and starving artists, making virtually no money from it. Their passion was storytelling — they were not the most aggressive capitalists. This describes most artists, writers, actors, and musicians at their core. At 50¢ a copy, the lion’s share of the proceeds went to underground publisher/distributor Kitchen Sink Comics.
This time around, only the creators of this IP (Jeff, Jan and Rich) are in control over the finished product, and we are poised to do what it takes to take "Faces" into the public sphere as a feature film. Its success or failure is in our hands, not Hollywood’s, and that’s the way they want it.
Just look at the work we have done thus far — and we are close to the finish line.
THE PRIZES
There are several combinations of prize options available to Faces backers. Here are descriptions of each component.
YOUR NAME IN THE CREDITS: 
Regardless of pledge amount, every Kickstarter backer will have their name listed in the credits.
Most KS projects offering “your name in the credits” put your name in a credits sequence attached to their movie. We put your name in TWO places —  one is in the film itself as a SPECIAL feature on the BluRay disk, PLUS your name will be listed in the Special Edition comic book prize.  And this is EACH AND EVERY of you. Even the smallest amount of contribution to our casting budget will get the backer listed in these two locations.
GRAND PRIZE ASSOCIATE PRODUCER PRIZE:
There will be a grand prize available listing you as Associate Producer in the crew credits! (See photo above) This prize also includes a Limited Edition Signed Comic (#2/200), an unsigned extra comic copy, BOTH large SIGNED posters, both art prints, a Blu-ray copy of the film, and your name in the credits. THERE IS ONLY ONE of these offered, so get it early.
ADMIRAL GILLETTE'S SEVERED HAND PROP: 
Admiral Gillette’s severed hand.
Another Special Grand Prize is a screen-used prop — Gillette’s severed hand! Turns out the Admiral loses it while trying to kill MEAD, but his loss is your gain. This prize will ship immediately after the campaign is funded and comes with a Limited Edition Signed Comic (#1/200), an unsigned extra comic copy, BOTH large SIGNED posters, both art prints, a Blu-ray copy of the film, and your name in the credits.
OPTION: We have TWO of these props, the screen-used version and a backup created by our prop department for safety.  We intend on sending out the screen-used version to the backer of this reward, but it will be shipped once the scene it is required for has been shot, sometime in late 2020 or early 2021.  If the lucky backer of this prize prefers, we can immediately ship the backup version OR they can wait for the screen-used hand.  We'll reach out after the campaign to find out what your preference is. There is only ONE of these available, so get it before it's gone.
SPECIAL EDITION AUTOGRAPHED “TO MEET THE FACES YOU MEET” reprint: 
"Fever Dreams" Special Edition reprint (left).
This special item could be a Kickstarter campaign of its own! The comic art has been re-mastered and the magazine enlarged substantially from 7”w x 10”h up to a huge 8.5”w x 12.5”h. (See it in Jeff's video) It features the movie poster as one cover; flip it over, and you will see Rich Corben’s original art for the Fever Dreams comic. Four pages will contain EVERY Faces Kickstarter backer in print, and a thank you message to all of you. And of course, the entirety of the uncensored 16-page story by Jan Strnad and Richard Corben is reproduced in all of its visceral, underground comic glory.
There will be both autographed and unsigned versions available. 
Richard will sign his cover art and Jeff & Jan will sign the movie version. This is a gorgeous collectible, and ONLY available here — this special edition will not appear anywhere else. There will be a limit of only 200 comics signed and numbered, so if you want a signed version, get in on it early in the campaign. The total print run including the unsigned editions will depend on the number of pledges we receive.
AUTOGRAPHED POSTERS:
24x30" film poster designed by J. Allen Williams.
There will be two designs offered at a limited signed/numbered run of 100 for each design. One features the “movie version” (shown above) with MEAD featured (approximately 24x30). The other is the comic version (shown below) with Richard Corben's famous Fever Dreams cover (approximately 21x30). These will be shipped separately in tubes worldwide.
These are big and glossy, rare collectibles on heavy stock, and will not be sold elsewhere — only backers of our movie can get their hands on one of these babies!
ART PRINTS (not signed): 
12.5x18 art print of the original comic cover by Richard Corben.
There will be two designs of these art prints, the same art as used for our autographed posters, just smaller.  The “movie version” print is 14.5”w x 18”h and the Richard Corben-illustrated version will be 12.5”w x 18”h. They are great collectibles in their own right, and again, not offered anywhere but here. On request, the Director (J. Allen) will sign your print for no extra cost (message us after the campaign). Autographs for Jan and Rich on this item are not available.
BLURAY of the FINISHED FILM: 
"To Meet the Faces You Meet" blu-ray.
This is the prize above all, the subject of all of this much-appreciated fuss and attention. A copy of the finished film for YOU before ANYONE else sees it. Our backers will be the first audience that Faces will premier before. It will run at about 94 minutes (including credits) chock full of slam-pow-kablooey action, comedy, drama, breathtaking special animated effects, and a starship-load of zany robot fun injected with a T-Rex, pteranadons, a giant toy robot, a rubber duck bigger than a trash truck, the Titanic, an ugly squid-faced monster, and a vague Kubrick easter egg reference to boot.
Of course this prize will take a little more time to get to you, (we have to finish it) but we will be sharing the progress of this film production to keep you informed on many social media pages and through media interviews during production. The earliest we can ship promotional pre-sales Blu-rays to backers will most likely be late spring of 2021. The COVID-19 crisis may protract that a bit, especially if it resurges in the fall as predicted, but rest assured that this film is nearly finished right now — nothing will keep us from crossing the finish line for our backers.
We apologize for the patience required for this prize, but believe me when I say — it will be well worth the wait. Plus, we have plenty of other prizes listed above that will go out toot-sweet (that means really fast).
FOLLOW US AT “To Meet the Faces You Meet” on FACEBOOK.
https://www.facebook.com/groups/209691127118509/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The purpose of this Kickstarter is to raise funds to pay name actors to play one, two, or more characters. Without name actors, a feature film has little hope of finding a large audience, and big-name Hollywood actors ain’t cheap. We have many actors on our roster that would do a fine job in any of our roles, but the fact is that most distributors won’t even consider a film without recognizable faces. We want our film to find its audience, and we need your help to do it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: ALL ACTORS AND CREW have committed to our shooting schedule from Sept. 20 to Sept. 29th.  Covid be damned, we're rolling over it like the dried husk of road-kill armadillo.  STAY TUNED!!!!!

updates.update_userinfo: WARDROBE TEST FOR KASSANDRA WRIGHT as TAM
updates.update_content: We  are completing all of our Wardrobe as we creep toward a safe date to  shoot our talented cast. In fact, we have about 90% of it all finished  and need to develop costumes for about four actors.

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR NAME IS IN THE CREDITS!
updates.update_content: We have just completed the first rough draft of the credits.  Some of the "cast and crew" items are NOT final, but all of the "name" actors are contracted.  After the first set of credits (cast & crew) there is a short story "stinger" (actors not yet shot), then after that is the listings of your names in the "backer credits".

As the nation gets vaccinated, we are preparing to reach out to cast and crew to see what their status is regarding getting their two Moderna/Phizers or their one dose J&J.  Once everyone is taken care of and we get a green light from the CDC and the Screen Actor's Guild, we will begin scheduling our next shoot.  Stay tuned.  Jeff
COVID-19 has not stopped Jan Strnad and I from finalizing our shooting script.  Nor will it stop our primary shoot production to take place this summer or fall...

Hello All,
We at Parallax Studio are anxious to proceed on our shoot including Robert Picardo, Samuel Hunt, and other actors that the Kickstarter campaign you helped back.  Based on SAG (Screen Actors Guild) and CDC recommendations, we have decided to schedule and resume production on "To Meet the Faces You Meet" once all cast and crew have received their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.  In the meantime we are finalizing wardrobe, and other pre-production tasks that we are able to move on.  STAY TUNED, we will keep you all posted.

TODAY IS THE LAST DAY, only 10 hours until our INDIEGOGO campaign ends to help back our feature film “To Meet the Faces You Meet” starring Robert Picardo, Samuel Hunt, Patton Oswalt and Patrick Warburton. There are lots of great prizes including signed items from Heavy Metal comic artist Richard Corben.
VISIT: https://igg.me/at/tmtfym

updates.update_userinfo: ONLY FIVE DAYS LEFT ON OUR INDIEGOGO
updates.update_content: ONLY FIVE DAYS LEFT to get one of these Corben signed posters. Only one of the “movie” versions exists and six of the “Fever Dreams”  design. They are among the last items hand-signed by Richard, a prolific  contributor of Heavy Metal Magazine. They are also signed by writer Jan  Strnad and Director Jeff Williams to promote the upcoming film based on  “To Meet the Faces You Meet”, a story written by Strnad and illustrated  by Corb in 1972.

updates.update_userinfo: IF YOU HAVE NOT RECIEVED YOUR REWARD...
updates.update_content:
Hey there, valued backers.
There are about 16 of you that we have rewards packed up, but have NOT received your address information.  Some of you were not aware this has to be done in order to receive your awesome perks.  IF YOU HAVE NOT received posters, art prints, or special edition comics, PLEASE fill out your information or contact us.  THANK YOU, Jeff
