campaign.story:
FINALLY! Zorro fans and card collectors are getting the card series they've always wanted ... It is HUGE! With TONS of bells and whistles celebrating the 100th Anniversary of Zorro, the first masked superhero! The series is coming soon and with this Kickstarter campaign you have the chance to add to your collection not just a box of cards but also a MASTER SET and Kickstarter Exclusives (which will be available only during this Kickstarter!). Current plan is to have the series released late September or early October  (there are a LOT of moving parts and this is card series is REALLY complex).  
The Card series includes:
- A 180 card set broken up into numerous subsets covering a visual history of Zorro from his beginnings in Argosy Magazine through the silent film era, the 1930s/1940s movies and serials, 1950s TV show and the more recent movies as well as the comic books of the 1950s on up through American Mythology's current Zorro Comic Book series. These 180 cards also feature 18 different newly created Anaglyph 3D cards by the maestro of 3D: Christian LeBlanc!
- A lovely selection of 'flicker' Lenticular Motion Cards!
- Limited Edition Graphite Realism portraits by long-time official RRParksCARDS artist Macarie Claudiu (who did the official portraits for card series The Three Stooges, Sharknado, Quatermass and the Pit, and Mystery Science Theater 3000).
- Sticker cards of classic Zorro movie one-sheet posters.
- Beautiful American Mythology Zorro comic cover cards created by those great folks at Faerie Metal.
- Four different genuine 35mm Zorro Movie Theater-Used Cell Cards.
- FREE pair of 3D glasses in each box or Master Set plus a FREE Zorro Mask you can wear!
The  entire card series is designed and already in the first stages of the approval process.  I will be starting production of some of the more challenging cards while this Kickstarter is running just as soon as approvals from licensing are in hand ... and afterwards, when funding takes place, I'll be sending the rest to press.  
Every pledge will get Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE production cards and bonus goodies available nowhere else!
Here's  a visual 'grand tour' of the project:     "The 100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Card Series:  
The series of cards starts off with several annotated checklist cards covering the history of Zorro from 1919 through NOW! 
Next, the series features cards of the silent movie era with Douglas Fairbanks -- lobby cards and one-sheets in full color of The Mark of Zorro and Don Q: Son of Zorro.
Next, the series covers a graphic history of Zorro's Fighting Legion serials (poster and lobby card art).
Next, the series continues with the movie posters (foreign and domestic) and one-sheets of  The Mark of Zorro and The Sign of Zorro (Tyrone Power and Linda Darnell), Zorro the Gay Blade (George Hamilton) and The Sign of Zorro (Guy Williams).
Next comes the subsets of the modern era movies The Mask of Zorro and The Legend of Zorro (Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta-Jones).
Next, the series continues with the classic comic book covers and interior art of the 1950s-60s comic books in full color!
Next, 18 beautiful Anaglyph 3D cards by Christian LeBlanc of the 1950s Zorro TV series starring Guy Williams. And of COURSE I'm including a free pair of 3D glasses with all boxes and Master Sets.
Next, an 82-card subset featuring every single Guy Williams Zorro TV show episode with storylines AND the 4 1-hour specials.
Next, a special full color card subset of Guy Williams as Zorro (with Sign of Zorro lobby cards on the backs).
This series also features special chase and hit cards including:
Lenticular Motion Cards (currently in the design phase -- but don't worry, with MST3K Series 3 I found the best source for flicker lenticular style cards!).
Genuine 35mm Zorro Cell cards (3 single cell and 1 double cell cards to collect) -- each one with a unique cell inside the card ...
Limited Edition Claudiu Macarie portrait cards ...
Full Color Zorro stickers ...
Metal box topper cards featuring the amazing comic book covers of American Mythology ...
Genuine Original Art Sketch Cards by TOP NAMES in the hobby ...
Authentic original production printing plates ... and MORE!
Anyone who collected RRParksCARDS' Mystery Science Theater 3000, The Three Stooges, Sharknado and other series already knows I'm a fan of producing packaging with bonus mini clip-out cards ... and Zorro is no exception. Each box will have over 30 mini double-sided cards to clip and collect!   


 And there you have it! The GRAND VISUAL TOUR of what's coming ... and what you'll get ... in your "100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Card set! 
What's in the box?
Each  and every full, sealed box of "The 100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Card Series you will receive all 180 base and subset cards (a complete set) PLUS a FREE pair of 3D glasses and a Zorro mask ... plus you're guaranteed chase cards: 1 lenticular motion card, 1 sticker, 1 Genuine Movie Cell Relic Card, 1 Limited Edition Macarie Portrait Art Card, 1 printing plate, 1 Original Art Sketch Card and 1 Genuine Production printing Plate, 1 Limited Edition Metal Box Topper Card  ... plus some bonus goodies (including the 30+ mini clipout cards printed right on the packaging).
What's in the MASTER SET?
If you want the MASTER SET you will get all 180 different cards, the complete set of lenticular motion cards (currently planned to be 6 different), all 4 different Cell Relic Cards (each with a unique cell or pair of cells -- no two cards are alike), all 7 Limited Edition Macarie Portrait Art Cards, all 10 different Zorro Stickers, all 9 different American Mythology Comic Book Cover Metal Cards, at LEAST 1 genuine printing plate AND 1 Original Art Sketch Card plus MORE! The Master Set gets you EVERYTHING! 

SO  HOW DO I GET ALL THIS AMAZING STUFF AND SATIATE MY DIRE NEED FOR ZORRO TRADING CARD COLLECTIBLES??? 
It's  easy. You'll notice there are many different pledge levels -- levels to fit all  collector budgets.  Please note, though, that a full MASTER SET will only be available during this Kickstarter ... after the Kickstarter ends a MASTER SET will NOT be available. So if you ever want to have a complete MASTER SET of "The 100th Anniversary of Zorro" then this is the ONLY time it will be available.
Level  1: $2 You get ONE promo card for the "100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Card Series. 
Level  2: $5 You  get 10 different "100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Cards (random but all different)
Level  3: $49  You  get the FULL sealed "100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Cards box with all 180 different cards PLUS the random chase cards mentioned above. Boxes pledged on during the Kickstarter are guaranteed a sketch card.
Level  4: $88 You  get the MASTER SET with EVERYTHING! A complete master set with all the chase and special production cards mentioned above. Meaning all Master Sets come with a sketch card.
Level 5: $140 You get a full sealed box (Level 3) PLUS a full MASTER SET (Level 4) PLUS bonus goodies. This means a at this level you get TWO sketch cards (one in the box and one in the Master Set. AND at this level I'll be loading up on bonus goodies, too!). And just to see who READS everything, those pledging on the Box plus Master pledge level will get a BONUS printing plate with their package! 
Level  6: $175  At  this level you get FOUR of the Level 3 sealed boxes. Guaranteed all your chase cards will be different and you get 4 genuine Original Art Sketch Cards PLUS bonus goodies. This means you get FOUR total sketch cards.
Level 7: $350 Ideally suited for 'live breakers' and resellers. At the $350 level you get TEN (10) sealed boxes with the guarantee that ALL 4 cell cards, all 7 Limited Edition Macarie Portrait Art Cards, all 10 Stickers, all 6 Lenticular Motion Cards and all 9 American Mythology Comic Book Cover Metal Box Toppers will be included. PLUS there will be a BUNCH of bonus material (errors, proofs, uncut panels, oddities and/or other goodies will be loaded in). At this 10-box level you are guaranteed TEN sketch cards!

Questions  and Answers:
Q:  I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do  I go about it?  
A:  Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable  to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no  worries. 
--------------- 
Q:  When will the "100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Card Series ship? 
A:  The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of September or early October. This series, though, is a complicated one so if things get hectic with coordinating many different printing companies and licensing approvals and other moving part then delays MIGHT happen. But most of you know me pretty well by now that if I'm late for some reason getting shipping done I keep everyone informed and do my best to be on time. I'm good about  posting updates and communications so will keep everyone in the loop.  I do,  though, ask for patience in advance. This is my 22nd Kickstarter and I've published over 30 different trading card series in the last 5 years ... so I've got decent experience and am generally accurate when it comes to shipping and production deadlines and timeframes. 
 --------------------- 
Q:  I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two  boxes? Or two 'Master Sets'?  
A:  If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ...  then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge  amount. Be SURE to message me if you do this explaining what you did. I'll check  and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine. The way I believe it's done is  after you pledge you click to view/manage your pledge and then you change the  amount of your pledge to reflect everything you want in your package. So, for  example, if you want to pledge on two master sets you just pledge on ONE ... After  your pledge is entered you can click on view/manage your pledge and change the  amount of your pledge to reflect adding on additional goodies.
----------------- 
Q:  Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or  through a catalog? 
A:  This is my 22nd Kickstarter over the last 5 years. I've found that pre-selling a  card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of  cards and boxes (especially special production cards that are pricey to do ... such as metal cards). It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a  limited basis. Once the Kickstarter is done I will have a good idea of what the  total 'sealed box' needs will be for a production run to provide Kickstarter  backers AND other customers and resellers (when the series is offered through distributors and  retail outlets). A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious  collectors FIRST before ANYONE else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise  some flexibility on providing 'bonus stuff' for backers ... once the Kickstarter is  over the only planned retail/wholesale activity for series three is simply the basic sealed box with 180 cards and some chase cards ... and as mentioned, MASTER SETS will be for sale ONLY during the Kickstarter. 
ADD ON GOODIES:
 If you want something not listed just let me know and if it's possible we'll do it. Add On prices are postpaid in the US. If you're outside the US let me know before doing the add on so I can research postage costs to your country. And of course if you have any questions just ask! My goal is to make sure you have fun with your collection and it's everything you want it to be. 
----------------------- 
If  you have a question not answered here please just ask -- you can message me  directly through Kickstarter and I will respond as quickly as possible. It is  better to message me than to post a comment. Kickstarter shows me MESSAGES as  soon as they are posted but is not consistent with showing me 'comments' (plus Kickstarter will show me someone has commented ... but they don't show me where the comment is -- if it is a comment on an update please note there are 100s of updates spread over 20 different Kickstarters ... meaning a 'comment' is a needle in the haystack. If you want me to see your comment, question, etc. send it as a MESSAGE).  If you can't figure out how to  message on Kickstarter then just contact me through my RRParksCARDS.com website.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

Risks? Well I suppose an asteroid could come hurtling through space and land on my head. Otherwise, this is my 22nd Kickstarter Campaign... and I've published dozens of other card series over the last 5 years (including eight different Three Stooges series, Gary Saves the Graveyard, two Basil Wolverton series, Japanese Horror in 3D, am currently finishing up Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series Three and others). I know my way around card publishing and financing production. The "100th Anniversary of Zorro" is almost entirely designed and at licensing for final approvals and revisions (plus I need to format the Lenticular Motion cards which won't take much time and I'll be doing that during the Kickstarter campaign) . Depending on licensing's 'revisions' SOME graphics shown above may change. Production will be done almost entirely through ICONIX (Karen Watt Cowan -- who has overseen ALL trading card series I've published since I first started my company) ... So risks and challenges have all been minimized.

You'll NEVER be left wondering "what's going on" because I post regular updates and keep in contact with EVERYONE. Please note: AFTER this Kickstarter ends and right before I start shipping I'm going to send out what's called a 'mailing address survey' email through Kickstarter (everyone will automatically get a survey and Kickstarter will alert you when it is available PLUS I will post updates letting everyone know ... be sure to fill that out and message it back to me when the time comes so there's no delays in mailing your package. Okay? Okay!).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The 100th Anniversary of Zorro ... series TWO! COMING SOON!
updates.update_content:
Alrighty ... I think it was Monday I put the final Zorro parcels in the mail. Wasn't easy, we had extreme cold the night before with turned the 3" of snow into a combination of black ice and half-frozen slush. There's a 50-60' stretch of road to get out of this street that's a steep ascent. But after 6 running starts and a LOT of fishtailing and backsliding all over the road I got over the hump and to the post office. Nothing gets the adrenaline pumping like sliding backwards on a steep road with a 30 foot cliff drop behind. Whoof! BUT... got 'er done!
Now, I've had a few people report that some of their sets were missing a card and had duplicates of other cards. Everyone should have a sketch card, a sticker, a lenticular and a cell card in their box (master sets get ALL the stickers, lenticulars and cells but boxes get one of each. See Kickstarter description). BUT... ALL boxes should have a complete card set #'d 1-180. So I'm going to ask all backers here that IF something is missing from that #1-180 card set they should message me here through Kickstarter messages. I will fix ALL problems personally ... but be sure to message me through Kickstarter (not FB messages, emails, etc.). Save space in your 9-pocket page collection for the missing cards because I will make sure all missing cards are taken care of. But let's give it a couple weeks so most people can have a chance to send messages and I'll fix everything all at the same time. Make sense? In the meantime I've got MST3K collectors who are waiting for their goodies and I NEED to get those rolling forward.

updates.update_userinfo: A Very Special ORIGINAL ART VENUE for Zorro Card Collectors ... Own a PIECE of Zorro Trading Cards History!
updates.update_content: Alrighty then ... by the end of today I'll have 95 Zorro packages mailed out. Between Thursday and yesterday morning mailed out 95 packages ... and I've got 19 right here that I just need to stamp and stick tracking stickers on and will mail them out. So by this afternoon I'll have 13 packages left to process and mail (but 4 of them 'don't count' because those 4 backers haven't provided a mailing address yet). The remaining packages are virtually all packages of "10" or "20" Zorro boxes ... and I'm working out the collation so that each box has different 'chase' cards (meaning of the 10 boxes, ALL the different metal box toppers, cell cards, sketch cards, etc. have as much variety as possible).  AND I also want to do something special regarding printing plates -- since 'rainbow' sets of plates are virtually impossible to collect of ANY card series produced by anyone, I want to make sure that within the 10 box package deals, complete 4-card rainbow sets are present (meaning plates of the same card with cyan, magenta, yellow and black plates represented).

Finished assembling the printing plate / COA cards today. That means NOW all 180-card sets are collated, cell cards are done, sketch cards are here and ready, promo cards are  here and ready, metal box topper cards are COA'd and ready, masks and 3D glasses are ready, packaging is ready, and printing plate cards are ready. And I just now finished the mailing address survey paperwork (for those who completed the mailing address surveys). I will officially begin shipping the first packages tomorrow and since there are some 150 packages to mail it will likely take me about a week to get everything posted on out of here. BUT ... shipping is going to start tomorrow. For those who pledged on the MST3K series 3 Kickstarter just know that the very second Zorros are all out of here I can dive head first into processing out MST3K series 3 packages (printing plates arrived so LATE they are still a little tacky to the touch so are still drying ... but there's other stuff to work on while that's taking place.

I know, I know -- had planned to ship in October. BUT, getting closer. Had some delays with printing production and they didn't send the printing plates until just a bit ago (and plates are still tacky, still drying/curing). I'll be shipping out this month for sure, though. Everything's 'here' (including sketch cards) ... have some more cell cards to assemble and once the printing plates are dry I can assemble those with the COAs on the backs. Lenticulars, 3Ds, metal box toppers, etc. are all collated and ready. Will post an update when shipping starts.

project_data.project_name: "The 100th Anniversary of Zorro" Trading Cards Collection!

campaign.story:
[NOTE: Optional ADD ONS have been added to the bottom of this page]
Here it IS! The BIG ONE! Mystery  Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards Series THREE is COMING! And SOON, TOO! And this is the Kickstarter campaign where you have your chance to add not just a BOX but also a MASTER SET and EXCLUSIVES available ONLY HERE and NOW to your collection. Current plan  is to have the series released late September or early October (there are a LOT of moving parts and this is our most COMPLEX card series ever -- but this is when I hope to release the cards to everyone who pledges on during this limited timeframe). And Series Three picks up right  where Series Two left off. While the First and Second series of MST3K Trading Cards' base  sets covered the Invention Exchanges and Experiments of the first SEVEN seasons (plus the KTMA series),  this THIRD series covers original seasons eight, nine and ten ... PLUS the REVIVAL seasons eleven and twelve (The Gauntlet).  So every character is here: Joel, Mike, Jonah, Dr. Forrester, Dr. Erhardt, TV's Frank, Pearl, Bobo, Observer, Kinga, Max, Tom, Cro-o-o-ow, Gypsy, Cambot ... and everyone else including guest appearances. 
The  entire third series is designed and already through the first stages of the approval process (at this very minute Joel himself is reviewing the 500+ cards!). I will be starting production of some of the more challenging cards while this Kickstarter is running ... and afterwards, when funding takes place, I'll be sending the rest to press.  And as we did in the first and second MST3K Trading Card Kickstarters,  there will be cards ONLY available for those who pledge during this campaign. This pre-order opportunity is planned to run through July 31st. 
MST3K Trading Cards Series Three isn't just  larger than Series One or Two but it might also be one of the largest non-sport trading  card series ever published with over 500 different cards to collect.  A 'box' pledge has most of these cards (including complete base and subsets) and a 'master set' pledge has all the base and subsets and more (see below for details) 
Here's  a visual 'grand tour' of the series:     MYSTERY  SCIENCE THEATER 3000 Series Three Trading cards features: 
Example of 'Experiment' card
 A  68-card "Experiment" base set -- every experiment of the 8th, 9th, 10th ... and 11th and 12th seasons of Mystery Science Theater 3000. The card fronts feature a classic scene from the show and the backs  of the cards cover the movie title, release date, air date, host, director,  stars, synopsis, classic riff and trivia.  
Examples of 'Invention Exchange Cards'
A  42-card "Invention Exchange" base set -- every invention of seasons 11 and 12 (as there were no Invention Exchanges in seasons 8, 9 and 10)  ... With  each card featuring the invention on the front and on the back of the card is  the dialogue of the Invention Exchange. 
Example of the front and back of Riff It! cards.
A  27-card 'Riff It' cards subset featuring a scene from a movie featured on the show  along with a hilarious riff ... and on the back? Another scene with space for  you to write your OWN riff. These are done in old timey stock. 
Special 9-card set of MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000: THE MOVIE
There will be 9 different MST3K: The Movie cards to collect with fun scenes from the film featuring Mike, Tom, Crow, Gypsy and, of course, Dr. Clayton Forrester. Glossy 16pt production with backs having the cast and crew given their proper due respect.
Examples of the 'Planet of a Million Monkeys' subset featuring Pearl, Bobo and Observer ... and a few others.
MST3K seasons 8, 9 and 10 featuring the misadventures in space and time of Pearl, Bobo and Observer and so this special subset features the various locations Pearl and her 'pals' journeyed -- the planet where apes evolved from men, the brain guys' 'world', strange planets, Roman world, courtroom, Castle Forrester, etc. On the backs is dialogue related to the image on the front of the card. 65 cards chronicling their adventures.
Examples of Steve Vance's beautiful and beloved artwork on 'mini poster' cards with DVD Menu Art on the backs.
A  37-card special subset featuring MST3K iconic mini movie posters from the Shout!  Factory DVD releases ... and terrific DVD menu art on the card backs. Steve  Vance (artist) has personally helped in obtaining high res images of his poster  art so the cards can look as lovely as you hope they'll look.  AND (let's just see who is reading all this, shall we?) Steve Vance has generously provided his time and talents to create a special EXCLUSIVE COOL ITEM for this series (he is working on it right now -- he showed me the rough draft and it is beyond nerd-cool ... it is GEEK-COOL!). 
Examples of the Spot UV Glossed GIZMONICS, GADGETS, and GUESTS subset cards
These terrific cards -- 64 of them -- feature the 'spot UV' technique of card production where part of the image is high gloss (giving the cards a FUN extra 'dimension'). For those who collected my Sharknado series, you know what these will look like. These cards feature iconic guests, strange gadgets, space ships, and more with fun 9-card puzzle backs (so they'll display nicely in your 9-pocket binder pages). 
Example of Macarie Claudiu's brilliant Limited Edition Portrait Art Cards
Macarie has returned once again to RRParks CARDS to create 17 NEW portraits for the Limited Edition Portrait Art Cards. For those on Facebook who participated in the poll to decide on which actors should be in this series I think you'll be pleasantly surprised. And yes, as you can see, Dr. Erhardt finally gets a portrait card!  
Example of one of the 36 different 3D cards (yes -- get your 3D glasses out and take a look!)
The incredible Christian LeBlanc has returned to MST3K Trading Cards and provides us with 36 brand new 3D cards for this series. And they are MAGICAL! And of course if you lost your 3D glasses from series 2 don't worry -- a pair of 3D glasses comes in the 'box' or 'master set'.
Examples of Elizabetta Stoinich art for the BOX TOPPERS
When I published Chronicles of the Three Stooges I commissioned the mega-talented Elizabetta Stoinich (our 'artist in Rome') to do portraits of the Three Stooges. So impressed was I with her skills I brought her back for MST3K Series Three. Aren't those lovely!!! Watercolor and coffee is her choice of paint. Nine different standard box topper cards (and for 'master set' backers -- oh, just a little something extra!).
Example of RETRO designed Spot UV Character Cards by Jason Crosby
Nine different Character Cards to collect with artwork by one of the hobby's most popular artists -- Jason Crosby. Brilliant artwork AND with an added Spot UV production feature. 
Diecut PUNCH OUT Nanite Cards!
I'd been talking with friends and fellow publishers about doing these (am sure they are sick of me talking about it). These are being done regular card size (extra thick cards) with TWO different Nanites per card that you can punch out and the put back when done doing whatever it is you'd DO with a Nanite. I've never tried this type of production before so this is a 'first' for RRParks CARDS. 
Example of Lenticular Motion card (impossible to show the effect on a computer screen)
Oooohhhh do I have high hopes for these! MOTION LENTICULAR cards -- not just one but NINE DIFFERENT featuring motion effects of scenes and bits from POOPIE! This is another 'first' for RRParks CARDS. 
Examples of the Sketch Art Gallery PROMO CARDS!
For MST3K Series Two we produced the LARGEST promo card series ever ... at 63 cards. So why stop at already producing the largest promo series when Series Three can have even MORE! 90 of these beautiful cards by DOZENS of artists. 
Examples of the MST3K Sticker Chase Cards!
The very first 'cards' I collected as a kid were the Wacky Package stickers in 1973/1974 ... and the first trading card series I actually collected in packs had a sticker subset (I won't mention here what series THAT was ... let's just say a wookie featured prominently). So for MST3K Series Three I really wanted to have a set of stickers. Ten different of them, too! Chances are NO ONE is actually going to peel them off and stick them on their notebooks or bikes, but they ARE stickers. Every box will have at least one ... and of course 'master sets' will have all TEN!
Examples of just THREE of the different Artists' Sketch Cards
Some of the most popular cards in the MST3K Trading Card projects have been original art sketch cards ~ so of COURSE Series Three will have sketch cards (one in every 'box' and of course one in every 'master set'). Over FIFTY different artists have sketch cards destined for MSt3K Series Three. On the inside of one of the wrappers you'll get you'll find a complete list of ALL the artists that are involved in the MST3K trading card production (many of these artists have become great friends and are coming back for my Old Man Like Ron series coming up... and The 100th Anniversary of Zorro (that I'm doing right after MST3K Series Three). As most of you have seen, MST3K sketch cards are popular ... SO popular in fact that they sell on eBay and online for $80-$120 on average (with some fetching upwards of $200 on ebay)... so do the math: a 'box' pledge is $85 and is guaranteed a sketch card. 
Examples of progressive proofs (actual colors may differ when printed)
Progressive Proofs are on the task list for this production -- just like Series Two. And all 'box' and 'master set' backers will get at LEAST one progressive proof. For Series Two the colors were Magenta, Cyan and Yellow. What will Series Three colors be? We'll just have to wait and see won't we!
Example of printing plates (actual colors and intensities will vary)
As with Series One and Series Two, Series Three will once again include printing plates! Each plate is UNIQUE ... for any given card there's only ONE cyan, ONE magenta, ONE yellow and ONE black. So each printing plate is UNIQUE -- there's only ONE of them! Some boxes will include one ... all master set backers will get one.
Joel, Trace, Frank, Bill, Kevin, Jim, J. Elvis, Mary Jo ... with some scarce dual autos of Trace & Frank, Bill and Kevin, Kevin and Bill

The most complicated and time consuming part of MST3K Series Three was obtaining the original actors AUTOGRAPHS on special production METAL CARDS. None of that 'on sticker' type of stuff -- these cards were actually held and signed by Joel, Trace, Frank, J. Elvis, Kevin, Bill, Mary Jo and Jim Mallon. And through some clever coordination and a rare moment of genius the BACKS of the autograph cards will have a certificate of authenticity attached with a photo of the actor actually signing the autograph cards! I asked my best friend and fellow publisher what do master sets usually include -- and he informed me a master set typically requires ONE autograph card. Which is a good thing because some actors would only sign a certain number of cards. I had a choice -- I could provide a very small number of collectors a complete set of autographs OR I could afford to provide EACH collector ('box' or 'master set') with ONE autograph card so that EVERYONE can have at least ONE autograph card for their collection (am sure on the Facebook Group page collectors can trade with someone else to make sure everyone gets the actor they want). But for this campaign and pre-sell if you pledge on a BOX or a MASTER SET you will get ONE random autograph card. Some collectors will randomly receive a DUAL autograph card (Trace and Frank ... or Trace and J. Elvis ... or Bill and Kevin 'Crow and Tom' or 'Bobo and Observer'). All the combinations and varieties will be listed on the inside of one of the wrappers. OH! And there's even a 'special guest' autograph card possible (I won't say WHO ... let's just say 'The Master would approve!' and leave it at that). This is only the second time an RRParks CARDS series features autographs (because I'm not filthy rich to afford this sort of thing very often)... the first series I published with autograph cards was Gary Saves the Graveyard (which featured the 7 main actors and the director of the webisodes). Very excited about this part of MST3K Series Three.
Box Topper Mini Clipouts
Anyone who collected MST3K Series One or Series Two already knows I'm a big fan of packaging clipout cards. Probably from me youth when cereal or pizza boxes would have cards on the packaging to clipout. And so MST3K Series One and Two ... and now Three ... will have boxes with mini clipout cards showing the MST3K entrance/title sequences. And because a box only has so much surface area (and there were several difference title sequences) I had to EXPAND the surface area of the box by including EIGHT (only four shown above) panels EACH with 5 mini clipout cards ... covering ALL title/intro sequences. So if you're getting a 'box' or a 'master set' you'll have the mini cards to clip out on the box PLUS an additional EIGHT panels as a BONUS. 
 And there you have it! The GRAND VISUAL TOUR of what's coming ... and what you'll get ... for your MST3K Trading Card Collection! Over 500 different cards including some pretty darn nifty SPECIAL PRODUCTION diecut Nanites, Lenticular Motions, Spot UVs, Limited Editions, Stickers and Autographs and more. My LARGEST and more COMPLEX card series to date.  Here (below) is a chart showing contents for 'box' collectors and 'master set' collectors:

In the chart above you'll see the guaranteed contents of a MST3K Series Three Box and a MST3K Series Three MASTER SET. Boxes are guaranteed all the fun stuff shown plus some rare and chase cards ... and Master Sets are guaranteed ALL the sets and subsets. See chart below:
Each  and every full, sealed box of Mystery Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards  carries 36 packs (that's right... not 18 or 24 packs holding 4 or 5 cards each like other industry averages) and each pack as 10 different cards. Boxes will have NO DUPLICATES! Every pack has 10 different cards from any other pack. So a box of 36 10 card packs holds at least 360 cards plus the box toppers, a metal and an autograph card. Master sets will have all 500 different cards plus at least one autograph card and additional exclusives and bonuses. master backers will receive unused wrappers inside their box. 
As a BONUS, the MST3K  retail box  features something NO other publisher provides: Printed  right on the box are 36 different mini double-sided clip-out cards in FULL color  front and back on super glossy stock. It's almost like getting a FREE 36  card special subset. Oh wait, it IS like that EXACTLY! Each  pack wrapper features a complete checklist printed on the inside showing you all  the cards to look for to complete your set. 
SO  HOW DO I GET ALL THIS AMAZING STUFF AND SATIATE MY DIRE NEED FOR MST3K  COLLECTIBLES??? 
It's  easy. You'll notice there are many different pledge levels -- levels to fit all  collector budgets.  
Level  1: $2 You get ONE promo card for the MST3K Series Three Trading Card collection.  
Level  2: $5 You  get FIVE different promo cards for the MST3K Series Three Trading Card  collection. 
Level  3: $12 You  get THREE sealed packs of cards. Each pack contains 10 different cards. Consider  this a 'sampler' level. And you'll also get a promo card, too.  
Level  4: $85 You  get a FULL SEALED BOX of 36 10-card packs. Guaranteed to contain everything listed in the chart above. 360 different cards plus the box topper goodies (mini clipout cards, 1 metal box topper card and 1 autograph card. Plus a pair of 3D glasses.
Level  5: $175  At  this level you get a MASTER SET. What's in a MASTER SET? Take a look at the chart above showing everything! And I'm sure that during production there may end up being some additional goodies.  500 cards will barely fit inside the box  unwrapped so it's going to be one REALLY thick, heavy box of cards -- all ready  for you to load into your card collection (you'll want a lot of 9-pocket pages  for THIS rascal!). And I might even have some more surprises for you depending  on pledge levels.  This is the level you want if you're a super fan and gotta  have EVERYTHING. IMPORTANT: A 'master set' will ONLY be available during this  Kickstarter pre-sell ... and during the Kickstarter I MAY have to limit the  number of these available (so you may want to jump on this one fast before the  option is gone).   
Level  6: $220. This level is a combination of Level 4 and Level 5 -- at this  level you get a 36-pack box AND a master set. This way your master set gives you  ALL the cards... and you still have a 36-pack sealed box to either open packs,  save for a rainy day, give as a gift, use as a boat anchor or whatever else your  imagination can come up with. At this level you are guaranteed at least TWO original art sketch cards and TWO genuine autograph cards plus bonus goodies.
Level  7: $320 Four  Box Case Level. At this level you get FOUR sealed 36-pack boxes. And yes, that means FOUR original art sketch cards and FOUR genuine MST3K actor autograph cards (all different actors guaranteed!).  A great level for  those who want to build sets and have duplicate sets to sell on ebay or give to  a friend or simply keep because you're greedy and fiending for cards... a great  level for those who love the thrill of seeking rare chase and hit cards. As a BONUS, those who get the Four Box Case  Level will get some guaranteed bonus stuff like uncut panels, additional  printing plates, error and freak cards (I won't know what errors or oddballs  I'll have until AFTER printing production... but virtually every printing  production does end up with some oddball cards and with a production job this  big am sure we'll have errors, freaks and oddballs), and more. Hurry on over to  the local store and grab a barrel full of bubble gum as this level will keep you  busy for HOURS!   
Level  8: $600 DOUBLE  the 'Four Box Case Level'. You get every everything in Level 6...DOUBLED. So  that's EIGHT boxes and all those goodies. And you are guaranteed to get not only 8 original art sketch cards (that sell on ebay for an average of $80-$100 each ... yea, do the math on that!) BUT I will guarantee that all 8 of the autgraph cards you get will be one from each actor: Joel, Trace, Frank, J. Elvis, Bill, Kevin, Mary Jo and Jim Mallon. This level is a pricey one ... but just the sketch cards alone are worth the whole amount!
Questions  and Answers:
Q:  I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do  I go about it?  A:  Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable  to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no  worries. 
--------------- 
Q:  When will the MST3K Trading Card Series ship? A:  The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of September. This series, though, is the most complicated one I've published so far so if things get hectic with coordinating almost a dozen different publishers delays MIGHT happen. But most of you know me pretty well by now that if I'm late for some reason getting shipping done I keep everyone informed and do my best to be on time. I'm good about  posting updates and communications so will keep everyone in the loop.  I do,  though, ask for patience in advance ... this is the first time I've published a  trading card series this large involving so MANY moving parts.   
 --------------------- 
Q:  I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two  boxes? Or two 'Master Sets'?  A:  If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ...  then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge  amount. Be SURE to message me if you do this explaining what you did. I'll check  and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine. The way I believe it's done is  after you pledge you click to view/manage your pledge and then you change the  amount of your pledge to reflect everything you want in your package. So, for  example, if you want to pledge on two master sets you just pledge on ONE. After  your pledge is entered you can click on view/manage your pledge and change the  amount of your pledge to reflect adding on additional goodies.
----------------- 
Q:  Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or  through a catalog? A:  This is my 20th Kickstarter over the last 4 years. I've found that pre-selling a  card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of  cards and boxes (especially special production cards that are pricey to do ... such as metal cards). It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a  limited basis. Once the Kickstarter is done I will have a good idea of what the  total 'sealed box' needs will be for a production run to provide Kickstarter  backers AND other customers (when the series is offered through distributors and  retail outlets). A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious  collectors FIRST before ANYONE else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise  some flexibility on providing 'stuff' for backers ... once the Kickstarter is  over the only planned retail/wholesale activity for series three is simply retail  boxes of 36 packs (and ONLY boxes pledged on during a Kickstarter are guaranteed an autograph and sketch card both in the same box).  
ADD ON GOODIES:
 If you want something not listed just let me know and if it's possible we'll do it. Add On prices are postpaid in the US. If you're outside the US let me know before doing the add on so I can research postage costs to your country. And of course if you have any questions just ask! My goal is to make sure you have fun with your collection and it's everything you want it to be. 
It is my intention during the Kickstarter to create some special Kickstarter-exclusive 'add on' options (original production art, progressive proofs, uncut sheets, etc.). So watch for updates throughout this Kickstarter. I
----------------------- 
If  you have a question not answered here please just ask -- you can message me  directly through Kickstarter and I will respond as quickly as possible. It is  better to message me than to post a comment. Kickstarter shows me MESSAGES as  soon as they are posted but is not consistent with showing me 'comments' (plus Kickstarter will show me someone has commented ... but they don't show me where the comment is -- if it is a comment on an update please note there are 100s of updates spread over 20 different Kickstarters ... meaning a 'comment' is a needle in the haystack. If you want me to see your comment, question, etc. send it as a MESSAGE).  If you can't figure out how to  message on Kickstarter then just contact me through my RRParksCARDS.com website.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks? Well I suppose an asteroid could come hurtling through space and land on my head. Otherwise, this is my 20th Kickstarter Campaign... and I've published dozens of other card series over the last 5 years (including eight different Three Stooges series, Gary Saves the Graveyard, two Basil Wolverton series, Japanese Horror in 3D, am currently finishing up The 100th Anniversary of Zorro and others). I know my way around card publishing and financing production. MST3K Series Three is entirely designed and at licensing for final approvals and revisions. Depending on licensing's 'revisions' (which are usually modest) SOME graphics shown above may change but I don't anticipate much if any changes. The lenticulars and the nanite diecuts are brand new to me but the details have been worked out. And ALL 100% of the autograph cards are here. So risks and challenges have all been minimized. 



 You'll NEVER be left wondering "what's going on" because I post regular updates and keep in contact with EVERYONE. Please note: AFTER this Kickstarter ends and right before I start shipping I'm going to send out what's called a 'mailing address survey' ... be sure to fill that out and message it back to me when the time comes so there's no delays in mailing your package. Okay? Okay!). While there are always risks and challenges with production, logistics or even crossing the street I have years of experience publishing trading cards and conducting Kickstarter campaigns. So the risks and challenges are minimized.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE:  ALL REWARD LEVELS ABOVE THE SINGLE PACK WILL INCLUDE THE METAL AUTOGRAPH CARD, and ALL Reward Levels will include ONE Backer Exclusive Promo Card
Pledges received on DAY ONE will receive a gold foil "Day 1" stamp on their promo card.
Digital Mockups, Product Not Final
ABOUT THE SET
Dan Brereton's Nocturnals is a premium wax pack trading card set featuring full color artwork and all new prose stories by series creator Dan Brereton!  
Each set will contain 18 retro picture cards packaged in a hand-folded and heat-sealed wax wrapper.  The cards and pack are printed entirely in the USA, and are designed to replicate the look and feel of classic monster cards from the 1960s and 70s.
The cards are printed on old school cardboard chip stock, and the wrapper coated in real wax; hold them in your hands and you'll be instantly transported back to your childhood!
ABOUT THE NOCTURNALS
Dan Brereton first published the Nocturnals in 1994, to critical acclaim, including an Eisner Award nomination. Over the years a series of  graphic novels and specials has followed, leading up to The Sinister Path, a 96-page graphic novel published by Big Wow Art  and funded right here on Kickstarter in 2017.
The Nocturnals tells the story of supernatural investigator Doc Horror, his spooky daughter Halloween Girl, the silent revenant Gunwitch, the beautiful wraith Polychrome, and a cast of other-worldly outcast heroes who do battle with the netherworld nightmares that threaten Pacific City!  
ABOUT SIDEKICK
The set is produced by SideKick Lab, who manufactured Topps' Mars Attacks: Occupation trading card series, and who's other Kickstarter sets have included Dan Brereton's Creeping Flesh Trading Cards, Ed Repka's Monsterdom Stickers, and The Funny Fiends.
 Wax Pack Set in Miniature Display Box
11x14 Signed Nocturnals Print
Nocturnals Metal Autograph Card
Collector Binder WITH TRIPTYCH PANORAMA CARD SET
Pencil Sketch Card (Limit 25)
Full Color Sketch Card (Limit 20)
Rainbow Foil Set/Cards
Rainbow Printing Plate sets
PDF Sketch Collection
  About Each Reward:
WAX PACK SET
The Wax Pack Set contains 18 full color cards on retro cardboard, and each image includes a new prose story on the back by Nocturnal Creator Dan Brereton! Each set is wrapped in a heat-sealed wax-coated paper package, and contained in a miniature full color display box!
11 x 14 SIGNED PRINT
Full color, hand signed by creator Dan Brereton, and hand numbered to the limited edition produced just for this campaign!  Final numbers to be dictated by orders.
METAL AUTOGRAPH CARD
Printed by Faerie Metals, these special metal cards are double-thick, full color, and includes the autograph of Nocturnals creator Dan Brereton.  
COLLECTOR BINDER
Two inch collector binder with all-over, double sided full color Nocturnals artwork by Dan Brereton!  Store all your Nocturnals cards-- or use it for work or school!  Included with the binder is a 3-card "Triptych" Panorama set!
SKETCH CARDS
In two versions: pencil or full color!  All sketch cards will created by Dan Brereton.  These cards have already been produced and are currently being drawn by Dan!
RAINBOW FOIL EDITION
A special version of the set printed on flashy rainbow foil and packaged in a rainbow foil miniature display box emblazoned with the Nocturnals logo!
PRINTING PLATES
The one-of-a-kind metal plates used to print the set, a "rainbow set" of plates includes ALL FOUR COLORS used to print that card.  These sets are available at the highest limited reward level.  
PDF Sketch Collection
A PDF collection of high resolution scans of some of Dan Brereton's greatest Nocturnal's sketch cards! (Digital delivery)


International shipping for Add-ons will be calculated after the campaign, during the survey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Both Tom and Dan have run many successful campaigns, and have learned much from the successes and challenges they faced on Creeping Flesh and other projects.

One of the biggest challenges on Creeping Flesh was the production of the exclusive Metal Autograph Cards, which delayed delivery by many months. This time around, SideKick is already working with Fairie Metals to ensure a timely production of the metal autographs.

We are also being a bit more conservative in our delivery estimates to avoid over-promising. Beyond any money we hope to raise on this project, our REAL goal on this campaign is to make every backer happy and deliver on-time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
To confirm, all domestic AND international orders have been mailed.  Domestic should have been received by now, International were mailed the last week of July.
PLEASE BE PATIENT!  In addition to our shipping service taking up to 6 weeks for international mailings, there are reports of slowed delivery overseas due to Covid and other factors.  Local couriers have reported slow-downs during the transfer from Fedex.
Thank you for your support, and patience while we worked to create and fulfill this project.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE YOUR SHIPPING INFO--WE ARE READY TO SHIP!
updates.update_content:
Well the long wait is nearly over.
FIRST OFF-- due to the long delay, we wanted to ask anyone who may have changed their mailing address to PLEASE MESSAGE US with your updated shipping details!
...because we're getting ready to ship!  
One snag we ran into was the foil stamping: we had promised every box would include a foil stamp logo, either in Silver, Gold, or Rainbow.  The problem is, the way we had planned it was to foil stamp OVER the logo on the box, but when it came time to stamp, it proved too difficult to over-stamp and look really nice.

As before, we are still down several employees, which has made progress on ALL of our projects (and we do much more than what we fund on Kickstarter) has been slow.  Back printing on the printing plates happened last week, and we are hoping to foil stamp the 8x10 prints soon.
Wish there was more progress, but due to Covid the shop only operating at about 25-30% capacity.

updates.update_userinfo: Progress Report: Work Resumes, albeit Slowly...
updates.update_content:
Good news is, the shop is slowly coming back online.  We've been able to print a few new items, but the process has been slower than normal, as local businesses are still under some restrictions.  Likewise, several of our "minions" (part timers tasked with wrapping packs, assembling boxes, orders, etc) are staying home due to a variety personal concerns, so progress is moving, but little by little.
Second, Tom is still spending a lot of his time on created PPE shields for his local hospital.

updates.update_userinfo: A Note from the Head Nocturnal
updates.update_content:
As events and circumstances surrounding the global pandemic continue to evolve daily, we wanted to update everyone with where we are on Nocturnals.
We were just at the home stretch, when Covid-19 became very real and scary situation, and we had originally planned to continue the final leg of assembly and shipping while taking reasonable social distancing and cleanliness measures.  As NYC was issuing a serious "stay at home" order, SideKick's facility in Vermont remained open, with reduced capacity and increased efforts to physically separate our 3-4 employees and make hand sanitizer readily available to all.

Nocturnals progress report below.
But first... Don't miss out on Mars Attacks: Uprising!
Fully authorized by Topps!  It's the FINAL DAY TO PLEDGE!  If you haven't checked it out, and don't know what to get-- just grab a pack!  That will give you access to the survey where you'll be able to pick out what you want without a ticking clock!
The campaign closes at 10PM EST TONIGHT!

updates.update_userinfo: Mars Attacks! LAST DAY TO PLEDGE!
updates.update_content:
Prints, sketches, metals, and single cards signed by Dan have been returned. All cards are printed, and packs are wrapped.  The binders are returned from the printer.
Two things we still need to do:
1) print the display box. (estimated in 1-2 weeks)
2) create the Nocturnals logo "die" used to foil stamp the rainbow box. (which is being ordered this week)

We just received the 11x14 print back, and will be sending it out to Dan for signing.  The last two elements for us to produce are the die for the foil stamp, and the display box.  We will be breaking for the holidays, and after the new year will get these last two items knocked out in January.
We appreciate your patience, we know this is taking a little longer than we anticipated.
Adam.

Just wanted to post a quick update!  
Everything is coming together: the cards and wrappers are printed, sketch cards are complete, the metal autos are printed, we are just waiting on the 11x14 print to come back so we can send it to Dan with the autos for signing.  We expect it to be in-house next week.
I know this is a delay from the estimated ship date of November, but please always keep in mind our stated ship dates are ESTIMATES.  We do our best, but it's always a challenge to estimate a ship date before a product has been made!   Hopefully we can get all components in hand and ready to ship by early December.

campaign.story:
Hello!
We are Addison Binek, creator of Tromasterpiece Theatre and Movies to Watch on a Rainy Afternoon, and Greg DeLiso, director of Hectic Knife.
 We would like to invite you all to participate in the production of our new killer gorilla movie- "Psycho Ape!" 
Psycho Ape! is our next feature film project and a comedy/horror movie done in the style of a low budget Troma/Roger Corman/Grindhouse production.   
Welcome to Psycho Ape! 
The totally bananas, no budget, gore-illa exploitation movie that everyone said could easily be made!
Psycho Ape! will be an Airplane!/Mel Brooks-esque spoof of John Carpenter's Halloween, King Kong, and John Landis' Schlock. 
The ape costume itself was purchased for Halloween many years ago, and now it's being used for this movie! In fact, shots of the ape will be used when he moves or turns around that reveal the seam on the back of the costume- truly reveling in the cheap humor of the whole thing.  
There will be plenty of low budget blood and gore, in addition to gags and jokes!  
Think Ed Wood filmmaking, but with excessive fake blood and comedy!(Basically a guy in a phony gorilla costume will be going around killing people with bananas...) 
Plot -
A gorilla escapes from the Detroit zoo and begins a serial killing spree.  
He is hunted down by the zookeeper, Dr. ZOOmis, played by actor Bill Weeden (Sgt. Kabukiman N.Y.P.D., Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger Part IV) after massacring a teen girl slumber party.  
Kansas Bowling (B.C. Butcher, Once Upon a Time in Hollywood) will play Nancy Banana, a monkey-loving ape-obsessed teenage girl, and sole survivor of the aforementioned slumber party banana massacre. She ends up writing a tell-all memoir about surviving "The Banana Murders."  
The ape is caught and incarcerated, where he is tortured and psychologically abused "A Clockwork Orange"-style, but eventually breaks out of jail during a poo-flinging prison riot. 
The ape reunites with Nancy Banana and whisks her off to New York City, where the climax of the film ends in a big chase scene through Times Square and atop the Empire State Building a la King Kong. 
Psycho Ape! is sure to be the leading (only?) mad cap comedy/slasher mashup that's one part Halloween parody, one part ape movie parody (all of them), and one part bananas! 
We plan to shoot the film in both Detroit, MI and New York City, so with this Kickstarter we hope to accrue enough money to cover our travel expenses and pay our booked actors. 

We've already shot a bit of footage, and you can see our teaser trailers here:

Teaser Trailer #1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sylnu9PJekk
Teaser Trailer #2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3UK-Igcmz8A
Teaser Trailer #3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=poNpxFhDtCg 
Here is the official IMDb page for Psycho Ape! as well:
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10104502/?ref_=nv_sr_1?ref_=nv_sr_1

I just wanted to let everybody know that a fellow Kickstarter backer is currently running his *own* Kickstarter for officially licensed Psycho Ape! trading cards, and it's all been approved beforehand so it's on the up and up.

I'm not involved with the product or Kickstarter itself, but if you would like to order these trading cards for your own collection then feel free to take a look at the Kickstarter here:

updates.update_userinfo: Finished shipping all orders within the U.S.
updates.update_content:
Hey there!

"Psycho Ape!" director Addison Binek here, and I just wanted to let everybody know that I have finished shipping all U.S. orders!

I was advised a couple months ago by postal clerks to hold off on international orders because it was a possibility they could get lost or seized by customs since they were coming from the U.S., but it's not as likely anymore so I'll start shipping international orders soon (France, Japan, UK, Ireland, etc)

We will be streaming the film for everybody by the end of the month, and will be placing DVD orders very soon!
Hang tight!
Psycho Ape is coming!

Hey everybody, so sorry for the lack of updates on here!
Because of Covid and quarantine we haven’t really been working on the film all that much.
There’s a couple of scenes left to shoot, and some voiceover dubbing needs to be done to replace bad audio from beach wind/New York traffic.
However, the film is clocking in at 70 minutes long so far without all that other stuff and our post-production clips are coming in!

Hey everybody, just wanted to let all you backers know that we were on track to get the movie done by June but because of coronavirus and social distancing, we've been forced to halt post-production on the project and haven't been able to work on it as much as we'd like.
The film is about 70 minutes long as of now, but it still needs one additional scene filmed, and there's still music to score, sound effects to add, a nice final spit and polish with filters and digital effects, etc.

campaign.story:
Update - 6/8/19
We're going to withdraw this Kickstarter.  Not because the cards won't be made.  The trading cards (and metal variants) are going to be printed on schedule and will be available for purchase. 
The challenge we're facing is post cards.  Instead of creating these and offering them directly to consumers, the path forward is going to be licensing to souvenir distributors who serve the countless tourist shops in Florida.
What does this mean?  It means that it is simply not cost effective for us to produce the post cards on a small scale.  And since they are part of the master set, it would mean a HUGE delay in sending out cards versus getting the post cards in the hands of master set backers.  
The only logical step forward is to withdraw the Kickstarter now, about two weeks before it ends.  It makes sense to do this now, before we potentially disappoint more people.  The trading cards will be available for direct purchase after printing.  No money collected in advance.  We will be offering the post cards at a MUCH later date.  We'll send out updates as each is available so please continue to follow this Kickstarter even after it ends.
Thanks for your interested in Florida Man.  He will be back and better than ever.
The Adventures of Florida Man
The Nation's favorite ne'er-do-well comes to life, bringing his crazy antics to life in this exciting collection of art.  Featuring "ripped from the headlines" stories (with a fair amount of artistic freedom given to protect the innocent), the adventures of Florida Man know no limit.  This series, however, does:  it will contain 9 fantastic events brought to life in glorious illustrations.  Stories ranging from Florida Man Denies Syringes Found in Rectum are His to Florida Man Brings Alligator through Drive-Thru, these images are sure to delight.
The first three illustrations, the remaining will be announced throughout the campaign!
Trading Cards
Each of the nine images will be featured on the front of high quality 16pt glossy trading cards.  The reverse of each card will feature a summary of the events that resulted in Florida Man's adventure.  Like previous releases from Attic Cards, these trading cards will be packaged in a customized wrapper.  These cards are sure to make you chuckle and are fun to share with friends.
Metal Cards
Backers of past Attic Cards sets are likely already familiar with metal cards.  Unlike many other trading card publishers who use the term "metal" to simply mean shiny, these cards are printed on actual SOLID METAL.  They feature an incredible shiny finish and are simply brilliant.  Metal cards will only be available through the Kickstarter and will be numbered.  They will not be available for retail sale after this campaign begins.
Also available is a special Master Set PLUS 1/1 Proof pledge level that includes a 1/1 metal printing proof from one of the metal cards.  There are four colors in the CMYK printing process - Black, Cyan, Magenta, and Yellow.  With 9 different cards, there will be 36 available.
1 Random Printing Proof will be included with each of the 36 Backers at the Master Set Plus 1/1 Proof level.
Post Cards
Want something a little larger than a 2.5" x 3.5" trading card?  Want to send something funny to your cousin in Jacksonville?  Or perhaps you are looking for a beautiful piece of artwork to have framed and hung in your Florida room?  Look no further!  The same nine incredible pieces of art are available as 4" x 6" post cards!  The reverse will feature regulation compliant specifications for stamp location and addresses.  These are ready to mail!
The Artist
All of the art for this release is being created by the incredibly talented Lindsey Armitage.  We couldn't be more proud to have her bring Florida Man and Nom-Nom to life!
Attic Originals Master Set
Have you missed out on prior sets from Attic Cards?  You're in luck!  For only $99 you can catch up and receive Reptiles, Sharks, and Krampus in addition to Florida Man.  Sharks includes 9 cards featuring original illustrations by Kokkinakis Achilleas.  Reptiles features 19 cards with 18 original illustrations also by Kokkinakis.  A bonus numbered parallel card is included in each back as well.  Krampus features 9 spot UV Krampuskarten cards, 3 solid metal cards featuring original art and 1 sketch card from our talented artists.
Krampus Master Set - 9 Spot UV Cards, 3 Metal Cards, plus 1 sketch card will also be included.
Pack of Sharks cards featuring 9 original illustrations
Pack of Reptiles with 18 original illustrations and 1 bonus numbered parallel card
Shipping
All pledge levels include shipping for backers in the United States.  International backers will have a nominal shipping charge.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 9th Kickstarter from Attic Cards. By now we've experienced almost every type of bump in the road of production and have never failed to deliver. While we are a well-oiled machine, there are things out of our control. These include, but are not limited to, earthquakes, hurricanes, tornados, feral kittens with rabies, and mutated half-crocodile half-bluegill lake creatures. Short of these unlikely events, we haven't let anyone down before and don't plan on it now.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the world of THE FUNNY FIENDS!
Created by artists John Detrich and Stephen Blickenstaff, The Funny Fiends are a loving homage to classic monster sticker cards from the '60s and '70s like "Ugly Stickers,"  "Odd Rods," and the "Nutty Initials."
These retro sticker cards will feature 100 ALL-NEW MONSTER MONIKERS!  These are not reprints, reproductions, or imports.  John Detrich and Stephen Blickenstaff have spent the past two years hand painting 100 all new characters!  Stunning new highly detailed art packaged in true vintage style!
Each "hobby box" will include 24 vintage style hand-folded and heat-sealed wax wrapped packs (number of stickers per pack to be determined, but a minimum of 6). The cards, packs, and boxes are printed, packaged, and assembled entirely in the USA, and are designed to replicate the look and feel of classic monster sticker cards.  SideKick specializes in high quality printing techniques, and careful curation of materials to give every product a lasting, loving touch.   
The wrappers will be coated in real wax;  hold them in your hands and you'll be instantly transported back to your childhood!
In addition to the 100 sticker set, boxes will include randomly inserted chase cards:
8  "Do It Yourself" coloring cards, printed on material perfect for markers, colored pencils, pen, ink, or even crayons! (5 per box) 
8 "3D" Cards.  Glasses included! (4 per box) 
2 Hand-Signed Creator Autograph Cards (1 per box) 
*note: chase cards are NOT stickers 
Other reward levels give collectors a chance to receive a master set with all 18 chase cards, both autograph cards, color sketches, and printing plates-- the one of a kind metal plates used to print the series!
SideKick has produced some samples and prototypes already.  The stickers, wrappers, boxes, and pack designs are all nearly completed and will be ready for pre-press by April.  We just need YOUR help to raise the necessary funding to complete the work and go to the printers!
There are multiple ways to pledge.  See below and pick your rewards!
 *Free domestic shipping.  International shipping charges at checkout.
     *Complete set does not include wax wrapper or box.

 *Images are prototypes and mockups for placement only!  May not be final designs.
Want more Funny Fiends?  Add-ons are for you!
If you want to add a special collector binder, an extra pack, complete set, hobby box, or discounted case of hobby boxes, just total up the items you'd like and add it to your pledge. These add-ons are unlimited, so feel free to select as many as you want!
Following the closing of the campaign we will send out a survey so you can select which add-ons you wanted to receive. Specialty items like signed stickers, buttons, posters, and diecut stickers may be available to add to your rewards as part of the survey.  
*Images are mockups and prototypes only.
$9,000: "On Sale Here" Poster Added to Every Order!  - UNLOCKED!
$11,000: 4 Chase Cards added to set - UNLOCKED!
$13,000: Checklist Bonus Card Added to Every Order! - UNLOCKED!
$15,000: 'Mock' Bubblegum stick added to every pack! 
New to Kickstarter?  Below we've outlined the simple easy way to select your rewards and add-ons.  This step-by-step infographic uses a sample pledge, you are free to choose whichever reward level and whichever add-ons in any quantities you desire.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SideKick Lab is a printing facility located in Rutland, Vermont. SideKick specializes in accurately reproducing the materials and methods of classic Wax Pack trading cards.

In order to compensate John Detrich & Stephen Blickenstaff, to cover the costs of printing, packaging, assembly, and shipping, we need to collect a small amount to make sure the product is worthwhile for everyone involved.

The good news is that SideKick has a long history of trading card production, and is a well-oiled, fine-tuned machine. SideKick produced Buff Monster's Melty Misfits cards, Topps' Mars Attacks: Occupation, Bobby Aker's "Blood Drive" series, plus many projects for major companies such as Skybound ("Outcast"), Fox ("Bob's Burgers"), PopCap ("Plants vs Zombies"), and many more!

This is SideKick's third foray on Kickstarter. Both previous campaigns were successfully delivered, and taught us a lot about managing expectations of delivery.

This campaign is a much simpler project, and all logistics have been carefully considered and planned for a smoother production and fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

As noted below, there is no tracking available due to the service we use, and we expect all orders to be delivered in 2-3 weeks.  Could be longer due to holidays?

updates.update_userinfo: Printing Plates, Foreign Orders, Autos + MARS ATTACKS!
updates.update_content:
Hello there!
This week we will begin shipping foreign orders, printing plates, and uncut sheets.
Also, we mistakenly neglected to send the dual autographs with the FLANG pledges, so if you pledged at this level, know that we are aware of the issue and the card will be mailed out shortly.  
Adam.
PS: Don't miss out on the new Mars Attacks Sampler Pack! CLICK THE IMAGE BELOW!

Sorry for the delay.  Lots going on: SideKick attended two shows (NYCC and Philly Non Sport Card Shows) and one of our non-kickstarter projects had a MAJOR setback due to a printing error from another facility, which effectively shut down the shop for about a week.
But we're back on schedule, and here's what we have so far:
ALL DOMESTIC US ORDERS HAVE NOW BEEN SHIPPED!  We're still waiting on the facility that back-prints the printing plates, which is one reason things got delayed from our last update estimate, so we've decided to ship out all domestic orders WITHOUT PLATES and we'll send the plates separately later, at our cost.

Last week we launched our newest project, Vamps vs Werewolves, from artist and creator Scott Blair!  The campaign includes a 27 card 3-pack set, a full hobby box with a sketch card, and even an exclusive print!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1514049470/vamps-vs-wolves-wax-pack-trading-cards-by-scott-blair?ref=670ta7

The binders have been delayed by the printer a couple of weeks (we only print the cards). We prefer to ship all orders together, so will wait to begin fulfillment until they are in hand.  Hang in there folks, we're in the home stretch!

That is all :)
But seriously-- all the sets are collated, wrapped, and are getting boxed up this week, and we should have the binders in-house next week as well, so shipping should begin just after that!
The Funny Fiends are almost here!

updates.update_userinfo: Base Set Printing- Behind the Scenes!

updates.update_content: This week, John and Stephen are in Vermont visiting with us at Sidekick to oversee printing of Funny Fiends!  We'll keep you updated as we move forward with printing and packaging!

Production update!
Stephen and John (or "the boys" as we refer to them) have spent the last month or so knee deep designing card backs, and chase card art for the 3D and CIY cards, after completing their sketches.
We are in the middle of pre-press, a process of accumulating, reviewing, assembling, and laying out
all the artwork to be printed.
