campaign.story:
I'm celebrating the 22nd year - 2nd month - 2nd week Anniversary of my 'quasi beginning' as a publisher. Although RRParks CARDS was still almost 20 years away at the time this book ... A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms ... marked my initial journey into the world of publishing. And to mark the start of that journey I've remastered a 25-card set based on the lunacy within the covers of this utterly worthless tome. Each card is full color on a retro style stock with artwork by RRParks (currently the publisher of Sharknado, Mystery Science Theater 3000, The Three Stooges, and other trading card series). I'm also launching this campaign at this time to support Kickstarter's 'MAKE 100' Month -- where Kickstarter promotes the concept of projects that are limited to 100 of a project. So in this case, there is a limit of only 100 "Gadzillion" Master Sets. 
So just what's IN this project you ask? Well... assuming you asked... or wondered... or didn't leave this campaign the second you read the word 'condoms'... the answer is this: A Book and Cards Package Deal. The book is a 64-page landscape style squarebound paperback, published in 1997 (First... and ONLY edition!). I had squirreled away back in 1997 a couple boxes of the books for some future project (that future project is now). The book has full color front and back covers painted my RRParks. 
Front Cover of the book
Back cover of the book
The book leads off with a four-page history of condoms from 1350 BCE through Roman times all the way up to the present. The what follows in the book are COUNTLESS... or rather "a Gadzillion" (which in this case is around 54) 'other' uses for condoms besides the obvious uses for condoms. Here's some of them ... 
PLUS ... In addition to the book this Kickstarter includes a complete 25-card set of A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms -- artwork fully remastered and produced in FULL COLOR fronts (and duo-color ... black and one primary color...  retro style backs planned). 
PLUS ... in addition to the book and the 25-card series there are TWO metal cards planned (produced by Faerie Metal) in full color. These are limited edition cards.
PLUS ... in addition to the book, the 25-card series, two different metal cards there will be included in the LIMITED EDITION Master Level a genuine printing plate. The printing plate will be the UNIQUE (1 of 1) actual printing plate used in the production of the card series.
PLUS ... in addition to the book, the 25-card series, two different metal cards, and the printing plate I'm ALSO going to include at the LIMITED EDITION Master Level a unique hand drawn SKETCH CARD (by RRParks of course)... your preference of subject matter is a possibility (within reason) OR let me conjure up something unique. ALSO (and this is of special interest to promo card collectors) I'm planning a rather UNIQUE and STRANGE series of promo cards for this project ... the complete set of which will be available ONLY through this Kickstarter's MASTER PLEDGE LEVEL. I do not have the promo cards designed yet but I've figured them out, the logistics, and it's going to be rather... WEIRD and EXPERIMENTAL!
This is all to celebrate the 22nd anniversary of my first publishing project (and the 5th anniversary of RRParks CARDS as a company). 
OPTIONAL: If you want the author (me) to scrawl some personal dedication and doodle inside the front cover just let me know in a message after you've pledged and I'll be happy to vandalize your book! Otherwise, book will be in BRAND NEW condition (even though it's 22 years old!).
OPTIONAL: If you want an addition copy of the book you can simply 'add' to your pledge the amount of $7 (which includes the additional postage costs for US orders).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book already exists ... they copies are all sitting right here. The trading card series will be produced through ICONIX (which has overseen ALL the trading card series produced by RRParks CARDS) and ICONIX and I are using the same resource we used for past projects. This will mark my 20th (I think 20th... 19th at any rate) Kickstarter campaign. I'm putting the 'rewards ship' date at April. It is POSSIBLE I'll be shipping before April but at the moment am working hard to get all previous shipments for other projects done first ... so am guessing April shipping for this project. If you've pledged on previous RRParks CARDS projects then you already know I'm USUALLY on time and whether I'm on time or not I make regular updates to keep everyone informed and I'm pretty darn good about responding to 'messages' in a timely fashion. So if you have any questions you can click to contact me. If you have questions after you've pledged you can click on your pledge and then you'll see the option to contact/message me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: "Just the Book"
support.descp: At the $10 level you get the NEW CONDITION original, first printing copy of the book A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms by RRParks. It will be mailed well packaged and postpaid within the US.

support.title: "Just the Card Set"
support.descp: At this level you get the 25-card set of A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms. All 25-cards produced in full color (fronts) and retro-style duotone (backs ... that's the PLAN anyway!). At $15 the set is shipped POSTPAID within the US.

support.title: "MASTER PLEDGE LEVEL" Everything!!!
support.descp: At this level you get the book PLUS the 25-card series PLUS a printing plate PLUS a unique and genuine sketch card by the author PLUS BOTH limited edition metal cards PLUS an unusual assortment of PROMO CARDS (a full set of which will be available ONLY through this one-time Kickstarter master level)! ALL shipped postpaid in the US. Backers at this level can let me know if they want their book signed/dedicated to them with a doodle (or left in minty-mint condition like it is now). This level is limited to only 100 limited edition sets.

updates.update_content:
UPS showed up today with the cards for 'A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms' along with printing plates. Since it is a small card series there was no pallet ... usually I refer to a day like this as 'pallet day' (for MST3K series two there were a LOT of pallets!) but it was 2 large boxes and 5 flatter boxes by UPS and hand cart.
Everything looks real nice. I noticed that I'd neglected to drop in a certain color on two cards and while most people won't notice it (or will be polite enough to not mention it) I noticed it. My bad ... but they still came out nice (even if the two beach theme cards have a white sky instead of a light blue sky).

Quickie update here ... Nearly all the sketch cards are done for master backers and all 200 (100 of each) metal cards for master backers all have their limited edition COA (Certificate of Authenticities) numbered and attached to the metal cards. Have a few sketch cards to complete and just waiting on the base set cards to come in from printing production.
Four backers haven't completed their surveys yet -- back #s 17, 27, 68 and 90. if you can't recall if you completed the mailing address survey yet just click on your pledge and you'll find your back number. Once you complete the survey (which Kickstarter emailed to you ... or you can find it by logging into Kickstarter) I can do up the paperwork for your pledge and you'll be all set. I can't mail your package without the mailing address survey.

Just quick update on production progress. All 25 cards are now remastered and colorized. And the back graphics are done now, too. A little bit more writing to do for the text of the front and back but that's pretty quick. Both metal cards arrived from Faerie Metal and they look wonderful (but of course they do -- Jacob and Julie at Faerie Metal are geniuses!). The metal card and printing plate COAs have arrived.  The books are, of course, here -- and have been since 1997! So what's left to do is the front and back text, attach the COAs to the metal cards, do the sketch cards and then send to production. Once received from production I'll do up the printing plates and COAs. Am still hoping to mail out packages in late April (if all keeps going as it has been going). I'll be conducting the mailing address surveys once production is done and I have a better idea of mailing dates.

The Kickstarter is over for A Gadzillion Other Uses for Condoms. In some ways this is the most successful Kickstarter campaign I've ever run. About 99% of the 'master set package deals' were pledged. And 99% is better than 100% ... 99% means that 100% of everyone who wanted one GETS one (while 100% could mean that some who wanted it showed up to the party late and couldn't get one). So am happier with 99% than I would be with 100%. 
So what happens next? I've been working on the digital colorizing of the cards and if all goes well I'll have all the files ready for production by the end of this coming weekend. The metal cards are already in production -- because they are limited to only 100 total sets I was able to put that order in weeks ago and so Faerie Metal is working on them now. The books themselves were published 22 years ago and kept in safe storage all this time. That leaves only the cards to finish up and get to printing production ... AND of course the sketch cards (which will take a bit of time... 99 sketch cards is NOT something I can churn out in an afternoon) ... however, the blanks are already produced and here. So even before the Kickstarter officially ended, the production aspects of this project were already underway... and in some cases DECADES ago!

Hey! Wow -- thank you for the enthusiasm! 66% of the 'make 100' limited edition pledge level is pledged ... and within the first 12 hours of the campaign. That's GREATLY GREAT and WONDEROUSLY WONDERFUL ... 'good' even!

project_data.project_name: MAKE 100 : RRParks CARDS Gadzillion Other Uses For Condoms

campaign.story:
It's been a year since I released the 5th set. It's time for the 6th set of FACE CARDS to claw back the soil and crawl from the grave.
If you're familiar with all of my previous FACE CARDS Kickstarter campaigns then you should know the quality and passion that I put into each trading card set. For those who are coming into this new, let me tell what you'll expect...
My main objective with each Kickstarter campaign is to raise funds for the printing costs and cover shipping and Kickstarter fees. The majority of the cards have been created and are ready for press. I just need a little financial help to get the ball rolling.
By supporting you'll get the basic ZOMBIES set PLUS EXCLUSIVE material (rewards) only offered here as a Kickstarter backer!
As before, I've opted for a 21 day fundraising period. Please share this with a ghoul, a friend, and a fan who might also be interested in this novelty item.
UPDATE: Final Stretch Goal unlocked! All backers will receive a 4 sticker set to be voted on after the campaign ends, 5 Zombie Fighter cards, and 5 Bonus Zombie cards.
Click to view ALL of the ZOMBIE cards
THE CARDS
Each basic 25 card set has 1 title card and 24 b&w Zombie portrait cards.
Every backer will also receive 1 limited 'Kickstarter Funded' title card.
Every card has a detailed monstrous portrait on the front and revealing info about the character on the back. The info includes; character's name, actor, movie they were in, director, synopsis, trivia, and poster.
The sets does not contain any nudity and is considered "safe for work."
Only 500 sets will be produced, the title card will be signed and numbered, and each set will be in its own crystal clear 2 piece slider box.
There will be one character per film or tv program in the regular set and possible others in stretch-goal cards. I chose these characters to balance out future ZOMBIES editions. There are so many zombies, I could do a few editions. Something to look forward to... to spread the zombie infection!
PLEDGE LEVELS
Every pledge level will have 1 regular ZOMBIES card set and 1 Kickstarter title card. Pledge levels other than the 'Single Set' will have extra items (see image below). For example, the 'Take 2 Sets' will consist of; 1 ZOMBIES card set, 1 KS title card, and a set of your choosing. It can be another ZOMBIES set or one of the other sets. Any additional sets will be an Add-On. The 'choosing' will happen after the Kickstarter ends, funds are collected, and the survey is emailed out. In the survey, I will ask for your mailing address, your choices, and other FACE CARDS related questions.
ADD-ONS
The items below can be added on to your initial pledge. Increase your pledge by adding the item amount to your pledge level. If you have already pledged, there should be a button in the side bar that says "manage my pledge." For example, if you're in the U.S. and you pledge at the ALL 6 SETS ($55 + $9 shipping) level and you want to add-on another set ($11) for a friend, you pledge a total amount of $75.
The amounts below include shipping for that add-on item.
Add-On an extra ZOMBIES set or add-on sets that you missed. Be sure to mention A) Zombies B) Vampires, C) Anti-Heroes, D) Creatures, E) Killer Dudes, or F) Killer Babes when the 'Survey' is emailed to you at the end of the Kickstarter.
As a special Kickstarter ONLY reward, the ZOMBIES set will be available as Metal Cards! Get them as a Pledge Level or as an Add-On. No where else will you be able to get this limited feature.
There's only a few original drawings left from all 6 sets. Claim what remain before they're all gone. PLEASE MESSAGE ME DIRECTLY IF YOUR ADD-ON IS FOR ORIGINAL CARD ART. We don't want any one else trying to claim that item. Most of the original art for this set has been claimed. However, there will be a few stretch-goal card art that will be available when announced.
STRETCH GOALS
Here are a couple Kickstarter EXCLUSIVES that I have planned to give to you at no additional cost. The more the campaign generates, the more free Stretch Goal items I can offer to every backer. First up, is a 5 card ZOMBIE FIGHTER sub-set! Then, if all goes well, there will be a potential additional set of 5 ADDITIONAL ZOMBIES. Check out the updates for details. Let's see if we reach all of these stretch goals!
 MANY THANKS!
Please tell a friend and share on social media!
More editions of FACE CARDS are planned for the future. But, as I've done in the past, I've left that decision up to the backers. Expect a new set every 5-6 months (roughly)! Stay alert!
Check out the Facebook page The Art of Byron Winton to see more of my 4x6 drawings, many of which these cards are based on. Follow me on Instagram and Twitter. Lastly, join me on Patreon to support in the creative process and to sign-up for the popular Card-of-the-Month program.
Thank you for your interest and support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At the time of the launch, I have a few images left to complete for the set. I plan to have them done before the campaign ends. In doing so, the Available Original Art will reflect their completion.

I given myself enough printer time for an end of March delivery for all the regular set backers. However, in the event that I am unable to ship by March, I will inform with a shipping update.

For those of you getting the 4"x6" drawing rewards with your sets, please be patient during the creation of those. I will produce them as quickly as I can without disrupting my current work-load. Depending on the quantity will determine the complete turn around time. I will mail in weekly batches.

I will be adjusting quantities available if necessary. There are ONLY 500 sets being produced... and even less are available for the previous sets.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey collector card fiends! Some of you may already know this, but for those who don't, I've launched the next set of FACE CARDS! This time around it's KILLER DUDES Edition No. 2!
The good news is that it just made it's funding goal on day 3! The great news is that Stretch Goal items are just around the corner! Who doesn't like free stuff? I'd love to see you continue the support!
Much appreciated!

updates.update_userinfo: Custom Original Art Pt. 2 and Next Set Update
updates.update_content:
The 2nd anniversary of George A. Romero's unfortunate passing was a couple days ago. I figured this would be a good time to post an update with a couple Romero influenced drawings.
Here are some more Custom Original 4x6 drawings I made for a couple other backers. Hinzman, the 1st Zombie from Night of the Living Dead, Tom Savini as Machete Zombie from Land of the Dead, and Greg Nicotero as a zombie from an episode of The Walking Dead. I'll have the last batch to show as they become available.

Hey gang! It's been a few months since the last update and there's been some progress with the Custom Original 4x6 Art for those backers. I have a small bunch of them to do and they're slowly getting done. These on top of my client work has kept me very busy over the past few months. I apologize for any delay. Here's a couple that I've completed; Liv Moore from iZombie, Hereditary's Annie Graham, Eric Draven from The Crow. I'll have a few more to show as they become available.

updates.update_userinfo: Infection is Spreading - A Shipping Update
updates.update_content: Thank you to those who joined me during the Live Facebook Video Q&A Collating Party the other day! If you missed out, you can still check out the video! It started a little rough, but once I got my footing, it was a zombie trot to the finish line.

Hey everyone! Just a brief update of things and stuff.
Surveys were sent out late last night. I received many back promptly. Thank you! The sooner I get them all in, the sooner I can place the order for the stickers. I opted to leave out the Zombie Hunters sub-set as options just because. They're great as bonus cards, but not as kick-ass zombie stickers!
It's been busy over here at FACE CARDS headquarters. I finally finished up the last of the drawings for all of the cards. The backs have also been completed and proofed. The files are ready for the printer! Now to rework them for the metal card set. Then it's on to the stickers!

campaign.story:
[NOTE: Optional ADD ONS have been added to the bottom of this page ... MST3K Series One boxes and UNCUT card sheets. Scroll to the bottom for more information]
Mystery  Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards Series Two is COMING! And SOON! Current plan  is to have the series released late in October. And Series Two picks up right  where Series One left off. While the first series of MST3K Trading Cards' base  sets covered the Invention Exchanges and Experiments of the first three seasons,  this second series covers original seasons four, five, six and seven... PLUS a  special subset covering the KTMA episodes. Series Two sees the end of the Joel  era and the start of the Mike Nelson era ... the end of the TV's Frank era and  the start of the Pearl era. As with MST3K Trading Cards Series One, all episodes  (invention Exchanges and Experiments) are covered.    
The  entire second series is designed and already through the approval process and  heading right into printing production. And as we did in the first Kickstarter,  this Kickstarter includes exclusives available ONLY for backers. This pre-order  campaign runs from September 1st through September 30th. 
MST3K Trading Cards Series Two isn't just  larger than Series One but it might also be one of the largest non-sport trading  card series ever published with over 500 different cards to collect. But don't  let that 'worry' you because a master set pledge gets you ALL of the cards (and  here's a shocker -- although LARGER than Series One the master set is priced  LESS. How often does a business offer MORE ... for LESS!).     
Here's  a visual 'grand tour' of the series:     MYSTERY  SCIENCE THEATER 3000 Series Two Trading cards features: A  118-card "Invention Exchange" base set -- every invention of seasons 4, 5, 6 and  7 episodes of the show (well, except for episodes that had no inventions). With  each card featuring the invention on the front and on the back of the card is  the dialogue of the Invention Exchange. 
Sample INVENTION EXCHANGE cards
A  78-card "Experiment" base set -- every experiment of the 4th, 5th, 6th and  7th seasons. The card fronts feature a classic scene from the show and the backs  of the cards cover the movie title, release date, air date, host, director,  stars, synopsis, classic riff and trivia. And there are some scarce variation  cards to look for! Don't worry -- if you're pledging on the Master Set you get  ALL the variations.  
Examples of EXPERIMENT cards ... look for scarce VARIATIONS CARDS!
A  47-card special subset featuring MST3K iconic mini movie posters from the Shout!  Factory DVD releases ... and terrific DVD menu art on the card backs. Steve  Vance (artist) has personally helped in obtaining high res images of his poster  art so the cards can look as lovely as you hope they'll look.  
Examples of the Steve Vance Mini Poster Art Cards (with Shout! Factory DVD menu graphics on the backs)
 A  99-card 'Riff It' subset featuring a scene from a movie featured on the show  along with a hilarious riff ... and on the back? Another scene with space for  you to write your OWN riff. Eleven different movies and 9 cards per each movie.   
Examples of RIFF IT Cards ... 11 different 9 card sets covering 11 different MST3K-featured movies
And  why is there a FREE pair of 3D glasses in the top of the card box? How about 36  different Anaglyph 3D cards! Put on your 3D glasses and each of these specially  designed cards POPS into THREE DIMENSIONS! Designed by the incredibly talented  anaglyphist Christian LeBlanc and features scenes from riffed movies, host  segments and DVD poster art. Christian did such a wonderful job on his 18 Series  One 3Ds that I asked him to come back for Series Two and do TWICE as many! And  he's done a truly breathtaking job of them (in fact, he did such a great job on  MST3K 3D cards I commissioned him to do Sharknado's 3D cards as well). 
Examples of just ONE of the 36 different Christian LeBlanc designed MST3K Anaglyph 3D cards in MST3K Series Two
Before Season One of Mystery Science Theater 3000 there was a season of MST3K ... the KTMA episodes. Can't very well have a card series of MST3K and NOT have a subset of the KTMA episodes. So all 22 KTMA episodes are represented in this 22-card subset with Joel, Crow, Tom Servo, Gypsy, Dr. Forrester and Larry (back when they were trying to decide if they were mad scientists or just scientists who were mad).
An example of the 22 different KTMA era MST3K cards
NOT very many of us have one (let alone all 9 different) Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Movie 'promo cards'.  So, apart from slight design modifications of the legal notice, year, card number here is the complete set of all 9 different promo cards from the 1990s!
Example of one of the 1990s MST3K: The Movie promo cards ... reprinted here for the first time. Collect all 9!
Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series One featured some of the most beautiful sketch cards ever brought to the hobby of trading card collecting. Since sketch cards are unique and only ONE person can ever own an original sketch card I decided -- and the artists each permitted  me -- to create Sketch Card Artist Gallery Promo Cards. There are 63 different in this series and they feature all different actual sketch card art from MST3K Series One. 
Examples of the MST3K Sketch Card Artist GALLERY promo cards... promoting the sketch cards to be found in random packs of MST3K Trading Cards.
As we all know, during MST3K original series season 7 TV's Frank left and Pearl became the other 'mad' along with Dr. Forrester. Since the MST3K Trading Card box only had enough room for the opening scenes of seasons 4, 5 and 6 I've created this BONUS mini-clipout card panel BOX TOPPER so the alternative intro scenes can have their own mini cards to collect. This will be in every box of MST3K (and, of course, in all Master Sets).
Special Production 'mini clip-out cards' box topper panels. Complete set in EVERY box of MST3K!
A  full, sealed box of Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series Two Trading Cards is  guaranteed to contain at least ONE complete set and subset of Invention Exchange Base Set, Experiment Base Set, Vance / DVD Menu Art Cards, 3D cards and more mentioned above.    "But  WAIT! There's MORE!" In each box you'll find randomly inserted limited edition and rare chase cards to collect:   A  24-card limited edition Macarie Claudiu MST3K art card series featuring Joel,  Mike, Gypsy, Tom, Crow, Dr. Forrester, TV's Frank, Pearl and Bobo and NEW SEASON  characters Jonah, Kinga, Max ... and then on to some actors from the movies and  serials. A total of 24 commissioned portraits by 'Chronicles of the Three  Stooges' official artist Macarie. 
1 of 24 different Macarie Limited Edition Portrait Cards
Because  I'm a big fan of GLOW IN THE DARK trading cards there will be NINE different  GLOW IN THE DARK Mystery Science Theater 3000 trading cards. My print production  broker Karen 'Wonder Woman' Cowan has connections with a production company that  does thermographic phosphorescent work (like the Glow in the Dark cards I  published for Chronicles of the Three Stooges Series Four). These are gonna be  SOOO COOOOOL! 
1 of 9 different GLOW IN THE DARK Mystery Science Theater 3000 rare cards
There  will also be genuine, unique printing plates to be found. Each printing plate is  UNIQUE as there can only be ONE printing plate for each of the four colors used  to create a full color card. These will be randomly inserted into box packs and  your box may be lucky enough to have one. Master Set backers, of course, will  get one.      
Examples of genuine printing plates to seek and find in packs of MST3K Trading Cards Series Two
In  some boxes you'll find a pack that contains a UNIQUE original art 'sketch card'.  These sketch cards are 1 of 1 and RARE -- I commissioned some of the very best  sketch card artists in the hobby. Here's a current list of artists planned (and  some of these artist have already gotten their work in -- take a look at this  list: Aaron Laurich,  Achilleas Kokkinakis, Adam Beck, Andy  Moore, Ariel Mamani, Brent Scotchmer, Brian Abston, Caleb  King, Carlos Cabaleiro, Christian Baster, Daniel Gorman, Danny  Hayman,  Darrin Pepe, Dave Gaskin, David Day, Eric Lehtonen, Gary  Kezel, Ingrid Hardy, James Dickson, Jamie Hitchcock, Jason  Crosby, Jeff Abar, Jenette Brown, Jerry Bennet,  Jerry Garcia Jr., Jim O'Riley, Jonarton, Jon Mangini, Juan Rosales, Kevin P.  West,  Kris Penix, Kristin Allen, Kyle Burles, Laura  Atikinson, Laura Martin, Lee Brown,  Louise Draper, Marsha  Parkins, Matt Appelgate,  Norvietro Basio,  Rebecca  Sharp, Rees Finaly, Rich Molinelli, Robert Floydman, Sammy  Gomez,  Scott Rorie, Tim Proctor, Tim Shay, Todd Smith, Tony  Keaton, Trent Westbrook,
    and introducing Bujtor Klara. If you're a serious card collector then chances are you recognize MOST of these  artists as being sketch artist SUPERSTARS in the hobby. When these artists found  out I was publishing MST3K Trading Cards they wanted in!  At this date I do not yet have ALL sketch cards turned in and so the list above may change slightly (if an artist or two is late then they will be moved to MST3K Series Three) and there are actually some additional artists that have just recently been brought aboard. This list above is to give you a SENSE of what artists are involved. Quite a list, isn't it! 
Examples of genuine, original art sketch cards randomly inserted in packs of MST3K Trading Cards (naturally every master set has ONE sketch card)
Randomly  inserted into packs you may find rare 'Faux Film Cell' cards -- 4 different  styles to collect but EACH and EVERY ONE of them is UNIQUE. No two alike! These  four cards include Pearl, Doctor Forrester, Mike Nelson ... and Mike Nelson in  various guises and disguises. The numbering for these cell cards picks up right after Series One's cell cards (series one were numbered 1 through 8 ... series two are numbered 9 through 12).  
Examples of 2 (of 4 different) MST3K Faux Cell Cards ... EVERY cell in EVERY card is unique. No two cell cards are alike
Inside  the top of each box, alongside the free pair of 3D glasses, you'll find a 1 of 9  different Full Metal box topper card, produced by those geniuses at Faerie Metal  (the best producer of limited edition metal cards in the biz!).  
5 of 9 different Metal Box Topper cards to collect
Each  and every full, sealed box of Mystery Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards  carries 40 packs (that's right... not 18 or 24 or other industry averages ...  and not 36 packs like MST3K Series One ... but FORTY packs! and each pack has 10  cards (a typical modern day card series usually features 5 or 6 cards per pack  and only 18 or 24 packs to a box ... but I'm a serious fan of MST3K and card  collecting so my card series always include more ... and my saying over here is  "Too much is never enough"). With this many packs and that many cards in each  pack your odds are good for pulling rare cards... and the chances of putting  together complete sets of Experiments, Invention Exchanges, MST3K mini poster  and DVD menu art cards subset and Anaglyph 3D cards is excellent (in fact, those  complete sets and subsets are guaranteed in each box).  
As a BONUS, the MST3K  retail box of 40 packs features something NO other publisher provides: Printed  right on the box are 36 different mini double-sided clip-out cards in FULL color  front and back on 24pt super glossy stock. It's almost like getting a FREE 36  card special subset. Oh wait, it IS like that EXACTLY! Each  pack wrapper features a complete checklist printed on the inside showing you all  the cards to look for to complete your set. 
SO  HOW DO I GET ALL THIS AMAZING STUFF AND SATIATE MY DIRE NEED FOR MST3K  COLLECTIBLES??? 
It's  easy. You'll notice there are many different pledge levels -- levels to fit all  collector budgets.  
Level  1: $2 You  get ONE promo card for the MST3K Series Two Trading Card collection.  
Level  2: $5 You  get FIVE different promo cards for the MST3K Series Two Trading Card  collection. 
Level  3: $10 You  get THREE sealed packs of cards. Each pack contains 10 different cards. Consider  this a 'sampler' level. And you'll also get a promo card, too.  
Level  4: $75 You  get a FULL SEALED BOX of 40 10-card packs. Guaranteed to contain complete sets  of Experiment cards (78 cards), Invention Exchange cards (118 cards), MST3K mini  poster and DVD menu art cards (47 cards), Anaglyph 3D cards (36 cards), and Riff  It Retro-stalgic style cards (99) ... you'll also get randomly inserted rare and  hit cards which could include a printing plate, original art sketch card, 'Faux  Film Cell' card, limited edition Macarie Claudiu art card, Glow in the Dark  card, Sketch Card Artist Gallery promo cards, KTMA subset cards and more. Each  box comes with a free pair of 3D glasses PLUS 1 of 9 different Full Metal Box  Topper cards. You ALSO get some MST3K promo cards. 
Level  5: $160 At  this level you get a MASTER SET. What's in a MASTER SET? Well I'll tell you!  It's everything. See all those cool cards in the 'grand tour'? Your collection  will include all of them. All the cards will be inside a retail box ... you'll  also receive 3 UNUSED wrappers. 500 cards will barely fit inside the box  unwrapped so it's going to be one REALLY thick, heavy box of cards -- all ready  for you to load into your card collection (you'll want a lot of 9-pocket pages  for THIS rascal!). And I might even have some more surprises for you depending  on pledge levels.  This is the level you want if you're a super fan and gotta  have EVERYTHING. IMPORTANT: A 'master set' will ONLY be available during this  Kickstarter pre-sell ... and during the Kickstarter I MAY have to limit the  number of these available (so you may want to jump on this one fast before the  option is gone).   
Level  6: $220. This level is a combination of Level 4 and Level 5 -- at this  level you get a 40-pack box AND a master set. This way your master set gives you  ALL the cards... and you still have a 40-pack sealed box to either open packs,  save for a rainy day, give as a gift, use as a boat anchor or whatever else your  imagination can come up with. I will guarantee that those pledging at this level  WILL have a sketch card in their 40-pack box (so at this level you're getting a  master set with a sketch card... AND a box with a sketch card lurking somewhere  inside all those packs).      
Level  7: $280 Four  Box Case Level. At this level you get FOUR sealed 40-pack boxes (for the  contents description of a box just look at Level Four above). A great level for  those who want to build sets and have duplicate sets to sell on ebay or give to  a friend or simply keep because you're greedy and fiending for cards... a great  level for those who love the thrill of seeking rare chase and hit cards... a  great level for those wanting to have the odds in their favor of finding more  than one sketch card, printing plate, or other limited edition material. This  level also includes the promo cards. As a BONUS, those who get the Four Box Case  Level will get some guaranteed bonus stuff like uncut panels, additional  printing plates, error and freak cards (I won't know what errors or oddballs  I'll have until AFTER printing production... but virtually every printing  production does end up with some oddball cards and with a production job this  big am sure we'll have errors, freaks and oddballs), and more. Hurry on over to  the local store and grab a barrel full of bubble gum as this level will keep you  busy for HOURS!   
Level  8: $500 DOUBLE  the 'Four Box Case Level'. You get every everything in Level 6...DOUBLED. So  that's EIGHT boxes and all those goodies. And at this level I'll make it even  MORE worth your while by loading up on the freebies and bonus stuff.    
Questions  and Answers:
Q:  I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do  I go about it?  A:  Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable  to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no  worries. 
--------------- 
Q:  When will the MST3K Trading Card Series ship? A:  The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of October. I'm good about  posting updates and communications so will keep everyone in the loop. Virtually  every trading card series I've published has been issued ON schedule.  I do,  though, ask for patience in advance ... this is the first time I've published a  trading card series this large. My other 'largest' card series was Chronicles of  the Three Stooges Series Four with just over 300 cards ... and this series of  MST3K is almost TWICE as large. I've gotten pretty good about working through  logistics, numbers, time and such but just want everyone to know I'll be making  a real effort to release the end of October and IF I'm a little late it will  only be a LITTLE late. Not months and months late. Still, am aiming for end of  October. 
 --------------------- 
Q:  I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two  boxes? Or two 'Master Sets'?  A:  If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ...  then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge  amount. Be SURE to message me if you do this explaining what you did. I'll check  and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine. The way I believe it's done is  after you pledge you click to view/manage your pledge and then you change the  amount of your pledge to reflect everything you want in your package. So, for  example, if you want to pledge on two master sets you just pledge on ONE. After  your pledge is entered you can click on view/manage your pledge and change the  $160 to $320 to reflect TWO master sets (backers outside the US MUST message me  to find out postage requirements... US packages are postpaid).  
----------------- 
Q:  Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or  through a catalog? A:  This is my 17th Kickstarter over the last 4 years. I've found that pre-selling a  card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of  cards and boxes. It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a  limited basis. Once the Kickstarter is done I will have a good idea of what the  total 'sealed box' needs will be for a production run to provide Kickstarter  backers AND other customers (when the series is offered through distributors and  retail outlets). A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious  collectors FIRST before ANYONE else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise  some flexibility on providing 'stuff' for backers ... once the Kickstarter is  over the only planned retail/wholesale activity for series one is simply retail  boxes of 40 packs. No master sets, no case deals with bonus 'swag', no  individual packs or promo card sets or anything else. Once this Kickstarter is  ended the ONLY available material will be sealed 36-pack boxes (may be 40 packs, but for sure Kickstarter backers will have 40-pack boxes ... retail boxes after the Kickstarter may have only 36)... months from  now. 
ADD ON GOODIES:
Since I've had requests for certain extra items I'm making these available to Kickstarter backers as 'add ons'. So if you want a box of MST3K Series One or MST3K Series One uncut card sheets (180 cards in uncut sheets!) you can add them onto your pledge easily. Here's how: If you've already got a pledge on this project and want a box of MST3K Series One cards just click to view/manage your pledge and add $75 for each series one box you want. If you want a set of uncut sheets (2 different sheets each having 90 different cards) just add on $68 for each set of 2 sheets you want (1 set of 2 sheets is $68, not $68 per sheet... just $68 for a set of BOTH uncut sheets). If you want something not listed just let me know and if it's possible we'll do it. Add On prices are postpaid in the US. If you're outside the US let me know before doing the add on so I can research postage costs to your country. And of course if you have any questions just ask! My goal is to make sure you have fun with your collection and it's everything you want it to be. 
----------------------- 
If  you have a question not answered here please just ask -- you can message me  directly through Kickstarter and I will respond as quickly as possible. it is  better to message me than to post a comment. Kickstarter shows me MESSAGES as  soon as they are posted but is not consistent with showing me 'comments'. So  asking me questions through messages is better. If you can't figure out how to  message on Kickstarter then just contact me through my RRParksCARDS.com website
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks? Well I suppose an asteroid could come hurtling through space and land on my head. Otherwise, this is my 17th Kickstarter Campaign... and I've published dozens of other card series over the last 4 years (including seven different Three Stooges series, Gary Saves the Graveyard, two Basil Wolverton series, Japanese Horror in 3D, am currently finishing up Sharknado Series One and others). I know my way around card publishing and financing production. For MST3K Series Two I have the BEST sketch card artists on board, the BEST printing production broker on the planet (Karen 'Wonder Woman' Cowan at ICONIX who has overseen ALL the card series I've published since I started my business), and ALL cards are written and designed and ready for production and officially approved through Shout! Factory. I also consider myself an excellent communicator -- you can view my other Kickstarters and see the level at which I keep backers informed during a campaign, after a campaign, during card production/collation/assembly, and through actual shipping of cards to backers AND afterwards. You'll NEVER be left wondering "what's going on" because I post regular updates and keep in contact with EVERYONE. I've never had a publishing challenge I couldn't overcome with the help of my printing production broker ... and except once (when I was 2 weeks late shipping on one campaign) I've shipped everyone their goodies ON TIME (with the ONLY exceptions being backers who didn't let me know WHERE to send their stuff... those were delayed of course. So please note: AFTER this Kickstarter ends and right before I start shipping I'm going to send out what's called a 'mailing address survey' ... be sure to fill that out and message it back to me when the time comes so there's no delays in mailing your package. Okay? Okay!). While there are always risks and challenges with production, logistics or even crossing the street I have years of experience publishing trading cards and conducting Kickstarter campaigns. So the risks and challenges are minimized.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What am I doing?
As a kid, I loved getting sports cards, but I especially loved getting the card that were illustrated. For some reason, they really appealed to me, to know that someone took the time to paint a portrait of a player for a card, and they all looked so good!
I want to bring that back to the collector and sports fan alike! As an illustrator, one of my favorite things to illustrate are sports athletes. With DangFresh cards, each season will bring a new unique look and style than the season before. Season 1 will be about big names in the NBA, next season who knows!! That's what the fun is all about!!
Season 1 of DangFresh cards consists of 34 NBA players, which can be put into 3 different categories:
1: The common cards: 26 of the 34 cards will be the common cards, they're still way good players and whatnot... 
2: The Uncommon Cards: these 5 cards are the guys that are just so popular, that you're just going to want them all. 
3: The Ultra Rare: only 3 players in this group, these are the ones you'll want to write home about... 
-- 
The Future of DangFresh
I'm excited to see what the future holds for DangFresh, I think Season 2 is going to be something incredible. I appreciate you, your time as well as your support!
I am super pumped to get this going and I hope you are too!
Nick Jarvis.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is a pretty straightforward project, there can be some risks and challenges involved (but only on my end). 

The biggest challenge will be once funded, beating that deadline of January 1, 2019. My goals is, once reached that I get you your rewards first and foremost and as soon as I can. 

That said, i am confident that I can make deadlines and make sure you get your rewards :)

Thank you again!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
FINALLY -- after over 5 years of Sharknado fandom comes the official Sharknado Trading Card Series we've all been waiting for. In cooperation with The SYFY Channel and The Asylum I've been working with David Latt (Producer), David Garber (Executive Producer) and Anthony Ferrante (Director) and we've put together a PHENOMENOL Sharknado collectible trading card series. And it's happening right now. This minute. And YOU can be part of the whole process AND add these cards to your Sharknado collection. 
My name is Richard Parks, publisher (CEO, designer ... and janitor) at RRParksCARDS. Perhaps you've collected some of my previous card series which include The Three Stooges, Mystery Science Theater 3000, Gary Saves the Graveyard, and other card series. If so, you already know what to expect. If not, then just know that I don't do 'small' card series ... 'Too much is never enough!'. And I produce the types card series I myself want to collect. And Sharknado is exactly that -- this is the card series I want to exist. And it has extensive base sets covering Sharknado and Sharknado 2, genuine movie-used relic cards, Anaglyph 3D cards, beautiful original art sketch cards, subsets, Faux Film Cell cards, metal cards and more. This is the first series and it features Sharknado and Sharknado 2 (series two will feature Sharknado 3 and Sharknado 4 and series three will feature Sharknado 5 and Sharknado 6) 
Here's a visual tour of Sharknado Trading Cards Series One: 
Sharknado Base Set, 90 Different Cards
Sharknado 2, 90-card Base Set
Base Cards and subsets. There are TWO base sets in this series ... the first base set is a 90-card set of Sharknado. The series is sequentially numbered lovely photos as seen in Sharknado (and in the order seen in the movie). The back text is the shoot script for that scene so you can relive the movie in this 90-card set just as it happened. And that's the same for the 90-card set of Sharknado 2! BOTH movies. Two complete 90-card base sets for a total of 180 different cards. And the special subset is the "Bloody Subset" featuring gooey, nasty scenes of sharkish mayhem. My plan is to produce this subset with a special coating so the blood shimmers when cards are held at a light source. That's in the works as of this Kickstarter launch. In any event, though, the 'Bloody Subset' is another 18 cards (or more). 
18 Diffrent 3D Anaglyph cards and FREE pair of 3D glasses in each box
3D anaglyph 18 card subset. Oh this is cool -- RRParksCARDS has spared no expense in making this series all it can be and we've brought on the 3D anaglyph genius Christian LeBlanc (known for LOADS of 3D projects, perhaps best known for his 3D work on Star Wars projects). Each card features on the front a traditional red/blue anaglyph TRUE 3D photo. Using the free pair of 3D glasses you'll find in the box you can view the image in stunning THREEEEEE DIMENSIONSSSSS! On the back is a detail 3D image showing you a highlight of the next 3D card in this subset. Christian has shown me some of the cards he's done and they are lovely. If you collected Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series One you'll have seen his amazing anaglyph 3D work in those 18 MST3K cards. 
4 Different Scarce Faux Film Cell Cards -- Each is UNIQUE
Faux Film Cells. We all like adding truly unique cards to our collections and that's why Sharknado series one has Faux Film Cell cards. As well all know, Sharknado 1 and 2 were not released in the theater and so there are no 35mm cells existing. However, like I did for MST3K series one I've created Sharknado Faux Film Cell cards. These diecut cards each have a UNIQUE (no two cells alike) cell embedded in the card. Hold to a light source and you can see a brilliant full color UNIQUE film cell. There are four different in this special chase subset -- cells of 'Fin', 'April', 'Nova' and The Sharknado!
4 Different Genuine Movie-Used Costume Prop Relic Cards
Relic Cards. These are pure magic! David Latt generously helped secure genuine movie-used costumes and props for the creation of these relic cards. Sharknado series one features FOUR different relic cards. One of Tara Reid's (April's) white jacket from the opening shots in Sharknado 2, Ian Ziering's (Fin's) jacket from Sharknado 4, the bloody sleeve of Tara's jacket in Sharknado 2 when the shark bit off her arm (how about THAT for an iconic genuine costume card!) and Cassandra Scerbo's (Nova's) military style combat jacket from Sharknado 5. These aren't replica props, these are the actual costumes SEEN in the movies. You'll be able to own an actual PIECE of Sharknado movie history. 
Beautiful FULL METAL BOX TOPPER CARDS produced by Faerie Metal
Metal card box toppers. There are 12 planned. These are full metal, full color cards -- same size as standard trading cards but about twice as thick and produced in full metal from those terrific folks at Faerie Metal (the leaders in the metal card industry... besides being really nice guys). Each card has a full color Sharknado poster graphic on the front and a certificate of authenticity on the back. Boxes will have ONE of the TWELVE different cards inside the box top area (along with the free pair of 3D glasses). Collect all 12 ... or GET all 12 with a master level pledge. 
9 Different Limited Edition Special Commission Portrait Cards with Puzzle Backs
Limited Edition portrait puzzle cards by Macarie Claudiu. Mr. Claudiu is a top shelf graphite realist artist who has worked on countless productions in his native Romania -- and he's also worked on portrait cards for my other trading card projects including Chronicles of the Three Stooges series 1, 2, 3, and 4 and Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series Two. He's done 9 different original portraits for this special limited edition subset. The fronts feature his artwork ... and the backs of the cards feature a 9-card puzzle scene of behind-the-scenes 'making of' Sharknado 2 with 'Fin' suspended by ropes, holding a chainsaw, with a greenscreen behind him. 
Just three examples of the Sketch Cards to be found randomly inserted in packs
Sketch Cards. These are special -- I've brought on the BEST artists in the hobby to work on these. What IS a 'sketch card'? A sketch card is a specially produced card that's had an original artwork painted, drawn, inked, graphited, etc. right on the card. NO two are alike because each is an actual original artwork. My first project to include sketch cards was MST3K Series One and the collector response was enormous and extremely enthusiastic. And that's because I bring on the best artists. As of this Kickstarter I'm still bringing on more artists but here's a list of those already hard at work on Sharknado sketch cards: Aaron Laurich, Achilleas Kokkinakis, Adam Beck, Andy Moore, Ariel Mamani, Brent Scotchmer, Brian Abston, Caleb King, Carlos Cabaleiro, Christian Baxter, Daniel Gorman, Danny Hayman, Darrin Pepe, Dave Gaskin, David Day, Eric Lehtonen, Gary Kezel, Ingrid Hardy, James Dickson, Jamie Cosley, Jamie Hitchcock, Jason Crosby, Jeff Abar, Jenette Brown, Jerry Bennet, Jerry Garcia Jr, Jim O'Riley, Jon Arton, Jon Mangini, Juan Rosales, Kevin P. West, Kris Penix, Kristin Allen, Kyle Burles, Laura Atikinson, Laura Martin, Lee Brown, Louise Draper, Marsha Parkins, Matt Appelgate, Matt Stewart, Norvietro Basio, Ray Racho, Rebecca Sharp, Rees Finaly, Rich Molinelli, Robert Floydman, Sammy Gomez, Scott Rorie, Tim Proctor, Tim Shay, Todd Smith, Tony Keaton, Trent Westbrook, Wayne Tully, and introducing Bujtor Klara. MORE being added, too!
Examples of printing plate cards (every card is only ONE color used to create the trading card)
Printing Plates. Every series I publish I obtain the actual printing plates from the printing company. I clean them up a little bit and attach a certificate of authenticity to the backs. Result? A unique, one-of-a-kind printing plate that was used to actually create the trading card series. They are the size of a standard trading card (but of course... they were used to print the card!). There's only ONE magenta card #13 printing plate, only ONE cyan card #44 back printing plate ... no matter what printing plate or plates you HAVE you are the ONLY one to every have that plate. 
Example of rare Progressive Proof cards
Progressive proofs are done during the printing production process. Sometimes the printer is testing the cyan plate or the cyan and black ink registrations. Sometimes progressive proofs have only one color, sometimes two colors... sometimes the back is blank and sometimes it has printing. These are neat 'oddities' and fun to collect because very few of each progressive proof are ever created -- and you'll have one of the few progressive proofs (too bad for other card collectors who don't jump on board this Kickstarter). I make these available on Kickstarters to make sure those who are supportive of a card series on Kickstarter will have something rare and fun for their collection. 
Each retail box has 36 10-card packs plus box topper AND a pair of FREE 3D glasses!
Box and Packs. One thing I really like to see in trading card series is a LOT of cards per pack, a LOT of packs in a box, and a pricetag that's collector friendly. PLUS something creative with the box. So what I'm doing is publishing this series with 10 cards per pack (rather than the usual 5 or 6 cards like some publishers)... and 36 packs per box (instead of the usual 20 or 24 packs). And the box itself has 36 mini clipout cards on 24pt glossy stock and each card has front and back graphics in full color. Each pack has a full series checklist printed right on the inside of the wrapper (so you'll have enough wrappers it will be okay to actually write on one, marking off the checklist the way a checklist should be used). And if you're a card collector then you already know that 36 10-card packs for only $85 is TWICE as many cards for HALF as much money as other card series. I want this and ALL my card series to be affordable by as many collectors as possible. 
SO HOW DO I GET ALL THIS AMAZING STUFF AND SATIATE MY DIRE NEED FOR SHARKNADO COLLECTIBLES??? 
It's easy. You'll notice there are many different pledge levels -- levels to fit all collector budgets. 
Level 1: $4 You get THREE promo cards and the knowledge you helped my new company. 
Level 2: $10 You get TWO sealed packs of cards. Each pack contains 10 different cards. Consider this a 'sampler' level. And you'll also get a promo card, too. 
Level 3: $35 You get TEN sealed packs of cards plus 2 promo cards PLUS, available on through this Kickstarter, a rare progressive proof Sharknado card. 
Level 4: $75 You get a FULL SEALED BOX of 36 10-card packs. Guaranteed to contain complete sets of Sharknado base set (90 cards), Sharknado 2 base set (90 cards), 'Bloody Subset' (18 cards currently planned but I might expand this), and all 18 Sharknado 3D cards (plus a free pair of 3D glasses to view them in all their dimensional glory). If your 36-pack box you'll find a few rare and scarce hit and chase cards which might include Faux Film Cell cards, limited edition Macarie Claudiu portrait art / puzzle back cards, genuine unique printing plate, genuine movie-used costume relic card, original art sketch card by some of the best sketch card artists in the hobby, and more. And each box has ONE full metal box topper card. PLUS, available on through this Kickstarter, a rare progressive proof Sharknado card and a Sharknado promo card.  
Level 5: $160 Okay, this is the BIG level. This is for serious collectors who want complete collections of everything -- At this level you get a MASTER SET. What's in a MASTER SET? Well I'll tell you! It's everything ... You'll get the retail box. Inside, instead of finding random packs, you'll find a complete Sharknado base set (90 cards), Sharknado 2 base set (90 cards), 'Bloody Subset' (18 cards currently planned but I might expand this), and all 18 Sharknado 3D cards (plus a free pair of 3D glasses to view them in all their dimensional glory). You'll also get a complete set of all four Faux Film Cell cards, a complete set of the Macarie Claudiu portrait puzzle back cards, ONE genuine unique printing plate, ONE original art sketch card, a complete set of all 9 Metal Box Topper cards, a rare progressive proof Sharknado card, ALL Sharknado promo cards PLUS all FOUR genuine costume prop relic card. Everything including the 36 mini clipout cards right on the box. All sets and subsets completely collated and ready to load into your binders or boxes. I'll also include a stack of UNUSED Sharknado trading card wrappers plus other goodies. You'll have all the cards, promos, hit and chase cards. You won't have to constantly check on ebay to try and find a missing card. You'll have it ALL. Please note, since some of the special cards have a very low production number I may have to cut short this pledge level ... so if you want a master set, best to pledge early before it gets ended.  
Level 6: $200 This includes the $75 pledge level 4 bundle (a full box of 36 packs) AND the $150 pledge level collection. So you'll have a master set PLUS a box full of packs you can have the fun of opening and building more sets... or squirrel away for some later date.  
Level 6: $300 Four Box Level. At this level you get FOUR sealed 36-pack boxes (for the contents description of a box just look at Level Four above). A fun level for those who want to build sets and have duplicate sets to sell on ebay or give to a friend or simply keep because you're greedy and fiending for cards... the right level for those who love the thrill of seeking rare chase and hit cards... a perfect level for those wanting to have the odds in their favor of finding more than one sketch card, printing plate, prop card, or other limited edition material. This level also includes the promo cards. As a BONUS, those who get the Four Box Level will get some guaranteed bonus stuff like uncut panels, additional printing plates, error and freak cards, progressive proofs and more. Hurry on over to the local store and grab a barrel full of bubble gum as this level will keep you busy for HOURS!  
Level 7: $500 DOUBLE the 'Four Box Case Level'. You get every everything in Level 6...DOUBLED. So that's EIGHT boxes and DOUBLE all those bonus goodies.  
Questions and Answers:  
Q: I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do I go about it?  
A: Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no worries.  
Q: When will the Sharknado Trading Card Series ship?   
A: The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of September. With any trading card production there are a lot of variables such as the licensing approval process (but I've noticed so far that The Asylum is faster than ANY other licensing approval group I've ever dealt with -- they are helpful, enthusiastic and encouraging ... and FAST!), printing production (a card series with this many different types of cards is quite complex and requires working out logistics) and of course paperwork and funding and a host of other variables ... but I think 'end of September' is a good, rough guesstimate at this stage of things. If you've backed any of my other Kickstarters you already know that my estimates for shipping, even when I make the estimates MONTHS in advance, usually turn out accurate within a few days or a couple weeks. I've had some that actually BEAT my estimate, others are real close. POINT is that WHILE this Kickstarter is running and WHILE you're pledging I'm not just sitting around on my hands -- production is already underway.  This will be my 16th Kickstarter project, so I've gotten pretty good at estimating completion and shipping dates. So it's just a few short months from now ... considering we've all waited about 5 years for someone to publish a Sharknado trading card series, a few more months will seem like a walk in the shark ... er... PARK.  
Q: I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two boxes? Or two 'Master Sets'? Or other combinations of pledge 'swag'? 
A: If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ... then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge amount. If you want a customized pledge level just message me -- we'll work it all out. Be SURE to message me if you do this explaining what you did. I'll check and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine.  
Q: Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or through a catalog?  
A: This is my 16th Kickstarter over the last 4 1/2 years. I've found that pre-selling a card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of cards and boxes. It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a limited basis. Once the Kickstarter is done I will have a good idea of what the total 'sealed box' needs will be for a production run to provide Kickstarter backers AND other customers (when the series is offered through distributors and retail outlets). A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious collectors FIRST before ANYone else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise some flexibility on providing 'stuff' for backers ... once the Kickstarter is over the only planned retail/wholesale activity for series one is simply retail boxes of 36 packs. No master sets, no case deals with bonus 'swag', no individual packs or promo card sets or anything else. Once this Kickstarter is ended the ONLY available material will be sealed 36-pack boxes... months from now. In other words, for those who collect Master Sets this is your first, best and ONLY chance to get in on a Master Set of these cards (unless later on someone lists their master set on ebay... but don't count on it being LESS than what you can get it for here and now).
NOTE: As of this posting, the cards are currently being reviewed by licensing for approvals/revisions. This means that some images and/or text MAY end up slightly different than as shown above.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges. Apart from a sharknado coming through my living room ceiling there are no logical risks. I'm working with wonderful people at The Asylum, I'm working with the same print broker at ICONIX who saw through my other 26 trading card series, the guy producing the retail box has done 5 other card series boxes for me and helped invent the type of box I use (which is unique to the hobby), the anaglyph designer (Christian LeBlanc) is the best and very professional and dependable, my sketch card artists are all reporting progress and everything's moving forward right on schedule. I'm an experienced card publisher with dozens of card series produced and this is my 16th Kickstarter campaign. EVERY Kickstarter campaign has been successful and all awards were mailed out for them (well, everyone who pledged and provided a mailing address of course). So I've become an old hand at this. Plus I am REAL good at communicating. I post updates before, during and after Kickstarter campaigns to let everyone know how everything is going every step of the way. YOU are a valuable part of my productions and I return the support you show me with your pledge by making sure you not only receive everything you should get but I keep you in the behind-the-scenes loop about what's happening. And if you have questions, just message me (try to use Kickstarter 'message' instead of Kickstarter 'comment'... I see messages, I don't always see comments). My response time to messages is roughly 24 hours at most (if I'm at the computer when you message then I can actually respond within seconds).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: $160 Okay, this is the BIG level. This is for serious collectors who want complete collections of everything -- At this level you get a MASTER SET. What's in a MASTER SET? Well I'll tell you! It's everything ... You'll get the retail box. Inside, instead of finding random packs, you'll find a complete Sharknado base set (90 cards), Sharknado 2 base set (90 cards), 'Bloody Subset' (18 cards currently planned but I might expand this), and all 18 Sharknado 3D cards (plus a free pair of 3D glasses to view them in all their dimensional glory). You'll also get a complete set of all four Faux Film Cell cards, a complete set of the Macarie Claudiu portrait puzzle back cards, ONE genuine unique printing plate, ONE original art sketch card, a complete set of all 9 Metal Box Topper cards, a rare progressive proof Sharknado card, ALL Sharknado promo cards PLUS all FOUR genuine costume prop relic card. Everything including the 36 mini clipout cards right on the box. All sets and subsets completely collated and ready to load into your binders or boxes. I'll also include a stack of UNUSED Sharknado trading card wrappers plus other goodies. You'll have all the cards, promos, hit and chase cards. You won't have to constantly check on ebay to try and find a missing card. You'll have it ALL. Please note, since some of the special cards have a very low production number I may have to cut short this pledge level ... so if you want a master set, best to pledge early before it gets ended. Postpaid in the US

support.title: The Whale Shark $300 Pledge Level

As a BONUS, those who get the Four Box Level will get some guaranteed bonus stuff like uncut panels, additional printing plates, error and freak cards, progressive proofs and more. Hurry on over to the local store and grab a barrel full of bubble gum as this level will keep you busy for HOURS!

support.title: The Megalodon $500 Pledge Level

updates.update_userinfo: Extremely LIMITED offer for Sharknado Kickstarter Backers
updates.update_content: Just a quickie update for Sharknado Trading Cards. To answer the question I get every once in awhile ... YES! There WILL be a Sharknado Trading Cards Series Two. In fact, the portrait artist from series 1 (Macarie Claudiu) has already created quite a few portrait cards for the limited edition portrait art subset. There will be at least 4 new RELIC cards (including a genuine 'rubber shark' chunk relic so everyone can own literally a piece of actual Sharknado from Sharknado 3). I'll be formatting a generous and lengthy interview with writer Thunder Levin (writer of Sharknado 1, 2, 3 and 4) to serve as back text. DOZENS of artists are creating more Sharknado sketch cards and they are slowly coming in... and looking WONDERFUL! I'm finishing up a small card series celebrating the 22nd anniversary of a book I wrote and illustrated in the 1990s called and then I need to get into pre-production and initial production. THEN I can get right to work on

project_data.project_name: SHARKNADO Official Collectible Trading Cards - RRParksCARDS

campaign.story:
The Three Stooges®️ Comic Book Trading Card Series, a JOINT PRODUCTION between RRParksCARDS and American Mythology, the publishers of The Three Stooges®️ comic book series -- While Three Stooges®️ Theater was the 7th and final RRParksCARDS exclusive Three Stooges®️ Trading Card Series, I've been able to work out the details and logistics with James K. at American Mythology to publish this, RRParksCARDS' 8th Three Stooges®️ series as a joint production as WELL as a concurrent Kickstarter project. Right this minute, American Mythology is conducting a Kickstarter for their current Three Stooges®️ comic book project. 
The Three Stooges®️ Comic Book Trading Card Series is a much smaller card series than previous Three Stooges®️ series. This series is not being issued as a 'wax pack' style product but rather a 'factory set' -- meaning the entire series is in a slip-sleeve style package. This series includes:
Base Set Sneak Peak
- A 45-card base set featuring ALL of the wonderful American Mythology comic book covers and cover variations of their numerous comic book series/titles:  The Three Stooges®️ .
'Retro Stalgic' 1950s Continuation Card Sneak Peak
- A 9-card 'Retro Staglic' continuation subset... continuing not just the 1959 Three Stooges®️ trading cards but the RRParksCARDS 'continuation' series.
Examples of the 9 Metal Cards (final actual designs will differ only slightly)
- 1 of 9 different METAL CARDS (or, if you pledge on the MASTER SET pledge level you get all 9) produced by those fine folks at Faerie Metal.
Example Printing Plates
- 1 Genuine RRParksCARDS 'The Three Stooges'®️ trading card printing plate with COA.
- 1 Ultra Rare Production/Progressive Proof card
Special Reproduction Cards
- Plus recreations of the classic 'ABC Film Stars' card (made possible with the generous assistance of R. Gallo) and the majestic  'Movie Machine' card (since most of us don't have $100s or even $1000 just sitting around to spend on mint originals, I've recreated both of the iconic Three Stooges®️ cards). 
The base cards are being printed on high gloss quality 16pt UV stock with offset printing (by the same production company that did Chronicles of the Three Stooges®️ series 1, 2, 3 and 4) with the cards featuring all aspects of the American Mythology comic book series: covers, progressive covers and artworks, panels and progressives, trivia cards, model sketches and more. The 'Retro Stalgic' continuation cards feature the wonderful artwork and overview words of Norman Maurer and Joe Kubert from the original 1950s Three Stooges®️ Comic Books -- printed in the exact same style as the RRParksCARD continuation cards (these being numbered 239 through 247). The printing plate and metal card and rare progressive proof card AND other goodies, along with the base and continuation cards, will all be housed in a slip-sleeve style package (yes... WITH header card!).  
Master Set pledge level backers will be treated to a COMPLETE set of everything including all 9 different metal cards -- All 3 'election' American Mythology Three Stooges®️ covers (white metal), all 3 'Three Stooges®️ Christmas' metal puzzle cards (gold metal) and 'Movie Machine' iconic card (front and back) plus the 'Movie Machine' ad metal card (silver metal). Each with COA on the back. 
    PLEDGE LEVELS I'm setting up this campaign with levels to satisfy (hopefully satisfy) all collector levels and budgets and I want long-time backers to see this as not just a fun series but also as a way to have a trading card 'sneak peak' at the historic American Mythology Three Stooges®️ Comic Book series.
$4 PLEDGE. This gets you two basic Three Stooges®️ Promo Cards.
 $28 PLEDGE. This gets you the 'factory set' which includes all 45 base cards, all 9 'Retro Stalgic' continuation cards, 1 of 9 different Metal Cards, 1 printing plate, 1 progressive production proof, and the two special reproduction cards... PLUS two basic Three Stooges®️ Promo Cards.
$60 PLEDGE. This is the 'Master Set' level pledge.  You get the factory set box, all 45 base cards, all 9 'Retro Stalgic' continuation cards, ALL 9 different Metal Cards (3 white, 3 silver, and 3 gold -- the complete set of all 9 metal cards), 1 printing plate, 1 progressive production proof, the two special reproduction cards and ALL Three Stooges®️ promo cards associated with the RRParksCARDS and American Mythology production. Odds are EXCELLENT (mainly because I'm already planning it) that Master Pledge backers will get some bonus goodies). 
.....
I'm also including some additional pledge levels for those who may have missed out on the PREVIOUS RRParksCARDS Three Stooges®️ Trading Card Series. 
$380 'Ultimate' Package Deal Bundle. This includes Chronicles of the Three Stooges®️ Series 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 ... The 1959 Three Stooges®️ Reprint retail box (6th series)... The Three Stooges®️ Theater retail box (7th series) ... PLUS this current 8th series: The Three Stooges®️ Comic Book Trading Card Series Factory Set. Individual prices for these 8 items is much more than the $380 bundle deal price. Ultimate package deal pledges will also get bonus printing plates and other goodies. A great way to 'catch up' and add a MASSIVE MOUNTAIN of The Three Stooges®️ Trading Cards to your collection. I will NOT be able to put together too many of these 'Ultimate' Package Deal Bundles since Three Stooges®️ Theater (7th series) is nearly sold out.  ...
CUSTOMIZED PLEDGE LEVELS. If you don't see a pledge level that suits your needs just let me know. I've done customized pledge levels before -- it's no bother. Be advised, requesting a customized pledge level is NOT for 'haggling' over pledge level prices -- the prices listed above are what they are (and if you've ever published trading cards you can already see they are very low). A customized pledge level can be created for those seeking a bulk deal... or if someone has Chronicles series 1 and 3 and the 1959 and wants a level that includes 2 and 4 and the 'Theater' set. Or for collectors seeking certain printing plate package deals, uncut sheets and so on. I'll do what I can (within reason) to accommodate special requests. You get the idea... this is to fine tune a package that covers everything you want, need or gotta have or you'll die. I'll post updates during and after the Kickstarter campaign letting everyone know progress and production 'milestones' and finally 'shipping date' once production is done and 'backer swag' is packaged up and ready for mailing. ...
Printing production of this series is actually ALREADY HAPPENING! All cards except the metal cards are at the printing company right now! So when this Kickstarter is over I'll simply do the order with Faerie Metal for the metal cards ... and submit the production files for the packaging. Otherwise, well before this Kickstarter is over the base cards, Retros, special reproduction cards, printing plates, progressive proofs, etc. will already be here. So it will simply be a matter of processing everyone's packages. So why am i saying a release date of March? Because I'll be frantically processing orders for 100s of boxes of Mystery Science Theater 3000 during January and February. Will have my hands full.
UPDATED January 30: ORIGINAL ART. Want to own a piece of actual Three Stooges Trading Card History? How about a piece of original art used in the production of Chronicles of the Three Stooges! The portrait cards for the Three Stooges card series were all done by Macarie -- the series' official portrait artist (he's also already completed the portraits for Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series Two ... and I'm helping him break into the world of doing sketch cards. Short version? A name to WATCH! And you can get original trading card art right here right now. How to buy is simple ... let me know which one(s) you want to confirm their availability. This is on a first-come, first-serve basis so once I confirm it is still available you can 'add' to your pledge for the piece(s) and I'll mark them SOLD on the image below. I'll then include them in your Stooge package. Although most are already sold, there are some left. Take a look.
Questions? Please just message me.
The Three Stooges®️ is a registered trademark of C3 Entertainment, Inc. The Three Stooges®️ characters, names, likenesses and all related indicia are trademarks and property of C3 Entertainment, Inc. © 2016 C3 Entertainment, Inc. All Rights Reserved. www.threestooges.com ... Published by RRParksCARDS (www.RRParksCARDS.com)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges ... well, this will be my 15th Trading Card Series Kickstarter. And apart from only ONCE in awhile an actual shipping date being a couple weeks later than planned months earlier, everyone always gets everything they pledge on and in a timely fashion and usually (depending on pledge level) with bonus goodies. Over the last 4-5 years I've published some 25 or 26 different trading card series... so I know my way around publishing cards. And unlike some Kickstarters I've hosted I've actually got this series IN production even before launching the Kickstarter... and the bulk of the cards will be here most likely around the middle of January. There are no challenges above and beyond any past Kickstarter challenges (and if you're a returning backing you already know what to expect). Should be a fun and uneventful/unchallenging production ... one that I'm delighted to be doing as it shows different licensees can team up and create a joint production collectible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Three Stooges Series Nine: Stooges in Motion UPDATE!
updates.update_content: I've gotten requests over the years for little oddball stuff... promo cards, uncut boxes... inquiries as to how someone can get more printing plates... And so what I'm doing right this second and for the next 7 days only (ending 6:45pm on June 19th Pacific Time) is providing an RRPARKS CARDS ERRORS FREAKS and ODDITIES BUNDLE. Various pledge levels from $50 on up to $600 that includes progressive proofs, dramatic printing errors, uncut Scratch 'n Sniff panels, Uncut Promo Card Panels, uncut Film Cell diecuts, unused series 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 boxes, printing plates, unfolded sell sheets, unused wrappers, the super rare 190-card special production base set collection, collector's kit binder cover and spine inserts along with grayback variations and tobacco card intact panels, the very last two 96-card 1959 Reissue Commemorative limited edition ALL METAL card set (which had been held for someone who never paid... so am giving collectors who missed out the first time a second and LAST chance to have this set), limited edition signed/numbered 9-card panels, the 1959 Reissue series in UNCUT SHEETS and MORE!

updates.update_userinfo: Special THREE STOOGES venue ... 10 days ONLY!
updates.update_content: Wow... that was over a week of intense work building up these dozen 'ultimate' packages ... There are just so MANY moving parts (over 2,000 moving parts PER box!). But they are now all assembled, boxed up/packed, labeled and sealed and waiting by the door for tomorrow morning when I bring them to the post office. This load has been the delaying factor in responding to emails, doing messages/letters, all other orders, paying bills, returning phone calls, etc. This means tomorrow I can go through a MOUNTAIN of emails, letters, and everything else that's been piling up and clear all of THEM out so that come Saturday I can clear the boards and get to work on MST3K Series Two creation. What a relief... all that work is done and so now I can get to work. Hmmm... I guess taking a day off or going on vacation just isn't in the cards.
