campaign.story:
It's the 5th set in the series!
If you're familiar with my previous FACE CARDS Kickstarter campaigns; KILLER BABES, KILLER DUDES, CREATURES, and ANTI-HEROES then you should know the quality and passion that I put into each trading card set. For those who are coming into this new, let me tell what you'll expect...
My main objective with each Kickstarter campaign is to raise funds for the printing costs and cover shipping and Kickstarter fees. The majority of the cards have been created and are ready for the press. I just need a little financial help to get the ball rolling.
By supporting you'll get the basic VAMPIRES set PLUS EXCLUSIVE material (rewards) only offered here as a Kickstarter backer!
As before, I've opted for a 21 day fundraising period. Please share this with a friend who might also be interested in this novelty item.
** Currently, every backer will get the basic 25 card set, plus the KS title card, PLUS a 4 sticker set, PLUS the 5 Alt Cards, PLUS 2 Vampire Hunter cards!!!**
** Be sure to check out the updates! There's info about the Stretch-Goals, Alt-Card reveals, and other pertinent details. **
Click to view ALL of the VAMPIRE cards
  ABOUT THE CARDS
Each basic 25 card set has 1 title card and 24 b&w Vampire portrait cards.
Every backer will also receive 1 limited 'Kickstarter Funded' title card.
Every card has a detailed portrait on the front and info about the character(s) on the back. The info include; the character's name, the actor, the movie they were in, the director, the synopsis of the film, trivia, and the film poster.
The sets does not contain any nudity and is considered "safe for work."
Each set's title card will be signed and numbered. Only 500 sets will be produced.
Each set will be in its own crystal clear 2 piece slider box.
I chose these characters to balance out future VAMPIRE editions. There are so many vampires, I could do at least 3 editions. Something to look forward to.
PLEDGE LEVELS
Every pledge level will have 1 VAMPIRES card set and 1 Kickstarter title card. Pledge levels other than the 'Single Set' will have extra items (see image below). For example, the 'Take 3 Sets' will consist of; 1 VAMPIRES card set, 1 KS title card, and 2 sets of your choosing. The 'choosing' will happen after the Kickstarter ends, funds are collected, and the survey is emailed out. In the survey, I will ask for your mailing address, your choices, and other FACE CARDS related questions.
ADD-ONS
The items below can be added on to your initial pledge. Increase your pledge by adding the item amount to your pledge level. If you have already pledged, there should be a button in the side bar that says "manage my pledge." For example, if you're in the U.S. and you pledge at the ALL 5 SETS ($45 + $8 shipping) level and you want to add-on another set ($11) for a friend, you pledge a total amount of $64.
The amounts below include shipping for that add-on item.
Add-On an extra VAMPIRES set or add-on sets that you missed. Be sure to mention A) Vampires, B) Anti-Heroes, C) Creatures, D) Killer Dudes, or E) Killer Babes when the 'Survey' is emailed to you at the end of the Kickstarter.
As a special Kickstarter ONLY reward, the VAMPIRES set will be available as Metal Cards! Get them as a Pledge Level or as an Add-On. No where else will you be able to get this limited feature.
There's only a few original drawings left from all 5 sets. Claim what remains before they're all taken. PLEASE MESSAGE ME DIRECTLY IF YOUR ADD-ON IS FOR ORIGINAL CARD ART. We don't want any other fang-bangers claiming that item.
STRETCH GOALS
Here are a couple Kickstarter EXCLUSIVES that I have planned to give to you at no additional cost. The more the campaign generates, the more free Stretch Goal items I can offer to every backer. NEW to the FACE CARDS Kickstarter campaigns are ALT CARDS! A variant front image to a card in the set. Also added is a 5 card VAMPIRE HUNTER sub-set. Check out the updates for details. Let's see if we reach all of these stretch goals!
MANY THANKS!
Please tell a friend and share on social media!
More editions of FACE CARDS are planned and here are couple sets I have in mind; Killer Dudes II, Damned Kids, and Zombies. But, as I've done in the past, I've left that decision up to the backers. Expect a new set every 5-6 months! Stay tuned!
Check out the Facebook page The Art of Byron Winton to see more of my 4x6 drawings, many of which these cards are based on. Follow me on Instagram and Twitter. Lastly, join me on Patreon if you're looking to support in the creative process and maybe to sign-up for the popular Card-of-the-Month program I have running.
Thank you for your interest and support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At the time of the launch, I have a few images left to complete for the set. I plan to have them done before the campaign ends. In doing so, the Available Original Art will reflect their completion.

I given myself enough printer time for an end of March delivery for all the backers. However, in the event that I am unable to ship in or by March, I will inform with a shipping update.

For those of you getting the 4"x6" drawing rewards with your sets, please be patient during the creation of those. I will produce them as quickly as I can without disrupting my current work-load. Depending on the quantity will determine the complete turn around time. I will mail in weekly batches.

I will be adjusting quantities available if necessary. There are ONLY 500 sets being produced... and even less are available for the previous sets.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Here are the last 4x6 drawings for backers that pledged the Custom Original Art tier. David from The Lost Boys, Mr. Barlow from Salem's Lot, and Old Man Dracula from Bram Stoker's Dracula.

As the sun is about to rise and as this campaign's coffin comes to a close, I thought I would share some of the Custom Original 4x6 Art for a couple backers. Here are 3 of them. Near Dark's Severen, Kitty Pryde from the X-Men, and Grandpa from the Munsters. I'll have another update in a couple weeks with the remaining drawings.

Most of you are starting to get your sets of Vampire cards in the mail or already have received them. Some of you have messaged or tagged me in posts expressing your excitement over them. A couple of you even made some unboxing videos.
Here's Johnny the Hyper Geek once again with his hyper unboxing...

Yes, you've heard that correctly. The shipping has begun! Those back-ordered clear 50 count card boxes arrived on Friday and I spent the weekend packing everything up. The good news is that today, many packages are venturing into the wide world yonder. I'll message each of you individually with the tracking (US only) and other need to know info. The bad news, I'm still waiting on the metal sets and I'm still working on all of those custom drawings. Those 14 packages will go out as soon as that stuff is available. Hang in there.
For anyone who does unboxing videos, make sure you comment with a link here or message me directly. Also, I'd love to see and hear everyone's responses after opening. Please tag me in your FB/IG/Twitter posts! (@byronwinton3)
Thank you to those who joined me during the Live Q&A Collating Party last week! If you missed out, you can still watch all of that glory. Check out the video!

campaign.story:
THE STORY SO FAR
Doom Town is an supernatural horror serial and character-based drama with a heavy metal soundtrack. Worshipers of the Hindu snake goddess Manasa are growing in strength and numbers, rebuilding their Order. Episode One introduced us to hard-drinking line cook Luke Bishop and his friends Jill, Darcy, and Steve. They're going to have to fight hard against this cult, and their troubles are just beginning!
OUR CAMPAIGN
Our crowdfunding campaign for Episode One was a wonderful success, and we're building on that momentum to create the next chapter in the story. The pilot episode, clocking in at a little under six minutes, is available to watch right here, right now, for free.
https://vimeo.com/217678470
password: doomtown
Please check it out, and if you want to see what happens next, pledge to support the production of Episode Two! Our new episode will continue Jill and Luke's romance, introduce new characters, and be between 5 - 10 minutes long.
Doom Town is a completely independent microbudget project. Our cast and crew are all being paid for their time, energy, and commitment. Pledging to Doom Town is a way to directly support your creative community, your friends and neighbors. 
To thank you for supporting us, we have t-shirts, stickers, and buttons designed by Justin Kaye of www.kingwolfdesign.com. Our first run of these items were a huge hit, and for this new campaign we'll be trying out new colors!
Here a few pictures of our first run of merch:
T-shirt Design
  Stickers
  Buttons
FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA
We haven't done much with these yet, but they exist, and we would be honored if you'd give us a like or a follow. The Facebook page is where we post our updates, photos, casting announcements, etc. If you have any helpful hints on how we can reach a wider audience, or would like to be our Social Media Consultant, please reach out!
https://www.facebook.com/doomtownseries
https://twitter.com/doomtownseries
https://www.instagram.com/doomtownseries
MEET THE CAST
Alex McCracken as Luke  
Alex McCracken is an actor living in Portland. Originally from Cincinnati, Ohio, Alex grew up doing musical theatre from a very young age. Alex moved to Portland in 2011 to attend Reed College, and has been involved in several local film and stage projects since graduating last Spring, including several web series and most recently a musical adaptation of He-Man. In addition to Doom Town, Alex is also filming a feature film musical, and rehearsing for Faultline Ensemble's "Holding onto the Sky," a show about life and loss in post-earthquake Portland.
Alex McCracken
 Chelsea Weder as Jill  
Chelsea Weder moved to Portland, Oregon in 2008 from Los Angeles, California. She studied acting, filmmaking and German at Portland State University, graduating as a triple major. While her background is mainly in screen acting, she has participated in multiple stage productions. Her most memorable stage acting experience was "The Other Side of The Gestapo" in the International Theater Festival in Hamburg, Germany. She stunt doubled and coordinated for PSU's very first feature film, and is also a camera/drone operator.
Chelsea Weder
 MEET THE CREW
Anna Bremner Smith: Director / Producer
Anna is a local producer who also specializes in Props and Set Decoration. After an unsuccessful attempt at starting an ADD support group, she landed happily in the Portland film community. She enjoys good friends, good food, and cat memes that contain off-color language. Doom Town is one of her favorite projects, and she is thrilled to be back for Episode Two!
Anna Bremner Smith
 Guthrie Taylor: Writer / Producer  
My love of horror began at a young age when I cut my teeth on Stephen King novels and snuck out of bed to watch Elvira, Mistress of the Dark on late night TV. I've also been a huge fan of heavy metal since I heard Black Sabbath in the 6th grade. Doom Town is a chance for me to explore the subjects that interest me while playing around with the conventions of serial narrative.
Guthrie Taylor
 Daniel Smith: Location Sound
Daniel Smith
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every creative project has its challenges, and Doom Town is no different. However, we feel we're in a really great place. The experience of producing the pilot was wonderful, and we're proud of what we were able to accomplish on a microbudget and with limited resources.

Our simple merchandise (stickers, buttons, and t-shirts) is all being produced in Portland. This will be our second run of t-shirts, the first run of 40 sold out by word of mouth! It's always possible that something could go wrong in production, but we doubt it. We are confident that all rewards will be fulfilled.

We have a fantastic cast and crew in place, and we're ready to do it again and continue the story of Doom Town!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi All,
One last email blast here. If we can raise $1,809 in the next four days, the campaign will succeed. Otherwise I'll be shelving it for the time being and moving on to something else.
Here's the link to pledge, if you want to share it: https://goo.gl/uEy5CF
Thank you all for your support. I appreciate it greatly.
Guthrie

With less than two weeks to go, this campaign is only 27% funded, which is not good. If things don't improve soon, it doesn't look like we're going to make it. With no money to pay the cast and crew, Doom Town will have to shelved until I can figure out another way to make it happen.
Anything you all can do to spread the word and let people know that this project even exists would be greatly appreciated. Wear your Doom Town shirts and buttons, if you have them. Share the link to the campaign on social media. I guess that's it.

campaign.story:
It's been nearly 30 years since Joel and the 'bots first graced our TVs in the classic comedy series MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000 on KTMA -- and now, FINALLY, there's a collectible of our favorite show. What better way to celebrate Joel, Crow and Tom Servo's return than an epic trading card series covering all 197 episodes -- the perfect collectible for true MST3K fans everywhere. And here it IS! The FIRST SERIES of MST3K officially licensed trading cards! And this Kickstarter offers exclusive package deals ONLY available between 'now' and December 27th when this Kickstarter ends. So, 30 years of waiting for a MST3K trading card series... over a year in production... and it's all finally happening NOW and for the next month! Woo hoo!
MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000 Series One Trading cards features:
A 104-card "Invention Exchange" base set -- every invention of the first 3 seasons of the show. With each card featuring the invention on the front and on the back of the card is the dialogue of the Invention Exchange.
Invention Exchange cards (examples)
A 50-card "Experiment" base set -- every experiment of the first 3 seasons. The card fronts feature a classic scene from the show and the backs of the cards cover the movie title, release date, air date, host, director, stars, synopsis, classic riff and trivia.
Experiment Cards (examples)
A 29-card special subset featuring MST3K iconic mini movie posters from the Shout! Factory DVD releases ... and terrific DVD menu art on the card backs.
MST3K mini poster and DVD menu art cards (examples)
 A 36-card 'Riff It' subset featuring a scene from a movie featured on the show along with a hilarious riff ... and on the back? Another scene with space for you to write your OWN riff.
Riff It Cards (examples)
 And why is there a FREE pair of 3D glasses in the top of the card box? How about 18 different Anaglyph 3D cards! Put on your 3D glasses and each of these specially designed cards POPS into THREE DIMENSIONS! Designed by the incredibly talented anaglyphist Christian LeBlanc and features scenes from riffed movies, host segments and DVD poster art.
Anaglyph 3D Cards (examples)
A full, sealed box of Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series One Trading Cards is guaranteed to contain at least ONE complete set and subset of everything just mentioned above. 
"But WAIT! There's MORE!" In each box you'll find randomly inserted limited edition and rare chase cards to collect:
A 9-card limited edition Byron Winton MST3K art card series featuring Joel, Mike, Gypsy, Tom, Crow, Dr. Forrester, TV's Frank, Pearl and Bobo.
Byron Winton Limited Edition Art Cards (examples)
2 different authentic show-used Costume Prop cards with actual costume material as seen on MST3K -- one card includes Joel's Jumpsuit and another Dr. Forrester's lab coat. Guaranteed genuine! Own an actual piece of MST3K history!
Genuine Costume Prop Cards (actually used in the production of MST3K)
Look for a GENUINE MST3K Series One printing plate inside a pack -- the actual printing plate used to produce this landmark trading card series. 
Genuine Printing Plates, each one UNIQUE (examples)
In some boxes you'll find a pack that contains a UNIQUE original art 'sketch card'. These sketch cards are 1 of 1 and RARE -- I commissioned some of the very best sketch card artists in the hobby including Bryan Abston, Jerry Bennet, Kyle Burles, Caleb King, Garrett Dix, Rees Finlay, Tiffany Groves, Ingrid Hardy, Daniel Hayman, Michael James, JonOnArt, Achilleas Kokkinakis, Eric Lehtonen, Rich Molinelli, Andy Moore, Marshs Parkins, Kris Penix, Darrin Pepe, Tim Proctor, Scott Rorie, Kevin P. West, and MORE! If you're a serious card collector then chances are you recognize MOST of these artists as being sketch artist SUPERSTARS in the hobby. When these artists found out I was publishing MST3K Trading Cards they wanted in! 
Original Art Sketch Cards (examples)
Randomly inserted into packs you may find rare 'Faux Film Cell' cards -- 8 different styles to collect but EACH and EVERY ONE of them is UNIQUE. No two alike!
'Faux Cell Film Relic' cards (examples)
Inside the top of each box, alongside the free pair of 3D glasses, you'll find a 1 of 9 different Full Metal box topper card, produced by those geniuses at Faerie Metal (the best producer of limited edition metal cards in the biz!). 
9 Different Full Metal Box Topper cards to collect (examples)
Each and every full, sealed box of Mystery Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards carries 36 packs and each pack has 10 cards (a typical modern day card series usually features 5 or 6 cards per pack and only 18 or 24 packs to a box ... but I'm a serious fan of MST3K and card collecting so my card series always include more ... and my saying over here is "Too much is never enough"). With this many packs and that many cards in each pack your odds are good for pulling rare cards... and the chances of putting together complete sets of Experiments, Invention Exchanges, MST3K mini poster and DVD menu art cards subset and Anaglyph 3D cards is excellent (in fact, those complete sets and subsets are guaranteed in each box).  As a BONUS, the MST3K retail box of 36 packs features something NO other publisher provides: Printed right on the box are 33 different mini double-sided clip-out cards in FULL color front and back on 24pt super glossy stock. It's almost like getting a FREE 33 card special subset. Oh wait, it IS like that EXACTLY!
Each pack wrapper features a complete checklist printed on the inside showing you all the cards to look for to complete your set.
SO HOW DO I GET ALL THIS AMAZING STUFF AND SATIATE MY DIRE NEED FOR MST3K COLLECTIBLES???
It's easy. You'll notice there are many different pledge levels -- levels to fit all collector budgets. 
Level 1: $2
You get ONE promo card for the MST3K Series One Trading Card collection. 
Level 2: $5
You get FIVE different promo cards for the MST3K Series One Trading Card collection.
Level 3: $10
You get THREE sealed packs of cards. Each pack contains 10 different cards. Consider this a 'sampler' level. And you'll also get a promo card, too. 
Level 4: $75
You get a FULL SEALED BOX of 36 10-card packs. Guaranteed to contain complete sets of Experiment cards (50 cards), Invention Exchange cards (104 cards), MST3K mini poster and DVD menu art cards (29 cards), Anaglyph 3D cards (18 cards), and Riff It Retro-stalgic style cards (36) ... you'll also get randomly inserted rare and hit cards which could include a printing plate, original art sketch card, 'Faux Film Cell' card, limited edition Byron Winton art card, super rare 'Prop Card', unique printing plate and more. Each box comes with a free pair of 3D glasses PLUS 1 of 9 different Full Metal Box Topper cards. You ALSO get MST3K promo cards.
Level 5: $175
At this level you get a MASTER SET. What's in a MASTER SET? Well I'll tell you! It's everything ... it's a full sealed box and in the box you'll find complete sets of Experiment cards (50 cards), Invention Exchange cards (104 cards), MST3K mini poster and DVD menu art cards (29 cards), Anaglyph 3D cards (18 cards), and Riff It Retro-stalgic style cards (36) ... you'll also have a complete set of all Byron Winton limited edition cards, a complete set of all 9 Full Metal Box Toppers, BOTH genuine 'Prop Cards', all 8 'Faux Film Cell' cards, at least one printing plate, and ONE original art sketch card. Plus promo cards (and of course the 33 mini clipout cards printed on the box). And I might even have some more surprises for you. This is the level you want if you're a super fan and gotta have EVERYTHING. I'll even include an extra EMPTY box so you can keep one box intact and have that extra box to clipout all 33 mini cards to complete your master set (now, if you aren't allowed to play with scissors just let me know... and I'll cut that extra box FOR you so you'll have the 33 mini card set without having blisters or losing an eye messing around with scissors... just let me know after this Kickstarter is over. No worries!). A 'master set' will ONLY be available during this Kickstarter pre-sell ... and during the Kickstarter I MAY have to limit the number of these available (so you may want to jump on this one fast before the option is gone).
Level 6: $300
Four Box Case Level. At this level you get FOUR sealed 36-pack boxes (for the contents description of a box just look at Level Four above). A great level for those who want to build sets and have duplicate sets to sell on ebay or give to a friend or simply keep because you're greedy and fiending for cards... a great level for those who love the thrill of seeking rare chase and hit cards... a great level for those wanting to have the odds in their favor of finding more than one sketch card, printing plate, prop card, or other limited edition material. This level also includes the promo cards. As a BONUS, those who get the Four Box Case Level will get some guaranteed bonus stuff like uncut panels, additional printing plates, error and freak cards, and more. Hurry on over to the local store and grab a barrel full of bubble gum as this level will keep you busy for HOURS!
Level 7: $500
DOUBLE the 'Four Box Case Level'. You get every everything in Level 6...DOUBLED. So that's EIGHT boxes and all those goodies. And at this level I'll make it even MORE worth your while by loading up on the freebies and bonus stuff. 
     Questions and Answers:
Q: I want to get stuff, but I don't want to sign up to back on Kickstarter. How do I go about it? 
A: Some collectors and fans don't want to sign up on Kickstarter. If you are unable to back through this Kickstarter just message me. We'll work it out, no worries.
---------------
Q: When will the MST3K Trading Card Series ship?
A: The current schedule and plan is to ship the end of January. I'm good about posting updates and communications so will keep everyone in the loop. Virtually every trading card series I've published has been issued ON schedule. I realize MST3K Trading Cards has been 'coming soon' for ages... but 'soon' starts NOW! And I'm organizing everything so that product will ship towards the end of January. We've waited 30 years... just a couple more months now :-)
Q: I'm OCD and want a box to keep sealed and a box to open. How do I back on two boxes? Or two 'Master Sets'? 
A: If you want more than one pledge level just back the pledge level you want ... then once you've pledged you can review your pledge and ADD to your pledge amount. Be SURE to message me if you do this explaining what you did. I'll check and make sure it's done right and you'll be fine.
-----------------
Q: Why are you running this as a Kickstarter instead of selling at a comic shop or through a catalog?
A: This is my 14th Kickstarter over the last 4 years. I've found that pre-selling a card series on Kickstarter allows me to determine a proper production run of cards and boxes. It also allows me to offer 'master sets' to collectors on a limited basis. Once the Kickstarter is done I will have a good idea of what the total 'sealed box' needs will be for a production run to provide Kickstarter backers AND other customers (when the series is offered through distributors and retail outlets). A Kickstarter also lets me get card series to serious collectors FIRST before ANYone else. Plus a Kickstarter allows me to exercise some flexibility on providing 'stuff' for backers ... once the Kickstarter is over the only planned retail/wholesale activity for series one is simply retail boxes of 36 packs. No master sets, no case deals with bonus 'swag', no individual packs or promo card sets or anything else. Once this Kickstarter is ended the ONLY available material will be sealed 36-pack boxes... months from now.
12/1/2017 FAQ.
Q: Is there are will there be a binder for these cards?
A: I've been asked this question A LOT! So figured I'd update this FAQ. When I was publishing Chronicles of the Three Stooges I created a binder 'insert kit'. I'm not a fan of commercially produced binders by 'the big boys' because they are invariably the wrong size, they invariably cost a fortune to produce and then are sold for a fortune. So for Three Stooges I created a binder insert kit -- VERY nice official cover and spine inserts so that a collector could be GIVEN the binder insert kit for free and then just go to an office supply store and pick out whatever color binder they like (black, white, red, mauve, lime green or whatever) and whatever size binder the like (1/2", 1 1/2", 3" or whatever) and then simply tuck in the official cover and spine kit and presto -- official binder but entirely customized by size and color. And I didn't have to charge for the kit! So for MST3K a binder insert kit is already in the planning for around the time series two comes out. In the meantime, when you get your series one cards and load them into 9 pocket pages I suggest getting a nice binder of your favorite size and color and just make sure it has clear pocket cover and spine... and then sit back, have patience... and just relax :-)  I'll soon take care of your official binder art needs (or have fun and design your own binder cover insert!).
-------------------
If you have a question not answered here please just ask -- you can message me directly through Kickstarter and I will respond as quickly as possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks? Well I suppose an asteroid could come hurtling through space and land on my head. Otherwise, this is my 14th Kickstarter Campaign... and I've published dozens of other card series over the last 4 years (including seven different Three Stooges series, Gary Saves the Graveyard, two Basil Wolverton series, Japanese Horror in 3D, and others). I know my way around card publishing and financing production. For MST3K Series One I have the BEST sketch card artists on board, the BEST printing production broker on the planet (Karen 'Wonder Woman' Cowan at ICONIX who has overseen ALL the card series I've published since I started my business), and ALL cards are written and designed and ready for production and officially approved through Shout! Factory. I also consider myself an excellent communicator -- you can view my other Kickstarters and see the level at which I keep backers informed during a campaign, after a campaign, during card production/collation/assembly, and through actual shipping of cards to backers AND afterwards. You'll NEVER be left wondering "what's going on" because I post regular updates and keep in contact with EVERYONE. I've never had a publishing challenge I couldn't overcome with the help of my printing production broker ... and except once (when I was 2 weeks late shipping on one campaign) I've shipped everyone their goodies ON TIME. Very few other Kickstarter hosts can make that claim! While there are always risks and challenges with production, logistics or even crossing the street I have years of experience publishing trading cards and conducting Kickstarter campaigns. So the risks and challenges are minimized.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PRAISE “Bob"! – the fates have brought you into an encounter with J.R. “Bob” Dobbs through this instructional video barrage Kickstarter delivery device – the first step on your personal road to SLACK, an unsurpassable beatific experience.
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM FILMMAKER ALEX COX
PLAY

Alex Cox has directed such cult classics as Repo Man and Sid & Nancy.
DID YOU US IN TEXAS MONTHLY ?!
PREVIOUSLY FORBIDDEN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THIS FILM 
The Church of the SubGenius has been called “the most aggressively preposterous theology the world has ever known!” But what is the Church? And who is J.R. "Bob" Dobbs? And why is his name always in quotes? And for nonbelievers, why has this strangely compelling parody religion, this long-running postmodern joke, caught the attention of such pop culture icons as Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, Jon Stewart, David Letterman, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), David Byrne, Robert Crumb, Richard Linklater, Alex Cox, Ken Kesey, Frank Zappa, Jonathan Demme, and Devo’s Mark Mothersbaugh? And is it true that Tori Amos is also one of "Bob"’s chosen?  
"Bob" and the Church have caught the attention of many– include David Byrne, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), Tori Amos, Stephen Colbert, Robert Crumb, Mark Mothersbaugh and DEVO, Matt Groening, Margaret Moser, Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, and more.
ARE WE CONTROLLED BY SECRET FORCES? ARE ALIEN MONSTERS BRINGING A STARTLING NEW WORLD? DO PEOPLE THINK YOU’RE STRANGE? DO YOU? 
The Church of the SubGenius: The Early Years
“We tied together every occult, superstitious fringe belief you could think of…it was so much fun!”
– Ivan Stang, co-founder
Born into the suburban world of the 1950s, future founders of the Church of the SubGenius Reverend Ivan Stang (Douglass St. Clair Smith) and Dr. Philo Drummond (Steve Wilcox) come of age during the 1960s and 70s – a time of unprecedented social and political tumult. They experience the rise of a deafening consumer culture, the tarnishing of the "American Dream," the violence of the Vietnam War abroad, and the Kennedy assassinations and conspiracies that follow. 
As youths they revel in the delights of stable families, monster movies, Science Fiction, super-8 moviemaking, dinosaur figures, comic books, and Rock 'n' Roll. As they grow older they witness the emergence of televangelism, the Jonestown Massacre, punk culture, and Reaganomics.
Despite both growing up in Texas, it was not until the mid 70s that Stang and Drummond meet and quickly forge a friendship over a shared love of comic books, Captain Beefheart, and UFO paperbacks. One not so particular eve in 1977, while bemoaning their lack of conventional “success” for two such intelligent, well read chaps, Stang remarks, “Well, we’re not exactly geniuses.” To which Drummond replies, “yeah, we’re sub-geniuses.” 
And in that moment the Church of the SubGenius is born. It is not long after that J.R. "Bob" Dobbs reveals himself as the Church's iconic prophet and foremost patron of ineffable Slack. In fact, Stang and Drummond will later come to the realization that "Bob" has been planting evidence of his presence for them for the past twenty years!!!
THE SUBGENIUS DIASPORA
“There was that moment of realizing that this thing goes further than I ever imagined.”
– Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman)
In late 1979 Stang and Drummond, with the help of their wives, brainstorm what would become perhaps the single most significant marketing effort made at the inception of the Church of the SubGenius – the writing, design, printing, and distribution of Pamphlet #1. The doctrine of the Church quickly spreads, and the word of “Bob” and the teachings of JHVH-1 teach “time control” as a way to wrest “Slack” from the ‘Pinks’ and ‘Normals.’ The Church, it seems, has struck a nerve amidst the deadening consumer culture, the evisceration of basic social services, and the worship of wealth that occurred during the Reagan/Thatcher years.
L: An early years Devival | R: The Three Wise Guys – Ivan Stang, Dr.X and Philo Drummond – pose with a Model X Humanoid (1979)
As “Bob”’s pamphlet continues to travel the world, the emergent punk publishing scene and new wave comic writers seize on the humor and cultural critique of the Church's doctrine. In San Francisco it is fished out of a trashcan by cartoonist and artist Paul Mavrides, igniting a SubGenius cell that gives the movement some of its most enduring art and performances through LIES (Paul Mavrides), Dr. Howland Owl (Hal Robins), Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman), Janor Hypercleats and Pope Sternodox. 
"Bob" captures the zetigeist of the day. Cartoonist Robert Crumb reprints Pamphlet #1 in the first issue of his comic Weirdo. A few years later Simon and Schuster publishes The Book of the SubGenius.  Acclaimed film director and SubGenius Alex Cox channels Church mythology in Repo Man as the glowing, alien-owned Chevy Malibu soars high above Los Angeles with Otto (Emilio Estevez) and Miller (Tracy Walke) inside, their faces shining with Slack as Bud (Harry Dean Stanton) watches from below. 
Dr. Howl and Puzzling Evidence conduct legendary “Devivals,” radio shows (More than an Hour, Less than a Show), and introduce the word of "Bob" to Burning Man. The Stark Fist of Removal newsletter, The Hour of Slack podcast, an MTV special, and countless cassette tapes, posters, comics, videos, websites, and Facebook groups perpetuate the word of "Bob." 
By the turn of the century, publications as powerful as TIME Magazine begin to get the SubGenius joke when “Bob” is voted ‘Fraud of the Century” by readers of its online poll. In the late 90’s and early 2000’s, the “Free Party” constituents of Brighton in Great Britain voted “Bob” Dobbs as an M.P. to the House of Commons three times.
Today, “Bob”’s hucksterism and the wisdom of JHVH-1 is apparent in all fifty states and a multitude of countries across the globe!
PLAY

Another early SubGenius of Texas, David Boone (late husband of Slacking Towards Bethlehem director Sandy K. Boone), documents the rise of the SubGenius in his 1980 film, Invasion of the Aluminum People, which is lauded by Academy Award winning director Jonathan Demme. This is one of the first known recorded instances of the transmission of SLACK.
GIVE TO THIS KICKSTARTER NOW AND ACHIEVE SALVATION – OR TRIPLE YOUR MONEY BACK!!!!!!
Only with your support can our intrepid group of award-winning filmmakers dare to make this film. By giving us your hard earned cash, we can make this dream a reality, and breach all Earthly human, political, and cultural barriers with the searing nonhuman truth of the Word of "Bob," J.R. "Bob" Dobbs, that LIVING GOD WHO WALKS THIS PLANET EARTH IN HUCKSTER'S SHOES. 
To date, we’ve travelled over 8,000 miles and interviewed 15 SubGenius in four cities, sharing the so-called "reality" that SubGenii are forced to share with humans. We’ve only just begun to uncover many of the SubGenius’ most guarded secrets. The SubGenii are finally willing to go public and tell the TRUTH. 
This is YOUR chance to get in on the ground floor of a huge, globally important cult. You will then attract all the $$$, pleasure spacecraft, and SHEER POWER OVER OTHERS that go with high-ranking support of the Church and this documentary! 
But most important, you can smite your enemies, achieve TIME CONTROL and attain SLACK.
REMEMBERING SAINT MARGARET
Since we began production on our film, a beloved avatar of the early SubGenius tribe, Margaret Moser, passed away on August 25 of this year. One of the nation’s top music journalists and music scene nurturers, Reverend Reverend Doctor Doctor Archdoctor Saint Margaret Moser even had a photo of J.R. “Bob” Dobbs on her Austin Chronicle business card. She said it helped her connect with her interview subjects, many of whom were already members of the Church themselves.
PLAY

In her interview with us, she spoke about the pleasure, “the great release, to have all this nutty stuff in your head and find like minded people to express it with.” But most notably she sang a song written by her own hand, "Oh, Life's a Bowl of Cherries with "Bob" Dobbs." Saint Moser's life epitomized the way that membership in the Church accelerated the discovery of true friendships, experimentations, creative collisions, and rebellion through art, music, and comedy against dehumanization in any form.
WHY THIS FILM? 
Why not this film? Pull the wool over your own eyes and help us make a movie! The Church of the SubGenius is the underground movement that has galvanized the imaginative, the artistic, the nerdy, even the deranged – to examine the simmering dystopia in their culture, and do absolutely nothing about it... except, maybe, poke fun at it all. The Church of the SubGenius is taking over the universe. The sooner you learn about it, the better off you’ll be. 
PLAY

Now more than ever we feel that the story of the Church of the SubGenius needs to be told. There's a core of ideas within the SubGenius ethos – of fighting oppression with humor, community and creativity, of using absurdity as a nonviolent weapon, giving time, permission and priority to expression, creation, and zaniness with friends –  that we think has great value we believe these ideas are necessary in today's world and that our film about the SubGenius is the perfect way to invoke them.
Amongst all the spaceships, frop, pipes, eye-bludgeoning graphics, bulldada, yeti ancestors, (and yes, ‘macho spoutings’), we hope you will fund this film so you can join our merry band of pranksters on the culture-jam of the century! It’s going to be a lot of fun!!!
No stranger to hiding in plain sight – "Bob" is everywhere, IF you know to look for him!
So please, give to our film, get our cool merch, show up at screenings, and talk to us in every way possible. We will have our third nostril open at all times.
And remember, as one famous SubGenius said, “since the main message is ‘think for yourself,’ the last thing you should be doing is believing all we’re telling you. We make it up as we go along.”
Ivan Stang hosts the 999 Club (1981)
WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
With this funding, we can complete the remaining interviews, edit the film, animate key sequences, and all other post-production work necessary to bring this ridiculous story to the masses.
A behind the scenes look at our film production. Note that "Bob" is never too far from where we are. (L: Image courtesy of Paul Mavrides | R: Image courtesy of Kelly Cash)
HOW YOU CAN HELP
A Boy's Guide - fig. 13013
Let ‘Bob’ into your savings. 
Kickstarter is ALL-OR-NOTHING – If we don’t meet our $199,999.99 goal, we won’t receive ANY of the funding. Don't let The Conspiracy win!  We need to get this story out into the world before it all comes to an end.
Tomorrow is obsolete. 
SHUT UP PINK BOY AND PLEDGE EARLY! – Be the ultimate slacker and slack off on slacking. The earlier you pledge, the more likely others are to contribute.
Instant answers to everything!
Don’t wallow in submission. Reveal the Church of the SubGenius Documentary to your slackless friends through social media, and watch as their Pink minds become wonderful, abnormal soups of mush. Just how we like it.
Blasted by knowledge
SHUT UP OR STAND UP BY SHARING OUR FILM ON SOCIAL MEDIA!  – How can you direct your friends to our Kickstarter? Write your own post linking our Kickstarter at bit.ly/SlackOn, or, for the slack-est among you use one of our pre-written posts below –
Twitter: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? Don't wallow in submission any longer! bit.ly/SlackOn
Facebook: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? The Church of the SubGenius is the subject of a new documentary I am supporting – check it out! But beware, you might pull the wool over your own eyes in the process. bit.ly/SlackOn
THE REWARDS
To THANK YOU for backing our documentary we have a great selection of classic favorites -- and more. But this campaign also offers some extremely unique items. So dive in. Look around. Scroll your way to bliss!
Partnering with Paul Mavrides, we will have an original film poster by one of the great artists and cartoonists living today. NO KIDDING! This is going to be something you don’t want to miss. And we also already received --- shhhhhhh! – some amazing, crazy, stuff – memorabilia, illustrations, artwork -- from the archives of some celebrity and anonymous SubGenius alike. Stay tuned. This is the stuff that will never, ever make its way to Ebay.
*Final Reward designs may vary.

Items marked as “limited” are truly one of a kind items created specifically for this campaign as a unique offering to thank you for becoming part of the team. From a “Bob” toaster that will help you begin your day with edible Slack to real life film credits in our finished film, we hope you embrace “Bob”’s rule of thumb that “too much is always better than not enough.
Claim 'em quick! Limited quantities available.
PAUL MAVRIDES ORIGINAL ART
We know what you're thinking. FINE ARTS? SUBGENIUS? How much frop are you smoking? Paul Mavrides is one of the originators and sustainers of the SubGenius aesthetic, and he is also a major artist whose work shows at Fine Art galleries and whose graphic design is sought after by companies like Apple. Writing about Paul for a recent show at the Steven Wolfe Fine Arts Gallery in San Francisco, art critic Mark Van Proyers said that SubGenius output is a key influence "on much of the art production of the 1990s... and the mythomaniacal clip-art orgies that Mavrides concocted for several of the highly entertaining “SubGenious” books still seem to sustain a spot-on freshness…."
NEW REWARDS GENEROUSLY DONATED BY LOUIS BLACK, FROM HIS PERSONAL COLLECTION
Louis Black is the co-founder of the Austin Chronicle and co-founder of the South By Southwest Music Festival and Conference (SXSW).
ANNOUNCING NEW REWARDS FROM COMIC BOOK ARTIST CULLY HAMNER. AND WE'RE KINDA GEEKING OUT OVER IT!
Cully Hamner is an American comic book artist, known for his work on such books as Green Lantern: Mosaic, Blue Beetle, Black Lightning: Year One, and Detective Comics.
MORE COOL CRAP FROM SubGenius DR. PHILO DRUMMOND! Signed by KRK RYDEN
KRK Ryden is an artist, musician, SubGenii and Bay Area native. His surrealistic art style is reflective of his taste in cartoons and pulp art and his work is described as "colorful and visually appealing reflections on discarded icons."
ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS 
SANDY K BOONE | Director / Producer
Sandy K. Boone began making films in Austin in the 1980s with her late husband, filmmaker David Boone, whose Texas cult classic Invasion of the Aluminum People was presented by director Jonathan Demme at the Collective for Living Cinema in 1981 in New York. Three decades later, Boone and Black produced a restoration of the film as part of Jonathan Demme: Made in Texas – Six Films From Austin, which premiered at SXSW in 2015. At that screening, Richard Linklater told how seeing Invasion, and another of the MIT films at an art gallery screening in Houston inspired him to move to Austin.
LOUIS BLACK | Executive Producer 
Louis Black co-founded The Austin Chronicle, where he was editor for more than three decades, SXSW, where he is a director, and was a founding Board Member of the Austin Film Society. He has written extensively on film, music and politics. Executive producer of Be Here to Love Me, A Film About Townes Van Zandt, he was a producer on the Peabody Award Winning The Order of Myths. Working with Mark Rance he produced a reissue of Eagle Pennell's The Whole Shootin' Match.
Sandy K Boone and Louis Black, of Black and Boone Productions.
BLACK AND BOONE now closely collaborate on all projects. They were deeply involved in crafting, structuring and shaping the documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny, which premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and was the initial screening of PBS's American Masters 2017 Fall season. They worked as Executive Producers on Keith Maitland's critically acclaimed Tower and Karen Skloss' The Honor Farm, which premiered at SXSW. They are executive producers on The Newspaperman and Road Angel, both still in production. Blaze, written and directed by Ethan Hawke, on which they worked, is scheduled for a 2018 release. Their next project to be released is Eggshells, a reissue of Tobe Hooper’s first film from 1969.
MICHELLE RANDOLPH FAIRES | Producer
Michelle Randolph Faires began her career in independent film by supporting area film-related non-profit organizations before moving into production. She worked with Austin Film Festival as the Festival & Conference Hospitality Coordinator for two years before joining the staff full-time as the Outreach and Community Coordinator. Additionally, she supported aGLIFF, as the Volunteer Coordinator and Festival Manager, later serving a full three year term on the Board of Directors. After moving into the production world, she produced her first short, followed by a feature length documentary on the legendary Broken Spoke dancehall, Honky Tonk Heaven. The film premiered at SXSW 2016 and earned an Audience Award. Michelle has been a part of the funding and producing teams for film projects The Newspaperman, Leslie and Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George's Creators, as well as PBS-KLRU series Standup Empire, a series showcasing the expansive comedy scene in Austin, Texas.
LAUREN SANDERS | Editor 
Lauren Sanders is an editor and post-production supervisor with experience on a wide range of commercial and film projects. After working as senior editor at Arts+Labor for 6 years, she collaborated extensively with clients like GSD&M and C3. Her most recent film credits include post-supervisor on 2017's comedy, Ripped, co-writer and editor on the documentary The Jones Family Will Make a Way, and assistant editor and co-composer on Clay Liford's Slash. She also is credited as post-production supervisor and assistant editor on Kat Candler’s Hellion, an official selection of both the Sundance and SXSW film festivals. Lauren is a graduate of the Radio-Television-Film program at the University of Texas at Austin.
DAVID LAYTON | Director of Photography
David Layton is an Austin-based filmmaker with a passion for cinematography and documentary film. He began his career as a newspaper reporter, but honed his technical skills working in the camera department on notable documentary features such as The Unforeseen, Be Here to Love Me, The Devil and Daniel Johnston, You’re Gonna Miss Me, Nuclear Family, Troop 1500, and Letter From Waco. He was cinematographer on two recent PBS documentaries, By the River of Babylon: An Elegy for South Louisiana and Through the Repellant Fence: A Land Art Film. Most recently, David shot the feature documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny and is directing/producing The Newspaperman about legendary Philadelphia Inquirer editor Gene Roberts.
IVAN STANG | Consultant
Ivan Stang is a writer, filmmaker, radio broadcaster/personality, as well as one of the founders of the Church of the SubGenius. As a filmmaker, Stang has done animation work and editing for films such as Arise!: The SubGenius Video, a “spoof” documentary for the Church of the SubGenius, and animation work for MTV and music video shorts. He is most notable for writing The Book of the SubGenius, and other SubGenius literature. Stang hosts the hour-long radio broadcast "The Hour of Slack," produced partially by WCSB at Cleveland State University and syndicated across North America. He remains an active SubGenii, continuing his work with the Church and appearing at X-Day, the SubGenius celebration held every year in Ohio, where Stang resides.
A POEM WRITTEN BY THE FILMMAKERS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are very close to completion of this documentary. Once completed, the film will be submitted to festivals as well as seek worldwide distribution. We are confident that this film tells the extraordinary history of this unorthodox religion in a way that will be satisfying to J.R. “Bob” Dobbs’ fan base. We are committed to capturing a rare look inside the creation and preservation of this phenomenon. That being said, we cannot guarantee mass distribution of the film. But, we believe wholeheartedly in this project; we are determined to share this film with as many people as possible for hope of a SLACK REVOLUTION. 

– DOBBS APPROVED –
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: SubGenius Doc Picked Up for Distribution!!
updates.update_content:
Greeting, SubGenii – 
Did you miss us?!?!
"Bob" works in mysterious ways, and at long last we can reveal all that has been going on behind the scenes of our film. After spending the better part of 2018 interviewing, editing, color-correcting, sound-mixing, and festival submitting, we are proud and excited to announce that –
Greetings Friends! Welcome to 2018!

THANK YOU!!!!! WE DID IT!!!!!! and now...........THE END IS JUST THE BEGINNING AND PRAISE "BOB"
YOU BEAUTIFUL DONORS YOU! BECAUSE OF YOU, WE DID IT!!!!! WE raised $206,891 WITH 1,257 BACKERS JOINING US IN THIS SLACK REVOLUTION!
We want to take you with us!! The SubGenii tribe is growing and trust us, we are a lot more fun when the Conspiracy isn’t making us madly scrounge for dollars.  and let “Bob” show you We are taking all our toys, (and we have even better ones there), all our new friends, and continuing on our magic pleasurecraft ride through the world of the SubGenius, past and future. We’ll keep you posted on our progress.

updates.update_userinfo: GIVE US YOUR ADDRESS SO WE CAN SEND YOU YOUR REWARDS!!!
updates.update_content: Friends! SO EXCITING! We not only made the goal in our ALL-OR-NOTHING campaign, thanks to YOU, we also have an incredible number of backers in this beginning on our SLACK REVOLUTION!

updates.update_userinfo: Church of the SubGenius Reward Update - T-Shirts
updates.update_content:
SO CLOSE.....JUST ONE MORE DOLLAR FOR "BOB"!
Can you believe it? Some of you have been with us from the beginning getting these updates, and others have just recently joined the ranks of the chosen. The chosen who believe in "Bob" and getting this documentary made. We thank you profusely. Each one of you - which is over 1000 now! And now is the critical time of the campaign - the LAST 24 HOURS! We are less than 5K away from our goal! SHARE SHARE SHARE!

updates.update_userinfo: PRAISE "BOB"....SLACK ACHIEVED! ALL BECAUSE OF YOU!
updates.update_content: 48 HOURS LEFT AND WE ARE JUST HITTING OUR STRIDE! WE CHALLENGED AND YOU AWESOME PEOPLE DELIVERED!

project_data.project_name: The Church of the SubGenius | A Documentary

campaign.story:
SEPTEMBER 27TH BONUS UPDATE!
MORE STUFF! BONUS for anyone who has already pledged or WILL pledge before October 2nd -- because this kickstarter has done so well I'm INCREASING what everyone gets. I've expanded the Monster Choke n Gag series from 37 cards to 64 CARDS! ... PLUS you'll get a secret surprise 15 CARD MONSTER set (it'll be a surprise... but you'll be 'blowed away' by golly at it's monstrous goodness... trust me, you'll LOVE IT!)... plus I've added some additional exclusive promo cards so the total number of promo cards has gone from about 15 ... to 26 different!). As mentioned, if you've already pledged at the $50, $90, $100 or more levels you get this bonus stuff AUTOMATICALLY! A FREE BONUS TREAT from RRParksCARDS! If you want to take a look at the FULL SET of EXCLUSIVE promo cards just scroll on down to the very end of this description... it's the last photo.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
HAPPY HALLOWEEN from RRParks CARDS! We're wrapping up our fourth year as a trading card publisher as well as our fourth Halloween as a publisher. Every October we publish some fun spoooooky horror/monster sets and this Halloween is no different except that we have FOUR NEW CARD SERIES all releasing before October 31st 2017! Your pledge on this project helps with production costs and will make sure you get ALL FOUR CARD SERIES as well as exclusives.
Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 3
First up,  Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 3. Our series 1 featured the whimsical and macabre artwork of Tom Rowlandson ... series 2 featured the gothic horror artwork of Hieronymus Hess. This series 3 features 25 standard size 'retro stalgic' cards of the classic 1741 Gedenkt Sterven and Pater Abraham St. Clara suite,  produced in Amersterdam nearly 300 years ago! These have been colored in muted grays and oranges (the originals were back and white) for a spooky 'feel' to them. Set comes in it's own wrapper. 
Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 4
Second up is Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 4 -- with classic stills from 'bad' monster and horror movies and goofy jokes (some realllly pushing the lines of good taste, but hey -- we're all adults here). This is a largest Monster Choke 'n Gag series to date with 37 different mini cards in panels and singles along with a separate checklist. the wrapper inside is designed with 'do it yourself' riff options. Set comes in it's own 'wide' wrapper.
Halloween Trick or Treat Series Five
Third up is Halloween Trick or Treat Series 5 -- continuing our journey back in time to the classic age of Halloween this, too, is our largest Halloween Trick and Treat series to date with 20 different cards featuring full color reproductions of vintage Halloween art -- and on the backs? Creepy, living Vegetable creatures from the turn of the century! Like the Grim Reaper and Monster Choke 'n Gag series these, too, are old timey retro-Stalgic style. Set comes in it's own wrapper.
N104 Dukes Comic Characters
Fourth and final is the 'treat' in 'trick or treat' -- for the first time in 130 years a complete reprinting of the non-sport classic N104: Duke's Comic Characters. This 25-card set has been completely remastered, capturing all the color of the original series but in a STANDARD trading card size (instead of the elongated size of the original series). And let's face it, who here has $1,000-$1,200 to spend on a 25-card set? I sure don't -- so here, for ALL of us, is the classic N104 series of 1888. The backs feature the original checklist artwork like on the originals, produced in a candesce uncoated back 'retro-stalgic' front sheen offset. Set comes in it's own wrapper.
All FOUR different card series, with bonus promos and inserts and wrappers
So that's four different sets for Halloween --  for me it just wouldn't be Halloween if I wasn't loading a bunch of spooky sets into my collection. And hopefully some of you feel the same -- that after 4 years, it's part of Halloween to have RRParksCARDS monster sets to collect. 
All 9 cards in 3-card set -- Gold, Silver and White Metal
In addition to the basic four sets above it wouldn't be a Kickstarter without special stuff, right? So that great couple team at Faerie Metal will be doing gold, silver and metal special limited edition cards for Kickstarter. There will be:
3 Gold Metal Vintage Halloween cards (images NOT in the regular set) ...
3 Silver Metal N104 Duke's Comic Character cards with the 1888 images from the classic series...
and
3 White Metal Chronicles of the Grim Reaper cards series.
These metal cards will be limited to the number of backers (well, "plus one" because I want a set, too).
Examples of printing plates -- each plate is either cyan (blue), magenta (red), yellow or black.
In addition to Faerie Metal cards backers at the special pledge level will ALSO get genuine printing plates from Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 3, Halloween Trick or Treat Series 5, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 4 and N104 Duke's Comic Characters. 
Error cards will be a surprise!
In addition to all THAT, master set backers will ALSO get at least TWO error cards. How on EARTH could I know there will be error cards? Because I got in the production run of N104 this afternoon and FOUND error cards. How cool is THAT!
Special Promo Card Set
In addition to all that additional stuff, we're NOT quite done... master set backers will get special wide promo cards! These promo cards are not being given out 'free with SASE' or included with other purchases. There's only TWO ways to get them -- one is this Kickstarter, in the master level pledge (and the other is SOME subscribers of The Wrapper will be sent one with their renewal subscription notice). And that's IT! No conventions, shows, requests, etc. So if you ever want to own a complete set of all the exclusive promos for Duke's Comic Characters, Grim Reaper Series 3, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 4 or Halloween Trick or Treat Series 5 this...is...IT! Right now. And there are over 15 of these different promo cards!
Bonus 3-card promo set
ONE more 'additional' thing for master set level backers -- the THREE different RRParksCARDS 2017 regular Halloween Series Promo cards.
During this Kickstarter I will actually be engaged in production proceedings so that the only thing left to do when this Kickstarter ends is to submit my order for Faerie Metal for the metal cards. This way I can assure all backers that they'll get their packages full of Halloween cardboard goodies BEFORE Halloween. 
For those who have not been following my annual sets I'm creating a special pledge level for ALL my past Halloween sets and series ... that includes Halloween Trick or Treat Series 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 ... Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 1, 2, 3 and 4 ... Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 1, 2, and 3 .... The Dungeon of Doctor Dreck Series 1 and 2 ... Gary Saves the Graveyard with ALL 8 ACTOR AUTOGRAPH cards ... Japanese Horror Yoshitoshi in 3D with 3D glasses ... and The Monster Times Boxed Set. And since 'The Most Irritating Man in the World' series includes severed heads, flaming skeletons, blood and gore let's throw it into the mix, too. 
... As always, if you want a customized pledge level created that's not a problem. Just message me during the Kickstarter campaign and we'll hammer out something that works for you -- uncut sheets, multiple sets, additional printing plates ... perhaps one of the limited edition Hans Holbeing Dance of Death etching sets... If you can think of it, we can figure out how to make a custom package for you.  Unlike some Kickstarter campaigns, I will actually be producing DURING the campaign... so that as soon as the campaign ends and 'funds' clear I'll get in the order for the metal cards but ALL other card sets will be produced so I will actually be mailing out packages FAST ...   I want ever backer on this campaign to get their trading card package well in advance of Halloween and will do all I can to make sure that happens. Expect the 'usual' RRParks CARDS Kickstarter 'updates' throughout the project and afterwards, keeping everyone regularly updated on progress and shipping. Questions? Just message me... And have a wonderful HALLOWEEN!
PLEDGE LEVELS: How to GET all this SPOOOOOKY SWAG!
$28 Pledge Level get you Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 3 PLUS the 3 regular promo cards, postpaid in the US!
 $50 Pledge Level gets you one of EACH of the RRParksCARDS Halloween 2017 trading card sets: Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 3, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 4, Halloween Trick or Treat Series 5 and the N104 Duke Comic Characters set -- all in their own special wrappers, complete sets ... PLUS 3 regular promo cards!
 The $90 Pledge Level are for those who feel "once is nice, twice is nicer"... This level gets you EVERYTHING in the $50 level...TWICE! As a bonus it also includes a printing plate AND an error card.
 The $100 MASTER SET pledge level is EVERYTHING! At this level you get one of each set (just like in the $50 level) PLUS one printing plate from each series PLUS error cards PLUS the set of 3 standard promo cards PLUS ALL of the 15+ special release 'wide' promo cards PLUS the set of 3 GOLD METAL Halloween Cards PLUS the set of 3 SILVER METAL Duke Comic Character Cards PLUS the 3 WHITE METAL Grim Reaper cards ... this is the level for someone who wants EVERYTHING from this year's Halloween Card Series.
Master Set Pledge Level
 The $250 level is for collectors who missed out on the previous 3 years of RRParksCARDS Halloween sets and want this year's sets, too. This is the ULTIMATE level -- it includes EVERYTHING in the $100 Master Level... PLUS everything from the last 3 years. So this package deal pledge level includes Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 1, 2, 3, and 4 ... Halloween Trick or Treat Series 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 ... Chronicles of the Grim Reaper Series 1, 2 and 3 ... The Dungeon of Doctor Dreck 1 and 2 ... Japanese Horror Yoshitoshi in 3D plus 3D glasses ... The Monster Times boxed set ... Gary Saves the Graveyard (with all 8 different genuine autograph cards from the 7 main actors AND the director)... promo cards for everything... printing plates listed in the Master Pledge level ... error cards ... all 9 different 2017 Master Level Metal cards (3 Gold, 3 Silver and 3 White) and MORE bonus surprises. This is one sca-a-a-a-ary fun package and a great way to pass the time on Halloween night waiting for trick or treaters and watching some classic monster movie on TV.
The Ultimate!
 Want a customized combo? More printing plates? Perhaps the Hans Holbein Limited Edition Etching set? If you don't find the exact Pledge Level deal above just let me know and we'll put together a customized pledge for you.
These are the 26 different EXCLUSIVE tabbed promo cards!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 12th Kickstarter -- 100% of the previous 11 Kickstarters all successfully funded and everyone received everything they pledged for either early, exactly on, or NEARLY on the projected release date. So I'm no stranger to publishing, time frames, deadlines, production matters, Kickstarter proceedures and shipping. So the risks boil down to "planetary destruction by asteroid" and... well, that's about it! I might be a weirdo but I manage my time and production schedules pretty darn well -and my printing production broker at ICONIX, Karen 'Wonder Woman' Cowan has been involved in keeping 100% of ALL my trading card series on time and produced right -- So before Halloween 2017 you WILL be opening a box of spooky trading cards from RRParks CARDS.

updates.update_userinfo: The 2019 RRParks CARDS SIXTH Annual 'Halloween Trading Cards' Kickstarter has just launched!
updates.update_content: In keeping with the spirit of my favorite holiday of the year ... and the very first 'tradition' at RRParksCARDS started about 6 years ago we've just now launched our Halloween Kickstarter! This year we have Halloween Trick or Treat Series 7, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series 6 (special spotlight on Attack of the Giant Leeches), Quatermass and the Pit Series 2, a special NASA tribute card (of famous astrochimp and first primate into space HAM! ... with a 3D back by 3D anaglyph maestro Christian LeBlanc) ... plus 4 different WEIRD sport card sets too strange to be considered actual sports cards ... PLUS the return of Genuine Etching cards (so far I'm the only publisher who releases genuine etching cards ... because they are incredibly challenging to pull off!) ... PLUS two metal cards featuring demons, witches and The Golem. PLUS exclusive promo cards and other goodies.

updates.update_userinfo: The 2018 RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter ends in about ONE HOUR
updates.update_content:
There are quite a few 'followers-but-not-backers-yet' ... here's the final countdown for the 2018 RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter. If you're going to pledge this Kickstarter and get in on the spooky fun of our 5th Annual Halloween festivities (4 different card series this year with Halloween Trick or Treat Series Six, Monster Choke 'n Gag Series Five, Scary Clowns Series One and Quatermass and the Pit Series One)... plus other goodies and treats ... it's now time to pledge before the clock runs down to zero. And we're nearly at ZERO!  
Backers (and non-backers, too)

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CHANCE to get in on the 2018 RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Our 2018 RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter has only TWO DAYS LEFT! This year we continue the Halloween Trick or Treat series with series SIX... Monster Choke 'n Gag with series FIVE ... and Scary Clowns series ONE. ALSO, starting this Halloween, Quatermass and the Pit series ONE. Plus the traditional 'trick or treat' goodie bag with surgar-y and plastic-y treats so no matter how old you can relive the fun of trick or treating without venturing any further than your mail box. 
This Kickstarter ends Tuesday, October 23 at 9:01 PM PDT. That's only 2 full days from now (well... 55 hours to be exact if you actually read this update when I post it).

updates.update_userinfo: The 2018 RRParksCARDS Halloween Kickstarter is now LIVE
updates.update_content: Just launched this year's Halloween Trading Card Kickstarter! it features Halloween Trick or Treat Series 6, Monster Choke 'n Gag series 5, Scary Clowns series 1 and the start of another 'annual' card series: Quatermass and the Pit Series 1. PLUS exclusive 'Macarie' portrait cards in FULL METAL! Plus 11 different super rare 'tab' promo cards for Scary Clowns and Monster Choke 'n Gag. Plus the usual bonus goodies, printing plates, progressive proofs, errors and other stuff INCLUDING the traditional 'trick or treat' goodie bag so everyone can feel like a kid again.

If you've been following me on Facebook, Kickstarter, etc. you've seen all the Sharknado Series One postings (Sharknado pre-order ends tonight at 8pm PST) and Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series Two (Pre-order BEGINS tonight at 9pm) and perhaps you're figuring "Naw, no way can one guy do all that ... and STILL have his annual Halloween cards". Well I'm happy to say if you're figuring that you figured wrong. Come hell 'r high water I always issue Halloween trading card sets. It's my favorite holiday and for the last 4 years as a company it's been my tradition to issue trading card series for Halloween. And this year is no exception. THREE series have already been designed AND published. Yep. They are sitting 'right here' (well, okay... in the storage area but otherwise 'right here'). They exist. They're done. And they are Halloween Trick or Treat series SIX ... Monster Choke 'n Gag series FIVE ... and a mini set called Scary Clowns. I've got two other series I have mostly designed and those, too, will be produced in time for Halloween.

updates.update_userinfo: Final Day and Final Hours for Mystery Science Theater 3000 Trading Cards
updates.update_content: Today is the final day... and we're into the final hours... to pre-order Mystery Science Theater 3000 Series One Trading Cards. The kickstarter ends tonite at 10pm. This is the ONLY chance EVER to pre-order a master set. The cut off date for a master set is tonite at 10pm. Sorry, no exceptions ... I place the final numbers order with production tomorrow morning. If you ever want to add a complete master set of MST3K Series One to your collection, tonite is the cut off. Now, if you don't have the money to pre-order a master set just email me ... I can do up some paperwork so you can pay for it sometime during January and you'll therefore be able to get it. But if I don't hear from you today, I can't reserve a master set for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Just a little bonus ... for MST3K Backers
updates.update_content: Am happy to report that we've brought on over 200 backers for our Mystery Science Theater 3000 Kickstarter! Woo hoo! It's also our most complex and varied card series to date with a HUGE base and sub set count (over 150 cards), 3D anaglyph cards, DVD Menu art cards, Diecut Faux Film Cell cards, genuine show-used prop relic cards, box topper metals, limited edition art cards, retro-style 'Riff It' cards, and more ... including original art Sketch Card inserts by THE top name artists in the hobby. Am very happy to see both new names AND previous Kickstarter backer names showing up on the pledge lists. The campaign ends December 27th (and some pledge levels will be ending BEFORE December 27th). So if you like science fiction, monsters, humor and cultish comedy weirdness be sure to check out the Kickstarter. And thank you again for being supportive of RRParksCARDS, the non-sport card hobby and small publishers!

updates.update_userinfo: MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000 ... our most successful Kickstarter EVER!
updates.update_content: Very excited. This has been a very busy week. Got final approvals for the 250+ different cards of MST3K series one... the box ... the wrapper. And two and a half hours ago got the 'green light' to proceed to PRE ORDERS. So I've launched the Kickstarter for MST3K Series One Trading Cards. A YEAR in production ... I can breath a sigh of relief ONLY long enough to be glad the project is heading to production... but then it's work, work, work actually producing it. So, if you like movie monsters, sci fi, funny robots and mad scientists check out what's on the horizon from RRParksCARDS ... it is no longer "coming soon"... it's coming NOW!

campaign.story:
Marijuana Trading Cards is a brand new way of looking at herbs, a fun way to collect all of your favorite strains. Each card is printed with its own suit and number. You can mix and match your favorite strains to create your own standard 52 card playing deck. They can be used to identify herbs in your stash or identify plants in your garden. These cards will also be used in our upcoming Marijuana Trading Card game. If we reach our funding goals we will be able to create a new set of cards every year.
Marijuana Trading cards was conceived as a way of raising funds for HocG. HocG is an Oregon based medical marijuana company whose goal is to distribute free hashish to patients who can not afford the medicine they need.

campaign.story:
ABOUT THE SET
Patterned after classic monster trading cards from the 1960s and 70's, Ed Repka's MONSTERDOM sticker cards are packaged in a classic wax wrapper made as only SideKick can!  Each pack includes all 12 sticker cards, and stored in a miniature collectible display box alongside a special promo card featuring the artist himself!  The back of each card features a bio of the character on the front.  The set is strictly limited to 500 packs!
ABOUT ED REPKA
Ed Repka is known worldwide for his many illustrations of Vic Rattlehead, Megadeth's skeletal mascot and is widely regarded as the undisputed king of thrash metal album cover art with hundreds of covers to his credit. His art has also appeared on numerous magazines including Horrorhound and Revolver, Star Wars and Mars Attacks trading cards from Topps, as well as apparel, posters, and action figures. He has also created concept and design work for hundreds of toys and collectables, and designed several mascots for heavy metal festivals.
ABOUT SIDEKICK LAB
The set is produced by SideKick Lab, who manufactured Topps' Mars Attacks: Occupation trading card series, and Dan Brereton's CREEPING FLESH trading cards, both of which were successfully funded on kickstarter.
This project is being run by Tom Lichtman, owner of SideKick, and Adam Levine, formerly of Topps. Both were responsible for running the Mars Attacks campaign, while Tom & SideKick handled both manufacturing and shipping/fulfillment for those projects.
  Digital Mock-Ups
• Wax Pack Sticker Set: the wax wrapped sticker set will include 12 full color stickers. Each sticker card includes a full color monster head painting on the front by Ed Repka, and a bio of each character on the back. Included with every set is a promo card of Ed Repka, and a miniature cardboard display box.
• 5x7 Jumbo Card Set: a unique oversized edition of MONSTERDOM featuring all 12 cards! Printed on classic chip stock, measuring 5" x 7", and packaged in an oversized wax wrapper. The art on the wrapper will be classic/retro 4-color line art. These oversized cards are perfect for framing!
• Metal Autograph Card: a specially designed creator metal card autographed by the artist!
• Black & White Sketch Card: Limited to 70, Ed will create black and white pencil sketches of his own monsters!
• Full Color Sketch Card: also limited to 75, and distributed across multiple pledge levels, Ed will paint sketch cards in full color of his many fiendish monster faces!
• Uncut Sheet: Measuring about 8" x 14.5".
• Autograph Collector Pack: a special version of the sticker set, where each sticker is hand signed, stamped with a special "autograph edition" seal, and packaged in a foil-stamped black velvet box.
• "Your Face as a Monster!" Sketch Card: LIMITED TO 5! With some proper photo reference of your face, Ed will create a full color sketch card of YOU as a monster!
        All add-on items are available in unlimited quantities.  To select them, simply total up the cost of the items you'd like to receive and add that amount to your pledge.  After the campaign, we'll send you a form to fill out to tell us what you wanted.
Measurement of Uncut Sheet is rough estimate, final uncut may be slightly different
      Example pledge only. Select any reward level and any add-ons you wish.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SideKick Lab is a printing facility located in Rutland, Vermont. SideKick specializes in accurately reproducing the materials and methods of classic Wax Pack trading cards.

In order to compensate Ed for the use of his artwork, to cover the costs of printing, packaging, assembly, and shipping, we need to collect a small amount to make sure the product is worthwhile for everyone involved.

The good news is that SideKick has a long history of trading card production, and is a well-oiled, fine-tuned machine. SideKick produced Buff Monster's Melty Misfits cards, Topps' Mars Attacks: Occupation, Bobby Aker's "Blood Drive" series, plus many projects for major companies such as Skybound ("Outcast"), Fox ("Bob's Burgers"), PopCap ("Plants vs Zombies"), and many many more!

While this is SideKick's second foray on Kickstarter, Tom & Adam have previously been part of numerous campaigns, most notably running the massive Mars Attacks: Occupation campaign, which had over 500 backers receiving dozens of different pledge reward items.

This campaign is a much simpler project, and all logistics have been carefully considered and planned for a smooth production and fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping about to begin, last reward element to complete
updates.update_content:
We have almost all reward components in hand.  The one element yet to be completed are the jumbo wax wrappers (the jumbo cards themselves are ready).  Artwork is in hand, only printing and waxing need to be done.
Tenative schedule is to finish the jumbo wrappers and packs next week, and then ship quickly afterwards.
Our plan is to ship all rewards to backers in one big shipping day, so everyone will receive them roughly the same time.

Word came in today that Ed Repka is sending back completed sketches and autograph cards!  We are this and next week finishing up shipping on Creeping Flesh, and will immediately move into shipping on Monsterdom!

Update on our production progress:
-Sketch Blanks are complete and are with Ed now; he is working on the color sketches.   We apologize for the delay on our side, we had a print error in the summer that was not noticed until just before they were to be mailed to Ed that required us to completely reprint them.
-Jumbo Cards are completed, printed, and ready to be sealed in their wax wrappers.  We hope to have this done in the next 2 weeks.

First, an update on production.  Here's a list of Monsterdom production elements remaining to be completed: 
1) Wax wrappers for 5x7 jumbo cards. Art is completed.
2) Actual printing plates. We've created and designed the back printing, and now will print the large plates with this design, which is done at Green Screen Graphics. That will take up to a week.  After that, we have to cut the sheet down to card size, which takes a day or two.  NOTE: these are being done in same batch with Creeping Flesh, and another project, so times are for all of these together.

First, apologies for the delay in update. Part of the reason was because of backers not completing survey-- until recently there were still about 30-35 surveys unaccounted for, so we've spent time following up with individual backers; because until surveys were completed, we could not calculate how many to print of each item.  
There are still a handful lingering, but we now have enough data to set our print runs.  If your survey is NOT filled out and completed please do so ASAP.

Thanks for your patience as we worked through some delays-- but the survey is now out and will remain open for 30 days.  Please fill in your shipping details, and select what you had wanted as add-ons.
PLEASE NOTE that the survey is coming from CROWDOX, via email.  Be sure to check your spam folders and junk email if it does not arrive in the next 2-3 days.  Most backers should have no problem receiving it, but some more... aggressive filters have been known to screen it.

Hi everyone.  We've had a few minor issues assembling the survey, but are working on it overtime this weekend so we can get it distributed in this coming week.
As mentioned, everyone will have a chance to add some extras to their reward selection, and we'll be making a few new items available, such as printing plates and extra packs!
We appreciate your patience as we get the survey ready for email distribution.
