campaign.story:
Alliteration Ink Presents
Is there a better phrase to start a story than "No Shit, There I Was..."? If you hear someone start with that phrase, you know it's going to be worth listening carefully. That's how all the craziest - and most interesting - stories start.
And then we turned a bunch of speculative fiction authors loose on that phrase.
I mean, these stories - whew.  Science fiction. Fantasy. Humor. Even horror. What they came up with is kind of hard to believe.
But no shit, there we were.
Who is Behind This Project
Rachael Acks is a writer, geologist, and sharp-dressed sir. In addition to her steampunk novella series, she’s had short stories in Strange Horizons, Waylines, Daily Science Fiction, Penumbra, and more. She’s an active member of SFWA, the Northern Colorado Writer’s Workshop, and Codex.
The publisher is Alliteration Ink, who has a track record of fulfilling Kickstarter-backed anthologies and making sure that backers get the rewards they signed up for.  Please see our crowdfunding policies if you have any questions.
These twenty four stories from authors around the globe bring us tales that stretch the realm of probability. 
Our authors are: Matt Dovey and Stewart Baker, William Ledbetter, James Beamon, Rachael K Jones, Wren Wallis, Heather Morris, E. Catherine Tobler, Tyler Hayes, Darcie Little Badger, Jo Robson, Premee Mohamed, R. K. Duncan, Sarah Tchernev, Linda Tyler, Anne M. Gibson, Andrew Barton, Sunil Patel, David Jón Fuller, William Wood, Devyani Borade, Adrian Simmons, Frances Rowat, Lou J Berger, and Alanna McFall. 
Stay tuned to our updates to hear more from the authors about how their stories came to be!
Our cover artist is Brandon Chng. This art has been used for our Kickstarter video and promotional materials, as well as the cover for this anthology.
Want more copies? 
if you want more than one copy, increase your pledge by the appropriate amount - $15 + shipping ($5 US/$15 worldwide) for the trade paperback, $50+ shipping ($10 US/$20 worldwide) for hardcover.
OUR GOALS
Once we hit this fundraising goal, the project will be able to pay all the creative folks for their work. All authors will get at least the current SFWA professional rate.
Once we reach this fundraising goal, it will add value to all backers by adding interior line artwork to half the stories!
Once we reach this fundraising goal, it will add value to all backers by adding interior line artwork to (the other) half of the stories!
Once we reach this fundraising goal, we will be able to give all the authors a pay increase for their stories!
GETTING THE BOOKS
When you pledge $5 or more, you will receive the eBook in all three major formats: PDF, ePub, and Kindle. Every reward level above $5 includes the eBook. When you pledge $15 or more, you will get the eBook and you will also receive the trade paperback with the gorgeous cover.
BUT WAIT. We make it easy for you to pledge for the number and kind of books that you want. Want to get the paperback and the hardcover? Want the hardcover and a story critique? No problem.
We also offer add-ons for more copies to ANY REWARD LEVEL! For extra copies of the eBook, add $5 per copy to the reward level of your choice, whether it already includes the book or not. For copies of the paperback, add $15 per copy to any level, and for copies of the hardcover, add $50 per copy to any level. 
Please do this as part of your pledge; to keep costs down we do not utilize any third-party Kickstarter fulfillment companies.
Where is the money going?
Our initial goal is enough to pay everyone involved - the authors, the editors, and the cover artist - a professional rate. Here's how the funding percentage for our initial goal breaks down:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In all projects that involve contributions from multiple people and companies, there's the possibility of an unexpected delay here or there. That said, we already have the stories and are working on editing at this time.

If we reach the additional artwork level, it will take time to obtain quality art for your books.

That said, we're stacking the odds in our favor. We already have the cover art and all of the listed stories in our hands, but there are details, revisions, and production schedules to consider. We will do our best to get this book to you on schedule.

Alliteration Ink has a robust crowdfunding policy at https://github.com/uriel1998/ainkpolicies/blob/master/kickstarter.md

We've also successfully fulfilled several Kickstarters so far, and whenever problems have arisen, we've been transparent about what the difficulties were and getting them fixed.

campaign.story:
Kannon Headphones - Deep Bass You Can Feel
Conventional headphones simply cannot do bass audio justice.  Because your body hears deep bass audio through vibrations, traditional headphones shortchange you at low frequencies.  Hearing is ultimately a physical sensation.  Out in the world you feel sound, especially at the low end. Sound waves don’t just travel in air, they travel through whatever they encounter, including your body.  A bass drop on the dance floor.  The deep thump of a drum at a concert or symphony.  A heavy truck rumbling by.  When you hear those sounds you are also feeling the combination of the physical impact of the sounds waves and the way they resonate within your body. 
The lowest frequencies – 60Hz and below – are diminished and frequently missing entirely in conventional headphones.  Even with the best audio drivers that may reproduce sound down to 30 Hz, there still seems to be something missing.  Why?  Because your body “feels” as much of the sound in that frequency range as it “hears” it.  True realism comes from being able to feel low frequencies as well as hear them. 
PLAY

Fans of bass audio – Bassheads – have been on a long, intensive search for a headphone that can truly deliver a convincing bass experience. Now that long search is over. 
 Taction Technology (TM)
Taction Technology has designed the Kannon headphones with a unique haptic driver that accurately delivers low frequency audio through vibrations, so you hear the full range of audio, complete with deep, resonating bass that is missing in conventional headphones. Each earcup in the new Taction Kannon headset has both a traditional driver and a haptic driver. The traditional driver transfers higher-frequency audio – treble and mid-tones – as well as the high end of the low-frequency spectrum. The haptic driver delivers a clean strong bass sensation down to 15 Hz, well beyond the capabilities of a traditional driver. 
Taction Haptic Driver
        “Through innovations in engineering and product design Taction was able to take a good concept that had yet to be effectively realized and launch what we believe will be a market-changing product in the Taction Kannon.” 
The few attempts to use haptic technology in the past have been fairly simplistic, similar to the rumble employed in game controllers. They also lacked the power and range to render lower-frequency audio, where vibrations can have such intense impact. Even worse, these attempts at haptic drivers actually degraded the overall quality of the audio by interfering with the sound coming from the traditional magnetic driver.
      “For other brands, a haptic headphone in their lineup is little more than a marketing gimmick. At Taction, haptic is all we do, which is why the Kannon has the first haptic driver that actually improves rather than degrades audio quality in a headphone.” 
Taction’s haptic drivers have been re-thought from the ground up. 
Unlike prior market attempts at haptic audio technology, the Kannon drivers move parallel to the side of the head: the new design is planar, older designs axial. This innovation is critical because it leaves the volume of air in the ear cup unchanged, preserving the fidelity of the audio coming from the traditional driver. In addition, some nifty engineering advances allowed the team to generate 20 times more power than the few haptic drivers in the market can muster. 
 Combined these two advances allow the Taction haptic driver to deliver lower bass and more accurate fidelity across all frequencies.  
"… a masterfully accurate vibration that mirrors what you would feel in the real world." 
-- Ryan Shwayder, Basshead Club 
"...heightened degree of musical realism."..."artfully combines a traditional dynamic driver with a well-crafted, proprietary Taction haptic driver."
--Chris Martens, Hi-fi+
 The Advantages of the Taction Kannon
The Taction Kannon is designed for audio enthusiasts and headphone users who value high-quality, immersive audio when listening to music, playing video games, and watching movies. 
Music Fans:   The home audio goal for most music fans is to try and recreate the live music experience as closely as they can. The Taction Kannon builds upon an audiophile quality headphone experience with the addition of unmatched bass audio delivered by finely tuned haptic drivers to provide a music experience that you can truly feel. 
Cinephiles:  Now movie buffs can enjoy the immersive audio experience of a cineplex or home theater with a headset. The Taction Kannon lets movie watchers physically experience all the intense rumbles, bangs, growls and thunders that their favorite films have to offer. 
Gamers:  The Taction Kannon provides gamers with a unparallelled immersive audio experience. It also provides a documented competitive advantage by decreasing response times and improving spatial accuracy. The vibrations from haptic drivers have improved the response time of individuals in lab studies by an average of 60 milliseconds, which represents between and 15 percent and 40 percent improvement depending upon the individual. In addition, the physical sensation enhances the ability to distinguish left from right, improving spatial accuracy. 
Reaction Time for Audio Only vs. Haptic Feedback
PLAY

PLAY

Virtual Reality:  As VR transforms from a curiosity to a mainstream reality, the industry is focused on improving the experience by enhancing realism and immersion. Taction intensifies and clarifies spatial audio, providing orientation cues that can be the difference between simulation and the sense of “being there.” 
"The Taction Kannon puts all of my basshead cans to shame … it takes the top seat on the list without contention." 
-- Ryan Shwayder, Basshead Club
Introducing the Taction Kannon
The Taction Kannon is a premium over-ear, closed-back headset with audiophile-quality sound and high-fidelity tactile reproduction. Low-frequency sounds that the body both feels and hears are rendered with unparalleled clarity. The experience is immersive, powerful and precise and unlike anything currently available on the market.  The anticipated retail price is $499 USD with a fourth-quarter 2016 launch date. 
The Taction Kannon will be available for $389 through our Kickstarter campaign, a 25 percent discount and a savings of $110 off the anticipated retail price. 
To try these headphones in person is to understand a new level of musical realism, immersion, and audio depth.  But not everyone can try them during the short span of a Kickstarter campaign.  Accordingly, we offer a 15-day unconditional money-back guarantee (buyer pays return shipping).  If you don't like them, send them back and we will refund your money, no questions asked.  
Features 
Removable, high-sensitivity boom microphone 
Noise-isolating, around-ear leather ear cushions 
Premium finishes and durable construction 
Inline control of haptic intensity, on/off switch for haptic drivers, and mic mute 
Powered via Internal re-chargeable battery (8-hr capacity on a single charge) or through USB directly from an alternate source
Optional latching hard case with precision-cut foam insert 
Specifications
Style:                   Closed-Back Circumaural
Driver:                 40 mm Neodymium Magnet
Taction Driver:    Planar Nd magnet pairs, 0.8 N
Max Power:         1.7 W
Impedance:         38 Ohms
Freq Response (Acoustic):  10-30,000 Hz
Freq Response (Haptic):      15-200 Hz
Weight:                11 oz (312 g)
Typical acoustic data from a Kannon prototype
Typical tactile data from Kannon prototype
 Taction may also provide a long-term hearing preservation benefit.  With Taction, listeners can get a natural and intense experience with lower acoustic volume. Lowering acoustic volume 4.4 dB corresponds to cutting sound power by more than half, consistent with long term hearing preservation. Below are some measurements collected by a friend of the project - Dr. Christopher Schwetizer, board certified audiologist, university professor, and committee member for ANSI standards on hearing aids.
Listeners choose lower acoustic volume when Taction is available.
How it Works
Using the Taction Kannon is straightforward.  No software installation is required.  The attached headphone cable ends in a standard 4-pole 3.5mm plug for audio.  
Insert the 3.5mm audio plug into your audio source and enjoy. If you have both a stereo and microphone port on your device, simply use the included cable splitter.  
The inline controller has a mute button so you can easily turn your mic on and off.  The entire button lights up red to let you know that your mic is muted in case you forget mid-game.  The controller also has a button to turn the haptic driver on and off.  
Once you switch the haptic driver on you can adjust the Taction intensity using the knurled metal control knob to set a level anywhere from subtle to intense. 
Package contents: 
Taction Kannon Headphone with inline controller 
Removable microphone 
USB wall plug with USB charging cord
3.5mm stereo cable splitter

Meet the Taction Team
Taction Technology is a dynamic and fast-moving start-up focused on bringing transformative technology to market.  The Taction Kannon, which has the potential to be a market-changing product in audio and gaming, will be the first product from the team's pipeline.  At the company's core is a small team of experienced executives, scientists and product designers led by S. James Biggs, Ph.D. and Michael Fierro.
S. James Biggs Ph.D. is a former MIT scientist with more than two dozen patents to his credit.  He has spent the last decade working in the development of touch and audio technology.  He started Taction Technology to focus his talent and energy on moving haptic products from concept to reality.
Michael Fierro has more than two decades of experience transitioning products from prototype to product, including strategic development, financial modelling and risk analysis.  His experience will be dedicated to bringing the Taction Kannon to market on schedule.
The executive team is actively supported by an advisory board of tech industry veterans - each of whom has a successful track record as and executive and investor.
Help Us Bring the Impact of Live Sound to Mobile Audio
We've set out to change the way people think about mobile audio.  I know, no small task. That's why we need your help.  The sense of touch has always been an important aspect of sound for me, and once you've experienced the Kannon, I think you will understand.
As a small company with minimal budget, we need your help to pay for tooling, molds, and supplies necessary to start production of this ground-breaking product.
We also need your help to get the word out.  Only a relatively small number of people have had the opportunity to experience a Kannon.  Help us spread the word and the Feeling of Sound.
Other fun stuff
Like the project but aren't in the market for a full set of headphones yet? Then support us at some of the other pledge levels and get some of this fine stuff.

In the event of a cancellation, we’ll refund your pledge. There may be additional duties, fees or taxes charged by the the authorities in your country which will be covered at your expense when receiving the shipment.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with every project that seeks to transfer prototype design to full scale manufacturing, there is the risk that we will not be able to meet our estimated schedule for delivery. The Taction team, however, has done this before multiple times, and are aware of the risk factors, and have taken measures to reduce those risks. We are working with world-class manufacturing partners, and have long standing relationships with our suppliers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey, Taction fans:
Just a quick update.
By now most of you have received your Kannons. We expect to (finally!) complete Kickstarter shipments in the next couple of weeks. It has been a long haul, but we have been gratified by the overwhelmingly favorable response we have gotten.

We have good news and bad news. The good news is that we have a bunch of Kannons ready to head out the door, and they will be heading out to our loyal and patient customers shortly.
The bad news is that our landlord, the TechShop in Redwood City CA, suddenly and without advance notice declared bankruptcy this week, and gave us just a few hours to clear our stuff from the building or lose access to our inventory, tools, etc. for who knows how long.

We've had folks express (understandable) impatience as we work our way through our backer list. We get it -- it has been a very long road, and it is even harder to wait when you know others have gotten their little slices of heaven and you haven't.
Your Kannons are coming -- really.  And our throughput is improving.  Here's a video explaining why:
https://youtu.be/uwcX7x_68mQ

One of the big improvements we told you about what that we added a micro-controller to our drive board. That change enabled us to do cool things like intelligently manage battery life and do a bunch of other things to improve overall performance. 
On the other hand, when you have a microprocessor, you have software/firmware. And when you have software, you have... bugs. And so after we just begun shipping we discovered a bug in our firmware. And fixing that bug created another bug.

Bad news is we just missed starting to ship in July.
Good news is that we will FINALLY begin shipping next week.
Drool-inducing view of the stuff we will be sending you in this video.
Thanks for sticking with us, folks.

Hey, Kannoneers…we are really in the home stretch now. We are too busy to pull together a video right now, but here’s what’s going on: 
 -- manufacturing and assembly of production Kannons has begun. There are still some components that have not yet arrived, but we are pre-assembling what we can to reduce the delay once they get here. 
 -- we remain confident that we will be able to begin shipping Kannons THIS MONTH.

Hey, y'all.
Good stuff happening, and the highlights are covered in the video update.  
Bottom line is that we expect to be able to begin shipping by the middle of next month, and that we'll be sending out the survey to confirm shipping addresses and such  on June 21.
We can see the finish line from here....

Hello, Kannon backers.
Getting close now. With a little luck, we hope to be able to begin shipping late next month.
More details in the video linked below:
http://youtu.be/voso2p2yxC8

Hey, everyone.
We've made good progress since our last update.  We're cautiously optimistic that the hard problems are behind us, and we think the finish line is in sight.
More details in the video linked below:
https://youtu.be/jftYyc51Qh4

campaign.story:
CHRONICLES of THE GRIM REAPER
A History Of Horror
by RRParks CARDS and Tom Rowlandson
A LITTLE PRE-REAPER BACK STORY
After completing Chronicles of The Three Stooges Series 1, 2, 3 and 4 trading cards (one of the largest non-sport card series ever published) I wanted to get back to some good ol' fashioned horror/monster publishing. And this project, Chronicles of The Grim Reaper, is one I've wanted to tackle since about 2001.
As most collectors know (those familiar with RRParks CARDS) horror and humor are my favorite subjects ... I even turned Chronicles of The Three Stooges Series Four into a Stooges and Halloween extravaganza with LOADS of Stooge monster and horror subsets, foils, retros and glow in the dark spooky goodness. And among the horror genre, the Grim Reaper is the most fascinating. In the early 2000s I took on the project of Hans Holbein's Dance of Death (the classic appearance of the Grim
Reaper) -- collecting the wood engravings of the 1530s and remastering genuine intaglio etching plates of the standard classic series of 36 different images and producing the first etched series of Holbein's classic in over 200 years. The series -- sized about the dimensions of a classic tobacco card -- was limited to only 60 sets, which came in a small folio
and insert checklist. The complete edition of 60 was a quick sell out and finding a set anywhere is  essentially impossible. In the early 2010s, right before I launched RRParks CARDS, I remastered  larger version set -- standard trading card size of 2 1/2 x 3 1/2 -- which included the full 49 suite of Holbein's chronicles of the Grim Reaper. This set was limited to only 100 complete sets and each and every card of the series is a hand crafted miniature etching.
After years of searching, in 2015 I finally acquired the complete 1815 original hand painted etching set of the Tom Rowlandson classic The English Dance of Death. This series of fine art etchings is delightfully wicked. Each of the 74 artworks was etched and produced and hand painted in 1815 ... and so the issuance of this trading card series will mark the 200th anniversary of the classic of the macabre.
THE CHRONICLES OF THE GRIM REAPER TRADING CARD PROJECT
This planned trading card series, The Chronicles of The Grim Reaper, will showcase the ENTIRE Tom Rowlandson series in full color and produced in 'widevision' -- just the way it was issued 200 years ago. Card fronts will feature a retro style full color reproduction of the suite in it's entirety
and the backs will feature other artists' depictions of everyone's favorite bone head throughout history. In addition to the card series being especially art heavy it will also feature a fun overview chronicling
the history of The Grim Reaper. A gothic horror series designed by a horror card fan for horror card fans. The card series is planned as a trading card set of 74 cards, produced in 'retro stalgic' style and in widevision (Rowlandson did his etchings in an extra wide style and I don't want to 'pan and scan' the artwork... so will be done in Rowlandson wide-vision style. This means you'll need some 6-pocket pages for your trading card collection binder). The master set will also include 4 different limited edition metal cards (which I'll have produced through Faerie Metal -- they do amazing work!). One promo card is currently planned -- if others are published then ALL promo cards associated with this set will be included with the master set. Please browse through the pledge levels... I think I've got awards that can be accomodated by all types of budgets. Also, even if you're just seeking some stuff to flip on ebay and want numerous limited edition metal cards you can certainly 'send your friends in' to pledge.

To help raise funds for this project I'm creating this Kickstarter campaign so fans of monster and horror trading cards can contribute and be part of the project and add some ghoulish swag to their collection. This campaign features pledge awards at all conceivable levels ... backer awards for those with modest budgets include promo cards, exclusive metal cards (produced by those great folks at Faerie Metal) and sketch cards on up through complete sets to 'patron of the arts' levels which feature not just a complete set of Chronicles of The Grim Reaper but ALSO the actual, original 200-year old production art etchings (to put that in perspective, the artist was alive before the Grim Reaper came for George Washington). Am also including a couple 'horror holidays' levels which include ALL the horror card series published by RRParks CARDS. Note, this kickstarter is being run to help raise completion funds ... I have most of the money needed already but this campaign will hopefully raise the balance needed so I don't have to rely to heavily on my credit cards.
ADD ONS
Once in awhile when I've run a Kickstarter campaign I've had some backers want more than one pledge level. Well NO PROBLEM! All I ask is that you message me what you have in mind PRIOR to pledging... just
so I can make sure what you want to do is possible. I'm easy... I'll work with you... the goals here are for me to raise money to produce this card series AND to make sure you have some really fun stuff for your
collection. So it is to BOTH our advantages for me to work with you on whatever you want to pledge on.
RELEASE DATE
If all goes well this card series will be produced in April. It's planned in conjunction with the production of Chronicles of The Three Stooges Series Five and some aspects (such as the packaging) will be done at the
same time as Stooges. So am figuring April but am stating 'May' in this Kickstarter just in case there are production delays. In other words... plan on receiving your 'swag' in May or earlier (ALL my previous card releases through Kickstarter have ALL issued earlier than stated).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Chronicles of The Grim Reaper marks RRParks CARDS' SIXTH Kickstarter project. The previous five projects were all successfully funded and all backer awards were sent to backers on or before the announced fulfillment dates. I deliver what I say I'll deliver on or before when I say I'll deliver it. And to date I've always included EXTRA 'swag' on top of what I promise to provide. Kickstarter requires I include a 'risk statement' and so here's the 'risk' ... a meteor could come crashing out of the sky and land on my head. But those who have pledged on my campaigns before have come to find out that when I take on a project I see it through and make sure all backers are well rewarded for their help in getting these projects into the realm of 'existence'. 
Throughout this Kickstarter campaign I will post regular updates to this site to keep backers and fans informed as the project progresses. You can also find updates about RRParks CARDS on my facebook page
at RRPARKS CARDS. Images shown in this kickstarter are all prototype -- the series is being designed while the kickstarter is running. Some design elements may be modified during production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: After THE GRIM REAPER comes THE THREE STOOGES!
updates.update_content:
Virtually everyone has received their GRIM REAPER 'swag' packages by now (I think I only have 2 or 3 that haven't responded to the survey or are otherwise having me hold their package while they're on vacation) ... 
Am Gearing up for my next 'trading card publishing adventure'!
Finally... after nearly 60 years am celerbating the 100th anniversary of the FIRST Three Stooges Trading Cards (well, celebrating the 100th anniversary 40 years early... but since I won't likely be publishing 40 years from now I figure I better celebrate NOW) ... with a COMPLETE reissue of the original 1959 Three Stooges Trading Cards. This series is being produced COMPLETE -- with all 96 different cards PLUS the 3 checklists PLUS about 15 of the 1959 'color variations' PLUS a special glossy subset PLUS special metal portrait box toppers ... and MORE! Production is going to be retro style cards to look, feel and smell like 1950s cards. The packs will be wrapped in retro style designed wrappers and all 24 10-card packs will be loaded into a retro style 'retail' box with box topper bonuses. And it's happening right now: I've just launched the kickstarter at noon today and it will run until July 22nd at noon. This '1959 Three Stooges Reissue' will be my most limited edition card series to date (and some of the kickstarter pledge levels are quite limited indeed, first come first served). Am pretty darn excited about this series as it is the MOST requested non-sport card series ... at least, most requested by collectors for me to publish. Should be really fun ... and am publishing it so it feels as CLOSE as POSSIBLE to travelling back in time to 1959 and getting a box THEN. The only thing 'missing' will be the cardboard textured gum (but am sure at the last minute before mailing out backer awards I'll go to the store, buy a bag of Dubble Bubble, and put some in everyone's parcel ... even if you can't chew the stuff sometimes just the smell of bubble gum when opening card packs can transport us back to when we were 8 and still had all our teeth).

Alrighty ... ALL 'Chronicles of The Grim Reaper' backer award packages
are now either mailed (most went out this morning) or they are packaged, labeled
and ready for the letter carrier to pick up tomorrow morning. The only exception
to this are the few backers who haven't responded yet to the mailing address
survey. Once they respond I'll get their awards in the mail right away. But
EVERYONE ELSE who replied with a mailing address mailed either this morning

Just a real quick update ... Chronicles of The Grim Reaper sets are now all cut, collated, assembled and packaged ... the special promo cards are likewise all done ... the exclusive metal card sets all have their signed and numbered COAs and in penny sleeves ... the etchings are done and will be matched with their own COAs tomorrow morning and the bonus sketch cards for those who backed at that level will be finished up tomorrow. Those that pledged at the 'original 1800s etching level' will have their COAs printed up tomorrow and so if all goes well ALL backers will have their packages mailed out either Monday afternoon or early Tuesday. WHEW ... been a VERY busy month but the work is nearly all done. Thanks again for your support!

Yet another update ...
Am finishing up mailing out all Three Stooges Series Five
backer awards today (except for 3 packages, and I've already
spoken with those 3 backers -- their parcels are more complex
than everyone else's).
Meaning TOMORROW I can start the paperwork and shipping
out of all Grim Reaper packages! YAY!

Update:
Happy to report the entire suite of limited etchings was
produced all day yesterday and today.
So what the heck is an etching? Simply: In 'ancient times' a knights
shield would often be 'etched'. This involved taking the shield, made
from a metal that could be corroded quickly with acid. The shield
would be covered in a thin layer of wax and an artist, using a needle,
would draw through the wax whatever design was desired and then
the shield treated with a highly corrosive acid. The acid, when touching
the metal, would corrode that lines exposed through the wax. Once
the etching process was done the wax would be removed and the
etched design would be visible. In the 1500s Rembrandt (or rather
most notably Rembrandt) revived this lost art form but instead of
etching a shield he etched a sheet of copper utilizing a similar etching
approach. The resultant etched copper was called an 'etched plate'.
The etched plate was heated and an oily ink was applied and
squeegeed into the 'intaglio' plate. He would them thoroughly wipe
the plate with cheesecloth-like material so that the ONLY ink
remaining on the plate was in the etched lines. This plate was
placed face-up on an 'o' roller intaglio press and a damp sheet of
cotton paper was placed on top. Three different thickness felts
were placed on top of this and then run through the press. The damp
sheet, subjected to the high pressure of the 'o' roller of the press
would 'suck' the ink out of the etched linework and the result was
a thick sheet of paper with the artwork beautifully transferred from
the plate to the sheet. And this print is called an etching.

Another quickie update (both Grim Reaper and Three Stooges Kickstarter sets):  
1. Three Stooges Series Five factory set boxes are all completed and ready to go
2. All 9-card Metal Exclusive sets now have their COAs and are ready to go
3. All Series Five Film Cell Relic Cards are 75% done and soon ready to go
4. All 'bonus' promo cards and freebies are done and ready to go

[note, since I'm working on Grim Reaper and Stooges at the same time this update is identical to the update I just posted on Three Stooges Series Five]
Before some backers start thinking I flew off to the Bahamas with their money, figured it would be a good time to post an update.  
Firstly, I haven't flown off to the Bamamas -- the last 6 days I've spent 10 hours a day assembling Series Five. What's actually involved that 60 straight hours of work can't get it all done? Series Five ended up having more cards than originally figured. And while I bought a special 'chopper' that does an amazing job, I actually have to cut EACH card for the series. I'm not Topps with inhouse printing and production and bulk slicing machines, blah blah blah. To create the initial 100 boxes needed for Kickstarter backers and individual pre-orders it involves roughly 15,000 individual, precision cuts. Much of Series Four was like that as well -- ALL the 9 card subsets were cut by hand by me and it just takes 'ages'. Series Five is taking ages but I want it to be the best series I can produce and so am not rushing through anything. Sure, I could haul uncut sheets to Kinkos or Office Depot and have them bulk cut but in the past I've done that with some promo cards. And their bulk chopping is CRAP. So I'm doing it RIGHT ... and doing it right takes time.

campaign.story:
Dinosaurs Among Us...The American Alligator is a documentary that started out as a school thesis project and became much more. I started out like a lot of people... With no understanding and lots of fear about these living dinosaurs, but after working at the Gator Boys Alligator Rescue in South Florida, I have gained such a better understanding of them.
With the making of this full-length documentary I want the world to have a better understanding of their history, habits, and lives, and to debunk some of the myths that are out there. I also want to give credit to the people who risk their lives, their time, and money to help rescue these beautiful creatures from certain death. And hopefully show the world that we can coexist together.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge we face is to get the funding for this project. As much as we would like to know it all…we don’t and we need to hire the brilliant people who do. I also would like to have better equipment to help this project reach its potential. Along with permits, licensing, and the usual production costs, funding this on my own just isn’t an option. It is our goal to get this out to as many film festivals that we can and that will also cost money. This has been a very long road to get to this point and we don’t want all the hard work to be in vane. No matter the issues that come up, this project will somehow be completed. We just want it to be the best it can be.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I want to thank the people who supported me: 
Christopher Ciccotelli, Sue George, Kelly Matthews, Don Handley, Virginia Scarpino-Agosta, Kurt Kuersteiner, Blanche D’Anastasi. These FEW people donated to my Kickstarter campaign to raise funds to make my documentary “Dinosaurs Among Us…The American Alligator”. I also want to thank those of you who couldn’t donate but DID share the post to help with promoting it, and the few others who donated the rewards. Thank you guys from the bottom of my heart. It shows me who truly supported me.
I will keep updates going on our Facebook page for all those who are interested in any progress we make. Again thank you so very much for your support,

campaign.story:
"THE WORLD ENDS TOMORROW, AND YOU MAY DIE!"
For the first time in almost fifteen years, the Church of the Subgenius is returning to Florida for one fly-by-night, drug-fueled, sadomasochistic concert of epic proportions. We've lined up the theatre, the killer bands, the head launchings, the sex hurt Seminars, even the controversies and contraband! We're only missing ONE thing... YOU! (Or more importantly, your everlasting SOUL!)
Actual Poster Art
We cannot-- we WILL not-- enjoy this exorcism of conspiracy normalcy without your presence (if not in physical form, at least in a spiritual manifestation). We beg, plead, and COMMAND you to BUY YOUR TICKET NOW! (See $10 pledge.) The Church of the SubGenius was founded in 1953 by J.R. "Bob" Dobbs, the LIVING slack master and savior of Planet Earth! 
SubGeniuses are typically known as loud, boisterous trouble-makers that shift from town to town overnight seeking to plant the seed-word of "Bob" and his divine gifts, as well as scrape every pocket clean in a 100-mile radius before the cops clear them out. 
Scheduled acts to appear include: 
Room Full of Strangers
Danny Feedback and the Crack Rock Orchestra
Useless Jester
Generic Young Men
Get the Ghost
Windsor's Ghost (Payne Johnson)
AND the lovely sounds of the psychotic Dobbstown Quartet.
The event, hosted by Reverend Argus Faux and the Hypercube Media Laboratory, will be held at Space Station Orlando: 2539 Coolidge Ave. Orlando, FL 32804. For more info on this madness, please visit www.orlandodevival.com

We need to reach audiences across a vast cityscape: a world of artists, performers, actors and writers. 
We need to purchase all the food and beverage beforehand. We need to buy more art supplies to create a fantastic stage. 
We need more lasers and spotlights to attract people nearby. 
We need more money for swag and the band's traveling expenses.
We need your help, and we need it NOW!

The conspiracy will attempt to suppress news of this event. Our subgenus duty is to evangelize about it. TELL YOUR FRIENDS, Deface your Facebook, and Twitter all twits! "Give me 'Bob', or give me death!"

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When it comes to fulfillment, every project has potential obstacles, and ours is no different. Every Topps card set involves many moving parts: from production and design, to business and marketing. For Mars Attacks we have the added necessity of working with more than a hundred freelance artists.

However, as a company with more than 75 years of experience delivering high quality collectibles, as well as a pool of well-respected, veteran artists at our disposal, we have added resources that most Kickstarters don't. We will be doing everything we can to both keep this project on-schedule, as well as deliver the best, highest quality product possible. 

Our superstar illustrators are already working on new base card art, while our sketch artists are well underway drawing their allotment of cards. One of the many advantages of Kickstarter is that with a more flexible production we can give our artists even more time to produce their very best work-- for YOU!

Meanwhile our production partner (Sidekick Lab in Vermont) has already begun test printing the various card types, and has mapped out the printing and packing of the entire series to ensure we are ready to go as soon as the campaign concludes. Along with Sidekick, we have spent many months preparing for this campaign, costing out the printing, production, packing, shipping and creation of everything involved. 

But whether issues arise or not, we plan to communicate to our backers throughout the entire process and update the status of our project in real time. We hope that in addition to reassuring you of our commitment to creating the best set possible, it will give you a unique insight into the behind-the-scenes making of a Topps card series!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dinosaurs: Come play on life-sized dinosaurs deep in a jungle and experience family fun like never before! Dino Land is more amazing than anyone can imagine. It will have a prehistoric park filled with vibrant, bold, colorful dinosaurs! People of all ages will be able to bring out their inner child as they climb, slide, play, and even eat on these life-sized dinosaurs! 
Restaurant: Whether you have a carnivore or a herbivore appetite, prepare yourself for a satisfying dining experience! Dino Land's restaurant will offer mouthwatering foods in a tropical oasis environment. This is a vacation you can afford; no more spending a fortune on eating out with the family!
Skating Rink: Glide through the jungle at night, no matter what time of day it is. Dino Land's skating rink is filled with dinosaurs deep in the trees, as well as flying through the night's sky. A beautiful glow of colors glistens over the rink while enjoyable music fills the atmosphere.
Family: Dino Land's focus is creating an atmosphere where families can grow and strengthen their relationships in an amazing fun environment! Dino Land will also help fund needs and projects for the community, schools, churches and charities. 
The land purchase and construction is expected to begin in Nebraska in the Papillion/Bellevue area in June 2015 with a goal Grand Opening date of June 2016. This can only happen with the right financing, this means you! The more you give, the easier and faster Dino Land will become a reality. 
Become a Backer! Kickstarter is promoting Dino Land's Campaign. Any amount of money that you pledge will not be withdrawn from your account until May 28th 2015, and it will never be withdrawn if Dino Land does not reach its full goal of 4 million. So their is absolutely no risk in pledging today! Dino Land wants to thank our backers with a special giveaway! Please see www.dinoland.org for details! Dino Land is going to be the most exciting, out of this world experience! So please hurry, time is running out!

People who know me think I'm strong and can’t believe how far I’ve come in life. I know God is watching over me and He wants me to succeed! Dino Land isn't only going to be an amazing fun place for people to go, it's also going to be a step into a loving atmosphere. The people working to make Dino Land a reality have the biggest hearts and will do what it takes to make Dino Land a safe haven for the community!

campaign.story:
Stretch Goals Announced (click here for details)
"Many have lamented the city’s loss of culture (and the weirdness that keeps it unique), but still, artists and performers find a way to adapt. Doc Pop is one of those people. The multi-faceted artist is a creative as well as an observer, and was so inspired by the fundamentalists frequenting the Powell cable car junction, he decided to present his own doctrine: God Hates Dinosaurs." - Live 105/CBS Local
I made a comic called "God Hates Dinosaurs" that's a satirical book about how superheroes are rad and dinosaurs are bad. It's just plain silly and I'd like to give away 1,000 copies to strangers in San Francisco and beyond. Update: Now that we've reached that goal, you can help us reach the stretch goals to print an extra 666 comics and open source the project for anyone to translate/remix/distribute.
page 15, "New things are bad!"
I wrote and illustrated God Hates Dinosaurs during a consecutive 24-hour comic jam in San Francisco. It tells the story of a young child named Tim who helps a blind atheist cross the street, only to find out the blind man is actually Satan in disguise. Luckily Tim is saved by a new superhero in town, The Humanist. The two then join forces to help spread a new wave of self reliance across the world, only to discover rules are there for a reason. It's 24 pages of manic/frenzied/crazytime black and white art and delirious writing.
God Hates Dinosaurs is inspired by Chick tracts, the bizarre and unintentionally hilarious comics created by Jack T. Chick. I thought that by adding robots and superheroes, I could make something even weirder than a Chick tract.
By backing this project you can help brighten a strangers day with the Truth...about dinosaurs and robots.
page 3
page 21
Just a little about me: I've backed over 200 Kickstarter projects, helped dozens of creators with their own KS projects, and have created 2 other projects on my own. I love making public art projects like this, but I have a lot of other ongoing projects. Feel free to check out my chiptune music and my year long 3D City wiggle-photo project.
If you are a blogger or news outlet, feel free to contact me or download the God Hates Dinosaurs press kit here (filled with gifs, stills, and pages from the book).
I've received a lot of help from friends in the past and I'd love to pay-it-forward. If you ever have questions about your own projects or just want someone to look at your crowdfunding draft before you launch, please hit me up and I'll try to help you out if I can.
The Video uses these sounds from freesound: jago ini vjita by Jaturo

Risks and challenges
My goal is to keep this project as simple as possible. The books are finished, the digital copies are ready to go, and my printers are just a BART ride away. I've figured out printing and shipping costs and I think this project is as low risk as you could imagine. 

To be totally transparent, my last project was moderately successful, but my biggest rewards got lost in customs. I've ordered a second batch from the manufacturer and I'm trying to get my delayed rewards to my backers as soon as possible. That's why I wanted to keep this thing as simple as possible by locally sourcing my printing and not worrying about importing hassles.

campaign.story:
In the world of the pulp magazines, the name of Walter Baumhofer has always resonated with a solemn and respectful gravitas. His masterful cover paintings from the golden era of Dime Detective, Dime Mystery, Dime Western, Adventure, Pete Rice, Doc Savage, and The Spider were among the most iconic images in pulp art history. The design and execution of his work combined an impressive combination of sensational brushwork with a theatrical flair for composing striking scenes of intriguing villains, rugged heroes, and steadfast women. His creative ambitions elevated him from the low-paying field of the pulp magazines into the respectable and higher-paying realm of the slick magazine industry. When he quit the pulps, he left behind a legacy of innovative design and high standards that the next generation would struggle in his wake to attain. Although he is renowned for his paintings of pulp magazine covers, the actual number of years he worked in the field is but one chapter in a lifelong history of creative accomplishments. That full story has never been told—until now.
The Baumhofer book, showing the unfolded dust jacket.
Pulp and illustration art historian David Saunders has written an insightful biography, chronicling the life and work of this influential artist. This is the consummate reference book on the life of Walter Baumhofer, filled with over 300 reproductions of original art, rare proof sheets, working drawings, reference photos, as well as historic family photos. 
This book will be limited to 1000 copies. It is 224 pages, 9”x12”, full-color on premium glossy stock, hardbound with dust jacket. Every copy pre-ordered through Kickstarter will include a signed and numbered bookplate. 
By pledging through Kickstarter you will receive a signed and numbered copy of the book for only $40 delivered anywhere in the U.S. (Early Birds can get the book for only $35, if you act fast!) The regular unsigned edition available after this Kickstarter campaign ends, will cost $44.95 plus postage. 
Unlike previous titles from The Illustrated Press, this book will not be offered through Amazon, so it will never be offered at a discounted price (unless you can find a "used" copy.) If you want this book new, you will have to buy it directly from The Illustrated Press. In other words, don't worry about funding the book for $40 and then turning around and seeing it listed on Amazon later for $26. That is not going to happen. 
Check out a LOW RES preview of the book by clicking above.
   Every edition of this book sold on Kickstarter will feature a full color bookplate glued to the front endpapers, signed and numbered by David Saunders. Your number will be assigned in the order received, so pledge your support early to secure a low number! 
We're also offering a Special Edition version of the book, limited to 100 copies. These are presented in a red cloth slipcase with white stamped lettering, signed and numbered with a bookplate design unique to the Special Edition. We're also including one black and white ORIGINAL 8x10 photograph from Baumhofer's studio. This reference photograph was personally shot and developed by Baumhofer, and was part of his "morgue" of reference images that he used to create his paintings. (Every photograph is completely different; we'll be choosing the most interesting photographs to include with the book. The sample shown below indicates the general look of the photograph you will receive.) This version also ships with a copy of Illustration magazine #44, the Walter Baumhofer Special Edition, signed by David Saunders. 
The Special Edition comes in a slipcase, with a copy of Illustration #44, and an ORIGINAL b&w 8x10 reference photo.
The Special Edition features a unique book plate design.
The author David Saunders is the son of legendary illustrator Norman Saunders (the artist behind Mars Attacks, Wacky Packs, and much more). David has written two books for The Illustrated Press, the first on NORMAN SAUNDERS, and the second on H.J. WARD. He has also contributed numerous articles to Illustration magazine on such artists as Ernest Chiriacka, Rafael DeSoto, John W. Scott, Frederick Blakeslee, Rudolph Belarski, Gloria Stoll, Allen Anderson, and others. His website, www.pulpartists.com, chronicles the life and work of artists who worked for the pulp magazine industry. 
In addition to his work as an historian, David is also a fine artist with works in the collections of the Museum of Modern Art, NY; Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY; The Brooklyn Museum of Art, NY; The New Museum, NY; The Hirshhorn Museum & Sculpture Garden; and many more. 
The Illustrated Press has been publishing Illustration magazine since October of 2001, and has produced 45 issues to date. In addition, the publisher has produced monographs on the illustrators REYNOLD BROWN, NORMAN SAUNDERS, and H.J. WARD, as well as the book MASTERS OF AMERICAN ILLUSTRATION—41 ILLUSTRATORS AND HOW THEY WORKED. 
Publishing art books has become an increasingly risky business. They're complicated to assemble and expensive to make, and they can take up a lot of space in the garage when they don't sell. I want to produce the right number of copies, and  using Kickstarter enables us to gauge the demand for these kinds of books, and to adjust our print runs accordingly. By "pre-ordering" this book, you're helping to relieve some of the pressure and risk of publishing this book, and you're helping to finance the project from the ground up. Without YOUR generous support, this book will not happen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Baumhofer book is completely designed and is ready to go to press. Having already produced dozens of magazines and four hardcover books in China, there are relatively few risks associated with this project. All we need are some generous backers, and the book will be released in no time. We hope you will back our project and spread the word to other illustration fans everywhere.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
I wanted to be sure to share my latest Kickstarter project with everyone who backed The Art of Dean Cornwell... it's the second printing of Tom Lovell – Illustrator.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2096205729/tom-lovell-illustrator?ref=user_menu
Tom Lovell was one of America's greatest illustrators, and his spectacular illustration work is covered in depth in this new book (the second printing of the original release from 2016.) If you love illustration, and realistic painting, this book will astonish you.

Dear Backers,
For those of you who may not be on my regular email list, I wanted to reach out through Kickstarter to let you know that I am currenly accepting pre-orders for a spectacular new book on one of America's greatest illustrators—TOM LOVELL.
The new book is printed in FULL COLOR throughout and features over 270 illustrations. The book is 224 pages long and is filled to the brim with scores of beautiful illustrations reproduced from the original paintings and drawings, as well as rarely seen tear sheets from vintage magazines. A complete preview of the book in progress is available on the website listed below.

Dear Backers,
I hope you have enjoyed your copy of the Walter Baumhofer book! 
In case you haven't received an email from me, or seen any other updates regarding "The Golden Age" book that I recently funded on Kickstarter, I wanted to drop you a note about my latest project.

Hi Folks,
The Walter Baumhofer book has been received, and will begin shipping out on Wednesday, November 19. (I may even get a few out TODAY!) Thank you for your patience, and for your support of the project. I hope you will enjoy the book!
For those of you who are subscribers to Illustration Magazine, the new issue is also mailing out this week. And last but not least, my next book "The Golden Age" is wrapping up on Kickstarter in less than two days. I hope you'll check it out!

Dear Backers,
For anyone who may have missed my emails or Facebook posts earlier today, I wanted to spread the word about a new Kickstarter project I have launched. The next book from The Illustrated Press, to be released in March 2015 (assuming the project achieves funding!), is called "The Golden Age: Masterworks from the Golden Age of Illustration". It's a 224 page, full color hardcover book featuring the work of 154 artists. Every picture will be reproduced as a full page illustration, and every photograph is shot directly from the original artwork. I think it's a beautiful collection of images, and I hope you'll take a look...

Dear Backers,
The other day I received some sample copies of the new Walter Baumhofer book, and I think it looks great! (See photos below.) I can't wait for you to hold it in your hands.
The book is currently en route from the printer, and they tell me I'll have them in my mitts by November 10. I don't know if that number is accurate or not, but the book should be shipping sometime in mid-November. If there are any significant delays, I'll let you know ASAP, but so far things are right on schedule.

Dear Baumhofer Backers,
I have just sent out the Kickstarter "Backer Survey" to gather your shipping information for the upcoming Baumhofer book. 
The expected release will be in November, so if you are moving in the next few months, don't worry… you may always return to your Kickstarter account to update the Survey info at will.

Dear Backers,
The Baumhofer book campaign has reached a successful conclusion! Thank you all so much for your generous and enthusiastic support of this project—we couldn't have done it without you.
So what's next?

campaign.story:
Purpose
Have you ever fallen down the stairs?  Imagine looking down and seeing endless stairs.  Would you still go down the stairs?  Would you turn the lights off to avoid infinity?  "The Only Way Up is Down" is not only an infinity sculpture but a reminder that in life - sometimes you must go down to find your way up.  Help me super-size this sculpture for an Installation at The Art Place Wynwood for Miami Art Basel 2013!
Why Kickstarter?
As a Florida artist and sculptor, I have long been striving to break into the Miami art market and show my sculptures during Art Basel Miami.  I have attended this international art event for the past eight years researching how to involve my own work.  To be honest - it's expensive and usually requires gallery representation!  After many years, I finally have my work in a gallery in Miami and they are excited to showcase my life size sculpture during Miami Art Basel 2013.  This will be my first time exhibiting during Basel Miami.  I see it as my chance to go big and I need your help to make this long standing dream a reality.
This year, I became a founding co-op member of The Wynwood Warehouse Project - an exciting new opportunity developed by Danilo Gonzalez, Director of The Art Place Wynwood in Miami, FL. Since joining, my art has been displayed in the gallery for various "Second Saturday" events in the Wynwood Arts District.  My proposal to build and install the life sized "The Only Way Up is Down" infinity stairwell has been approved by The Art Place Wynwood which means I have gallery space secured during Miami Art Basel 2013.  Now, I just need to procure the funds to build the sculpture!
What am I making?
"The Only Way Up is Down" will be a life size version of my orginal 11" infinity stairwell!  The original has been shown in galleries and it evokes many reactions from "how did you do this?" to "is this thing real?".  The purpose of this Kickstarter is to raise enough funds to build the 7' (life size) infinity stairwell.  The larger version will create a more realistic illusion. I already have some experience "super sizing" my previous sculptures, but "The Only Way Up is Down" sculpture is BY FAR the most costly to complete!
The orginal size (11") "The Only Way Up is Down" which was first created to look similar to a cellar.
Top view of the 11" version without the "cellar doors".
This size is ideal for a cat to gaze downwards into infinity...hence my Kickstarter to create a size suitable for humans!
Wouldn't it be incredible to stand in front of a 7 foot sculpture and gaze downwards to infinity? That's my goal!
How will I do it?
Since the sculpture will be rather large - it needs to be built and installed on site.  That means I will have to travel from Tallahassee to Miami, and spend at least one to two weeks buying materials and constructing the infinity sculpture in The Wynwood Art Place.  A colleague will travel will me to help with the labor and construction.  
Where will the money go?
Supplies (lumber, hardware, paint, etc...) = $1,200
Two custom glass mirrors = $2,090
Packing foam = $182
Labor for 2 guys for at least 7 days = $1,600
Lodging, transport, gas, per diem = $1,200
Crating  = $120.00
Shipping = $379.00
Kickstarter fees & contingency = $800
Grand Total = $7,571....so I'm asking $7,500!
Sketches of life size version...
This was my original sketch for the life size version.
  This is the revised version to fit in the gallery. It is just as effective with one stair, but saves a lot of space.
The Rewards
I can't thank you enough for helping me!  I have created a few special rewards to show my gratitude and share some of my art.   Below are photos of some of the tangible rewards I have created!
Limited Edition Phil Gleason Magnets (pick one)
Stainless Steel Limited Edition Keychain with my Signature: produced for you using a water jet cutter!  It also serves as a bottle opener and who knows - maybe it will be worth something some day. 
2.5"x1.5" (will come with a key ring)
Limited Edition Project T-shirt:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any new project comes risks and challenges. Although I have constructed a small size version of this sculpture - making it MUCH larger brings some risk. In working with such a large mirror and piece of glass - safety is my highest concern. I am fully aware of this risk and plan to take precautionary measures to ensure the safety and security of the glass.

Another challenge is ensuring the accurate framing to effectively create the illusion and completing it in such a short amount of time. To facilitate the process, I have created this Kickstarter well in advance in hopes of purchasing all of the necessary materials to begin the development phase! This will help cut down on time once I get to Miami to construct the stairwell.

Let's say the project is funded - there will be a unique challenge of what to do with the large installation AFTER the show in Miami! If it sells, how would I transport such a large piece of work? If not, where will it go after the show? These are considerations which I am prepared to take on after the completion of the project. It may involve deconstructing the entire piece to return to Tallahassee with it or ship it to the next gallery! Hopefully, I can make a sale at Basel Miami and crate it to someone's final destination for the piece.

Lastly, a pretty big risk (which is more of a personal than financial risk) is the reality that my project may not be funded. BUT, at least I will know that I gave it my best try and will continue to support the Kickstarter community!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, Backers!
I will leave tomorrow evening for our first trip to Miami to begin building and installing the life size infinity stairwell. My friend, Joshua Cooper, will be traveling along to help with the installation. I am very excited to get on the road and actually BUILD THIS THING!!!!   A recent development with the gallery in Miami (The Art Place Wynwood) has changed the location from their small gallery to a much larger space in their Wynwood Warehouse Project space.  This exhibition will be titled "Miami Mix 2013 Art Basel Week".  I will be sure to start posting project images and continue to update you all...the final project will be on display during Art Basel which runs from December 4th - 8th.
